I decided to get a dedicated camera for my adventures, I knew I was going to buy a Nikon, and I saw this camera, looks at the specs, reviews, then I bought it! This camera takes amazing photos! Low light pictures turn out incredible, all the features are amazing, this works perfectly for what I need it for. I highly recommend this camera if you're an outdoors enthusiast.

Reviews.Title: My new toy
Reviews.Author: Madkaw
Reviews.Content: I've taken a few pictures and a few videos with it so far.  The image quality is awesome.  I have yet to take any underwater shots, but I do plan to stick in a glass of water for some creative stuff.  Then it is set to be mounted on my motorcycle for fun.

Reviews.Title: SWEET CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: Viewwords
Reviews.Content: I love this little Nikon!!  The picture quality is exceptional, the GPS feature is fun and useful, the video quality is wonderful.  It's a lot of features in a little package!!  LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, one missing part
Reviews.Author: Photoguy
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for awhile now, video and still performance is great. My only issue is the lack of a lens cap. I loaned the camera to my son and the built in lens filter came back looking like a finger print blotter.Someone, anyone, please make a lens cap that snaps on where the filter adapter is installed. Make sure it has a small lanyard so it can be attached to the neck strap lug on the lens side.

Reviews.Title: Horrible!
Reviews.Author: Long Island Dad
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when amazon had it for $199.  The feature list was what I was looking for and the Nikon name provided some confidence for quality.  Wow, what a let down.  The camera had a slew of issues:The AF was very slow and often the images were completely out of focus.The shutter lag was unbearably long.The flash recycle time was 2 to 3x as long as most cameras.The exposures were inconsistent.The GPS was completely unusable.Good luck to whoever buys this camera.  Even at under $200, it was garbage and got returned.

Reviews.Title: Only 2 uses underwater
Reviews.Author: ericm63
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my wife for our anniversary for snorkeling trip to USVI in July as camera is rated as "waterproof" to 33 feet. First day no problems, second day after diving down 10 feet to get photo of a turtle, began acting up. After about another 30 minutes the camera was a paper weight - now see similar review on Amazon - will be interesting to see Nikon's "fix"Too bad the few photos we did take were of good quality,with high res and able to zoom/crop to make appear "close" up to the fish, coral and turtles.Will be interesting to see if Amazon or Nikon will make this purchase rightAmazon Customer Service - thanks a bunch!

Reviews.Title: Great camera to compliment my SLR
Reviews.Author: Glenn W Nieciag "shotgnz"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera to take along when weather is iffy or you do not want to worry about getting it ruined.  Takes great pictures above and below water.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera.
Reviews.Author: Joshua
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift from my now wife when we first started dating. Although my original was stolen (long story, since been replaced) I have been very happy with its performance. I am a pretty outdoorsy person and it is really great to have a tough camera that you can just toss in your bag or slip in a back pocket and not have to worry about it. It holds up well, I have dropped it once or twice, usually due to excessive showing off.. Along the lines of "check out my sweet camera" followed by a toss to a rather un-expecting person who attempts to "think-fast" generally involving some sort of water hazard for extra shock when they botch the catch. It takes good quality pictures and really like the GPS geo-tagging abilities. Underwater pics turn out really well as long as the water is fairly clear, I even dropped it down and ice fishing hole and caught some fish in video mode. I don't really scuba dive, but have wore it around my neck for a full day of snorkeling going up to 15ft deep and never had an issue with it. I am more than satisfied with it as a whole, the only down side I think is the zoom capabilities but I was well aware of that before entering it into my wish list. Generally speaking whenever I find a good shot where I would like a powerful zoom I'm in a place where I would not have lugged a camera any larger or less durable than this with to begin with. So its nice to at least be able to take a picture home with me, even if the lens is smeared with mud. Plus if I ever want to go capture that perfect picture in the future I will have the exact GPS location, even the direction I was facing when i took the picture originally. All thanks to my Bad-A** water/drop proof, full HD, pocket sized, powerhouse of a camera.

Reviews.Title: Great under water Footage in Hawaii
Reviews.Author: Grace D.Bermudez
Reviews.Content: Took this Camera with me to Kauai for 3 weeks used it under water at Shark Cove and Na Pali Coast. It held up great in the salt Water, still works fine till this day. Purchased this camera because i wanted to  get some under water  shots, and was great. I'v droped it 3 or 4 times on accident while recording and didnt phase it, just kept on recording. I also purchased some extra Batteries because i knew i was going to use it everyday. Batteries held their charge for half the day, then just popped in the back-up when the first died. I recommend it to anyone who wants a good camera.Care to Check out some footage- [...]Underwater footage Nikon AW100Channel has more videos- [...]Youtube User Name- (Iezedumreb)Pros/-DURABLE-WATER PROOF-HD QUALITY FOOTAGE-NIGHT TIME LIGHTCons/-Movie light could be brighter

Reviews.Title: Truly waterproof and shockproof.
Reviews.Author: Judy McDyer
Reviews.Content: We ride a tandem bike with my husband in the front saddle and me in the back saddle.  I often I place the camera in one of the rear pockets of my husband's cycling jersey while we ride in order to place the camera in a position where it is easier for me to reach while bike riding. The last time we rode, he didn't realize that I left the camera in the back pocket of his jersey.  He put the jersey into our washing machine and only after the wash cycle was half over did we realize that our camera was missing.  We opened the washer and retrieved the camera expecting the worst.  We were both surprised when we found that the camera is still completely functional and that we couldn't even tell that it went through the wash.

Reviews.Title: My favorite Camera
Reviews.Author: JimRaynor "Vaio CW guy"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for just shy of two years as of this writing. I initially bought a refurbished unit here off of Amazon because it was $100 cheaper. The camera I received looked new and in box. I have had many Sony Cybershots only to have their lenses fail on me, we had a Canon and could never get a clear picture with it. We bought a Nikon d60 DSLR and loved the freedom and features, but found it to be too bulky for most of our activities. This Coolpix was the answer, and being waterproof it was great with kids around.I love having photos tagged with GPS. The image quality is better than any point-and-shoot that I have owned. It is fun to take the camera to the beach and act like you forgot it is around you neck when going in the water; other people look at you expecting to see you freak out, but then they freak out when you just start taking more pictures.We went to the Upper Peninsula of Michigan and had a great time. We got pictures and video of our dogs swimming from under the water. One thing the strikes me with this camera is that it is the only camera that I haven't babied and protected - yet it still looks new and works perfectly.The battery life is short when the GPS is tracking your locations. I only turn that feature on for trips and things that I want to geotag. Getting extra batteries doesn't cost much and makes it possible to always have a charge. My D60 has an amazing battery that I almost never have to charge, so that was one surprise with this camera.I don't find the menu to be difficult for the most part. There are times I can't find some features, but they aren't usually features that I use a lot. The maps are not very in depth, just land and water. It is nice to be able to see markers where all the pictures were taken.I do like that there is internal memory and that it can copy to a memory card. This is useful when I've forgotten to put a card in the camera. I just wish the memory had been larger.I have never had any trouble with this camera; with leaking or anything else. There are times when I am on the wrong settings and I get blurry pictures, but that is more user error than a camera issue. I'd like to get a second for my wife.

Reviews.Title: Best underwater, adventure camera ever.
Reviews.Author: Erin Page
Reviews.Content: Took this camera on my honeymoon cruise. Worked perfectly and never had an issue with the built in programming.I took this camera snorkeling and all the other divers were jealous! Took fantastic underwater video with sound and colorful life like photos underwater. Alot of the others had underwater cameras but some did not hold up as promised or didn't get the quality we did. This was perfect. We even banged it a few times during our ATV adventure and didn't run in to any problems.Product held up well and was a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Not the camera for me
Reviews.Author: Heather Buquet "SHOPPING MAMA"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my old Canon Powershot which I loved but I dropped and the battery compartment door wouldn't stay closed anymore.  My family had booked a cruise to Alaska and I needed a new camera so I figured this would be good since it was water proof and shock proof.  Thankfully I bought it early enough to test it out.  I was very unhappy with the quality of the pictures and was super frustrated with the fact that most of the pictures I took were blurry.  I never dropped this one and I never tried it under water so I can't comment on those features but I would not recommend this camera.  It is way over priced for its poor performance. I ended up ordering another camera for our vacation that I was very happy with. (Canon Powershot SX 500 IS 16.0 MP)

Reviews.Title: This camera leaked the first time used under water
Reviews.Author: MKS
Reviews.Content: This camera leaked immediately upon submersion. The Seller does not warrant it once you submerge it. I would seriously consider another product and I seriously question buying from The Electronics Club with this warranty practice.

Reviews.Title: Not often I review, wanted to share my experience
Reviews.Author: A. Rzadczynski "portugese_software"
Reviews.Content: While I didn't buy this camera off Amazon, after buying it locally I had an issue right out the gate.  The battery was fully charged prior to my using in the camera.  It was being used by someone when it inexplicably warned onscreen something about "Battery" before turning itself off.  The battery shouldn't have been dead as the thing wasn't even powered on but a few minutes throughout the day.  That said, it wouldn't do anything when plugged in to charge.  After going back to the local store where I'd bought it, hassling the electronics department to let me try their floor model battery just to see if it was the battery and not the unit, turned out it was the battery.  OK, so since the store wasn't about to let me swap batteries I go on amazon and order 2 replacements with some nifty external charger for like $20.  No issues there, and I'm happy again.  Fast forward a week and I'm out snorkeling with my Coolpix aw100 that according to the description on this page "Dive into 33 feet of water".  Wrong.  I was down about 15 feet in saltwater, and to be generous lets round that up to 20 even 25 feet.  Still almost 10 feet above the threshold at 25 feet, and I assure you it wasn't 25 feet deep.  Picture how long it takes to swim 5-10 feet down, and without a scuba tank picture at most DOUBLING that distance.  Unless you are a real professional, you're not going to leisurely be 25 feet underwater without a pretty decent effort.  Nevermind 33 feet.  Point being, I'm on the surface trying to figure out why the camera won't turn on and can see the LCD covered with water droplets/fog on the inside.  The battery door was securely closed so it wasn't user error, and I know it was closed because upon opening I watched water pour out and see the battery expanding inside about to explode.  I assume the saltwater neutralized the battery so it probably wouldn't have done so but in any event, there's my story.  I'm out $300-something on a camera, $20 on a pair of batteries, and $65 on the 64gb microsd card I bought that is essentially useless as well.  To get what few photos I could salvage off that microsd, I had to run a recovery software on my computer and essentially play detective for hours on end until I was able to successfully save the pictures.  Very bitter with this whole experience, stay away from this garbage camera!

Reviews.Title: I took a 4 thousand dollar trip to Machu Picchu and Camera  Sucked!
Reviews.Author: Jay Lynch
Reviews.Content: I took a 4 thousand dollar trip to Machu Picchu and Camera took approx 30 pictures and battery was exhausted! {Yes  Battery had full charge}! so I charged battery 2nd night ,all night, Camera showed full charge took 20 pics { turned camera off between pics} and battery was exhausted after approx 25 pics ! Jay

Reviews.Title: Poor product from a great camera company
Reviews.Author: Stefen J. Benincasa
Reviews.Content: Having bought two of these in the past year, and needing to return both, it's my opinion that the camera is not worth buying. I own many DSLR's from Nikon and thought a convenient point and shoot from the them would be good. Waterproof and shockproof, not so much.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera... if only it were waterproof...
Reviews.Author: JKnapper
Reviews.Content: Owned the camera for about a year.  Worked great for work, inclement weather photo taking was great.  Zoom was solid.  Image quality was good.  Battery life is tough, burns through a fully charged battery in about an hour of continuous capture.  We took in on our honeymoon to St. John USVI.  5 minutes in the ocean and the screen went black, took it out of the water and clearly the seal at the LCD had failed.  Opened the battery compartment and a tablespoon of salt water leaked out.  Didn't loose our images from the memory stick but what a disappointment, had to rely on Polaroid and Kodak disposables for the remainder of the trip.

Reviews.Title: It's not waterproof
Reviews.Author: FEDERICO LLOBET
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this item so take pictures of our family trips. We went to a children pool (2 feet deep) and tried to take pictures of my kids playing around and the lens got clouded immediately.  Don't get it near the water!!  It's not waterproof! Don't waste your money

Reviews.Title: Good, but there's a few things that could be better
Reviews.Author: M. Collins
Reviews.Content: Rugged waterproof camera that takes decent pictures. I bought this for a more portable solution than my Nikon DSLR and because it is waterproof (we were about to go on vacation to Cabo San Lucas). The picture quality is good, not as good as my DSLR--though that's to be expected--but a thousand times better than a Samsung camera that I returned a month before buying this model.There's a few things I wish it had:1) I have found in more than one place (even Nikon's website) that this camera has wifi. It does not. It has GPS, but it most definitely does not have wifi or bluetooth. That's too bad.2) Why, dear Nikon, must you force yet another battery type and cable connector on us? I'm sure the data transfer off this camera could be handled by a mini or micro USB, but no, Nikon had to go and make a dedicated cable. Grr.3) Modes: there's an Easy Auto and a Auto mode. Using the camera for a few months, I still can't tell the difference.4) Battery life is poor. I know Nikon can make a battery with tons of life. My DSLR battery lasts for weeks and hundreds of shots. Granted, it's bigger, but I think my expectations that PnS should last at least half as long are realistic.5) Battery: when it goes, it goes. One moment you'll look at the charge indicator and it will be full. The next minute, dead. This one makes me nuts. I recently returned from a trip to Mexico City. The battery, appearing fully charged, went from full to insufficient in about 4 shots. For the remainder of the day I took less quality pictures with my cell phone. This problem really irks me as it can leave one with a "brick" instead of the camera they wish they had to take decent pictures!6) The pictures are a little dull. The color range seems off and a little bit unrealistic. It's not a show stopper, but I find I have to post processing to make the pictures look more realistic. Typically a contrast adjustment is an absolute must.i was a little hard in this review for a 4-star review. I should point out that it is a nice, rugged little unit that I've fallen into the Pacific Ocean with and it has survived. In fact, it seems to work best when it's under water! Also, it's a real champion in low light. It's pretty amazing in that regard, actually.

Reviews.Title: Get the floating strap
Reviews.Author: V. Stiles
Reviews.Content: Ah... the Nikon COOLPIX AW100... our time together was short, but how I miss holding you in my hands. I got this camera to record our many days out at the rivers and lakes. It took the best pictures, great video too. 3 days later while laughing at my friend for flipping her kayak Karma herself reached down and flipped my kayak throwing the camera out of my hand. It has gone to the river camera graveyard.Pros:Easy to useExcellent picturesExcellent videoCons:Doesn't floatFYI.. If anyone finds an orange COOLPIX AW100 on the Mulberry River and the last recording was a video of someone trying to get her kayak flipped over with audio of laughter just as a tree jumps out of the water (yes, trees jump on the river) and a wave comes over the camera, please contact me.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Dan Hearn
Reviews.Content: Bought a refurbished AW100 for a trip to Belize. I knew we'd be in the water, jungles and ruins and so I chose this camera for it's versatility and durability. We took several hundred photos. At some point, when scrolling thru the images, the camera started skipping back and forth, but seemed OK other than that. When we returned home and tried to look at the pictures we had taken, we started getting an error mssg. to the effect of "file not available", then.....NOTHING. The Nikon seemed to have arbitrarily deleted all our images. I sent the memory card to FlashFixers and they were able to restore most of the photos.I checked with some tech-types and they seemed to think it was possible that the camera had a "bug" that was missed during the refurb process. I guess I shouldn't have tried to save a couple of bucks buying refurbished instead of brand new, but I think I should have been able to expect that the camera would function properly for at least a few months. The  retailer that I bought the camera from immediately exchanged the camera for another refurbished unit when I contacted them. No complaints whatsoever with them. Nikon customer service was another story. In my opinion, Nikon couldn't have cared less about the problems I experienced with their product. I e-mailed Nikon repeatedly, explaining that I thought that their refurbishing process needed some upgrading. I asked if there was any possibility of being reimbursed for the recovery of the files or if I could upgrade the replacement refurb unit for a new camera. All I got were template answers that I assume were off a screen on a bored represenitive's desk. So...all in all a bad experience for me. I ended up with a camera that I have no confidence in, and a $70 bill for restoring photos that shouldn't have been deleted to begin with. Looking at a Pentax Optio WG3.

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal service from Sunset and good performance first time used
Reviews.Author: Paul Misuraca
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera on 4-24-13 and hoped to have it by the following for a trip to the Carribean.  The following day I received a call from Sunset Electronics informing me that they didn't have the color that I ordered in stock. They asked if I would settle for a substitute color which was more expensive and were willing to let me have it for the original price, and I agreed. Somehow, even though I had chosen standard shipping, I received my camera the day after the call, which was really great considering I needed to get acquainted with the different functions before our trip the following week. Outstanding customer service!!!As far as the camera, it performed well for the week that it was used except for some fog that formed on the lens when shooting into the sun that dissapated in about fifteen minutes after shutting it off. Good underwater photo and video quality, and also for landscapes and panoramas. One thing I did note is that the placement of the lens is such that it's easy to get your finger in the frame unless you make a conscious effort to avoid this. Otherwise, so far - so good.

Reviews.Title: Leaked!
Reviews.Author: Sara Stefanski
Reviews.Content: Leaked on day 1!!! Trying to get a refund from Nikon (my return window for Amazon expired, unfortunately) and they said they will only try to 'fix' it. Horrible!!!!! Ruined my vacation in terms of underwater shots!

Reviews.Title: This camera has a systemic design flaw. DON'T buy it!
Reviews.Author: Vincent Vilcinskas
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on an Appalachian trail thru hike that I dreamed of taking for 40 years. I took 15 pictures with it in the first two days of my hike then the LCD screen went "dead". I read the net for possible solutions and discovered that other owners have the same problem!  Called Nikon. They basically say "send it in, we'll look at it." I'll miss days if not weeks of photographing my trip. This camera is flawed!  Search Nikon AW 100 LCD problems for yourself.

Reviews.Title: great under water pics
Reviews.Author: justin s
Reviews.Content: I was able to test mine out on vacation in cancun and I would recommend it to anyone.  It sure is nice to be able to keep it in your pocket while you are at a swim up bar or just going in and out of the pool.  Took great pics of ocean life while snorkling.  With the GPS on it will go through battery quicker but will still last most of the day.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: John Richmond
Reviews.Content: Never write reviews but I bought this camera to take to the Big Island and was very happy with it. It took decent pictures and videos both above ground and in the oceam and lagoons. Underwater shots were a little trickier because it is harder to hold the camera steady but many came out really well. The camera didn't leak and spent at least 6 hours in the water. We even took videos going down water slides.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX AW100 16 MP CMOS Waterproof Digital Camera with GPS and...
Reviews.Author: malberts
Reviews.Content: Great camera, but only average at best.Pros:Underwater capabilitiesThe 180 and 360 landscapes are by far the best thing about this camera.Cons:Focus is an issue. You will struggle to get kids and animals in focus in low light or artificial light.No lens cap is an issue. But it comes with a snap on adapter that allows you to buy a DSLR cap from your camera shop. MAkes a large compact camera big and impossible to fit in your pocket.Video is average, shooting anything moving it goes in an out of focus.In conclusion, This camera is an average camera, and if underwater video and photos are important I would purchase this camera. But trust me for a point and shoot this camera falls short. ITs not worth the price, but I do carry it with me on vacations for the 180 and 360 landscape function.

Reviews.Title: Great little underwater camera
Reviews.Author: J. Bidwick
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a trip to the Caribbean for my son and his family since they were avid snorklers.  This is my second NIKON underwater camera and this one is superior to others I have experienced.  It took good videos and excellent photos underwater.  There is a setting for underwater photography and if this is used it facilitates the rationing of light appropriately.  If it is not used, there is some photoshopping needed to highlight some darker photos.  This camera is steady and avoids the typical unclear or blurry photos that often occur when the camera is moved constantly.  My son took at least 7 lengthy videos underwater and fish and other objects are clear.  Photos are also clear and reproducable.On occasion I set the exposure compensation lighter to see how that faired.  It was okay but needed to be changed back when photos were taken on dry land.  If not, the photos will be light and washed out.  The settings on this camera are easy to use for me because I am comfortable with NIKON's methods for menus and toggling.  I have other NIKONs which are much more elaborate but use similar methods on the menu.  I did not use strap included with the camera because it was not recommended for use in the water.  I did use the thin one also included which fit around a wrist and could be tightened so it wouldn't slip off underwater.  Because of the excellent photos, I carry this as an additional camera to my D80 and D7000.  The only reason I didn't give this camera 5 stars is because I have not used it underwater myself and will reserve judgement until I do.  I am pleased with the videos and photos that my son took.Considering the use and my needs, this camera is more than satisfactory.  I was able to get an excellent price on Amazon for this camera, better than other sites.

Reviews.Title: Step down from other Nikons
Reviews.Author: seewhatitdoes224
Reviews.Content: Always bought Nikon cameras and have had great experiences.  My last camera was the Nikon Coolpix S8100.  That took incredible pictures but I always took it fishing and to the beach and sand got in the telescope lens and eventually it malfunctioned.  Considering that I decided I'd definitely stick with Nikon and try the AW100 so I can take it anywhere.  Here is what I've found:Pros:-Fairly small and compact.  Easy to whip out and take a picture.-Great selection of colors (although I recommend not getting camo if you plan on taking this into to woods for obvious reasons).-Although I have limited underwater use, the ones I did take looked pretty good.-Seems fairly durable so far.  Its taken a couple drops from four feet on a tennis court and held up (although video that had been recording is lost when it is dropped as the camera turns off).Cons:-Battery Life.  You need more than one battery especially on trips where you will be taking videos.-Charger.  You can't charge the battery in the camera.  This is a must for "all weather" cameras.  It at least should include a travel charger with a car charger or USB connection so you can charge it on the go.  With this camera all that's included is an external battery charger that requires an outlet.  This is a big downfall to this camera.-Images.  Although this camera takes some very good pictures, occasionally it will take ones out of focus. The same thing happened a couple times with videos.  Never had this happen with my previous Nikon S8100. I find I'm not as confident when I need to take a "must have" picture with this camera on the go.-Color. I got the Camo color because it was much cheaper on amazon than any of the other colors.  If you really plan to use this outdoors though, I'd get orange or blue but you will pay more.-Video.  Video is average to above average but the problem with it is when the camera falls the camera turns off and you lose all video you had been taking.  I took about a half hours worth of tennis video.  It took about a four foot fall and hit the court.  The camera itself was fine afterwards but it had turned off and the video was gone after the fall.  That was a bit disappointing.  Maybe I had too much confidence in its advertised "shock proofness" though. I did contact customer service to ask them if this was normal and they said after a 4 foot fall I would "have issues".  That's all they said.-Customer Service.  I really would have liked more than a short answer as to why an "all weather" camera does the above when its advertised as being "shock proof" but it is what it is.Overall: Decent camera but a step down for Nikon.  Image quality is a step down from regular cameras but that was to be expected as the lens in enclosed.  Randomly taking poor quality blurry pictures doesn't help my confidence though as I never had this happe with my previous Nikon's.  I haven't decided whether to take this one back or not.  I would take a good hard look at others before buying this one.  The battery charger is a huge issue as well with this camera for anybody that needs to charge on the run.  Good luck.

Reviews.Title: Great all around, but just minimal complaints
Reviews.Author: Dr Drew
Reviews.Content: I wanted a GREAT, RELIABLE camera for underwater and sports.  This camera so far has held its own.  I really like its design and ease of use.  I haven't yet tried it underwater, but I have read and heard that it can be really hit and miss with different cameras, and even this particular camera.  (It seems that 10% of all so-called underwater cameras from any manufacturer fails in 6ft of water, no matter how deep it says it can go.)  But I will be testing its water capabilities next week.  For now, my only complaint is the quality of its indoor photos.  They are washy and the flash is way too powerful.  I recommend using the smart camera settings (for indoor photos), rather than the default automatic camera settings.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera.
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: I just simply love it. The image quality is outstanding, video quality as well. It has great features and very well balanced colors. GPS works just great, it has even built-in quite detailed world map, so you can sort your photos by location.

Reviews.Title: Great for vacations
Reviews.Author: jacqueline-l "Jacqueline"
Reviews.Content: We've brought this camera on two vacations and it's gone snorkeling at least 7-8 times with great results. It's perfectly capable as a regular pocket sized point and shoot, takes nice video, and has decent battery life. My husband loves dropping it in the pool and saying "oh no! my camera!" (seriously, that joke never gets old). I love having a camera along that we can comfortably take on boats and to the beach and pool.

Reviews.Title: BEST CAMERA EVER!!
Reviews.Author: Derek Wellman
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera just before our family trip to Great Wolf Lodge. So needless to say we got to use the water proof durability of this product, right away. It was great, got it wet a lot. Spent time with it in the lazy river, and the hot tub. We got so many pictures of our kids playing in and around the water, that i never would have gotten with a standard camera. I love this camera and feel like for a young family on the go this is the best thing we could have bought.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Rosa Maria Rojas Romer
Reviews.Content: I'm a professional photographerand videographer and i'de been looking for a while for a pocket camera to use onvacation and camping trips. Found it. Photos are very good, RAW would have been nice though.Video quality is excelent for such a small point and shoot camera. I might even use it as a backup camera for work.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures!
Reviews.Author: J. Lowe
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my honeymoon in Aruba. All I can say is WOW! Such great pictures! We took over 1,000 pictures in a few days and about 30 min of underwater 1080p recording. I have to say that one picture was ruined by a fogged lens. The camera was in my pocket and when I took it out to take a picture of us on horseback with the coast behind us, there is nothing more than a big blob in the center of the picture due to fog. That was a major disappointment, but aside from that one mishap, it's a great camera that I would buy again. I also bought some filters that worked out really well when used right.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: meow
Reviews.Content: We got this camera before going on our cruise to the western caribbean.  We took it everywhere since it was waterproof, and light weight.  It took a lot of great pictures!  We ordered an extra battery and that worked out very well when we were on excursions and taking a lot of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Water Camera
Reviews.Author: Bobby
Reviews.Content: I love my new Nikon Underwater Camera. I used it while in Maui, Hawaii snorkeling, zip lining and para sailing. It took beautiful pictures both in the water and out. Everything was very clear even when I could not hold still. I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: thetravelingamanda
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera in dec 2011 and I've taken it to Puerto Rico, Iceland, Norway and to my friend's backyard pool. It's great. I'm clumsy so the shockproof worked for me. I've taken this camera caving and it's gone through free jumping falls and cave sludge mud and it has survived. Sure there are a couple scratches due to banging against rocks but it's pretty good. I can't complain about the quality because it's a point and shoot. I'm still getting used to some of the certain features which is appropriate lighting, but the photos come out great. Everyone that comes traveling with me loves the camera too and i've been designated the camera person since my camera is the only one that can go anywhere without being worried about damaging the camera. Quality in the product and the pictures. =D

Reviews.Title: Not working
Reviews.Author: Matiti
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my giirlfriend for her b-day and when she tried to use it it was not working well, Water got into the camera and the lens got tarnished.Now i can't return it because the return window expired a couple of weeks ago.I wold not recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Great all around point and shoot for all environments
Reviews.Author: Timothy A Rochte
Reviews.Content: I have been very pleased with the AW100 in the 6 months I've owned it. Even though there are smaller cameras out there, it is small enough to always toss in a pocket and have along. I really enjoy having the ability to not worry about the weather or location for using it. No problem going into the pool or other shallow water. (haven't tested deeper water to its rating). The water tight nature does produce an interesting side effect though. I was in humid summer weather at 400m then took a gondola up to a much cooler and higher 1800m mountain top. When there, the moisture from the air below condensed on the inside of the lens. By opening up the hatch and leaving it in the sun for a few minutes it cleared, but it probably wouldn't have happened with a 'leaky' camera.Picture quality can be stunning. Sharp, good colors, excellent low light performance. It is a PHD camera though so it can get faked out and produce mediocre pics too. But not often. I have a Canon EOS and iPhone 4 available for pictures and find myself using this one as my preferred option the majority of the time. iPhone picture quality can be similar but over a much lower range of challenges and only has a wide angle lens instead of zoom. Combine this with the ergonomics of shooting and the risk of loss and the AW100 wins out for anything other than an opportunistic snapshot.  The older Canon Rebel XT has even better optics and sensor so produces better pictures and shoots/resets instantly but involves dragging a large camera around (and can't take video) The Nikon fits right in the middle. And the AW100 turns on and shoots almost instantly which is great.I only have two real 'dings':1) The battery situation. Lifespan is adequate but not stunning. But the real problem is that the on screen indicator will show 'full' until it jumps to 'low' at which time you are about to die. The best answer is to pick up a spare battery and rotate them. Otherwise you WILL find yourself empty when you want to take a picture.  You can buy a little more time by turning off the GPS, but that's one of the cool things anyway of having the pictures geo coded automatically.2) GPS lock in time and indications. Sometimes it will lock in almost instantly (even indoors or in the city) and other times (in clear, outdoor space) it can take forever (hate to just leave camera on all the time due to #1) I have found this inconsistency even when I side load the assist file recently.

Reviews.Title: Glad i went with this one
Reviews.Author: alex
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time reading all the reviews watching the you-tube video's etc to pick the best waterproof camera for my wife's birthday. Mainly based on the amazon videos and some comments i went with this product and am glad i did. We have taken this camera to the pool, water-park, and a lake and it has been great and my wife loves it so i am happy. She says all her friends are so jealous when they see the kids underwater pictures. The build quality is good i love the nob and how it clicks so you know it is locked. The photo quality is good I'm sure you can get better but for the price and the waterproof feature it is good. We are not divers and have not taking this camera more than a few feet under water but for the average family at the pool water parks etc i can and do recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Tailgater
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with this camera. I found it a bit tedious at times with the buttons but overall love the camera. The video is very impressive and the pictures are great. I have found that the camera is quite big compared to other point and shoot cameras but I imagine that is because it can go so deep in the water.I have swam with this camera yet but I don't feel I need to worry about it breaking. I will be in Mexico in a few months and will update later.I would highly recommend this for anyone as this will now replace my current underwater camera and my regular point and shoot. Much easier to have one camera and it turned out to be a great purchase!Added:Nov 8, 2012QUALITY UNDER WATER: So I had a chance to test this one out in salt water and I must say it has continued to impressed me. The quality of the images under water is superb and even the video looked great.One down side: The one thing that I did noticed now that I have been using this camera for a few months is that it does struggle with low light. The images tend to be darker than I feel they should be. The response time with lower light can begin to get longer as well.Overall a fantastic camera for the price and a great way to have both a point and shoot and an underwater camera!

Reviews.Title: Leakage problem
Reviews.Author: djee
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for a little over 2 months.  We used the camera on our vacation and didn't have a problem with leakage.  However, the quality of the pictures was worst than my Pentax WP (when its not being used underwater).  The detail of the pictures just wasn't very good for 16mp camera even when compare to the old 5mp Pentax.A couple of month after purchase, the camera started taking in water. Didn't see any physical problems with the seal, so I don't know whats going on except that water is getting into the battery/memory compartment.  Now I need to see if I can get it repaired under warranty.

Reviews.Title: Durable, good HD video
Reviews.Author: Elle L "E"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in June 2012 for a trip to Cancun Mexico and wanted some underwater pictures in the Caribbean sea.  Camera produced very good images, a decent shutter lag, no leaking or funky things electronically.  HD was very good, had decent audio pick up as well.  I normally shoot DSLRs, D300 and D3S, so of course, for a small camera, you really can't compare to a larger sensor with that kind of pixel base, even if this is a 16MP camera.  But the colors are pretty true to life, you just can't crop too much.  I've used this camera out in sunlight, in the water, at night with fireworks, in a muddy lake, in fact, I lost it for about 10 minutes submerged in mud when my kayak tipped over and I didn't have a floater attached to it!  Definitely get one of those too.  It's a decent carry about camera, and I always have this with me when I don't have my DSLR.  Good price too.  Amazon is great as usual, delivering on time, packed well.  I've ordered tons of stuff here and really only had one package that was lost probably the only one in maybe 150 orders total.  Pretty good.  Prime membership is worth it too.

Reviews.Title: A really cool Coolpix from Nikon
Reviews.Author: Scott A. Schultz
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera primarily for traveling. I have a full-size Nikon DSLR, but I wanted a smaller "point and shoot" since we were traveling light. The reason I chose this camera specifically was be cause it has a built-in GPS which will "geotag" your pictures if you turn that feature on. By using this feature, you can view your pictures with a program such as Google's Picasa3 and it will pinpoint the location on a map where the picture was taken.As far as the picture quality, even though it has a resoultion of 16 megapixels, I would call the resulting pictures merely adequate. It will not rival the picture quality of a DSLR even if the DSLR has a lower megapixel count. This is not necessarily a negative feature, just a notice that it is adequate for what I will call "non-critical" photography.As far as the operational features, Nikon did not seem to leave anything out! There is a mode for just about every situation imaginable. There is even a pet portrait mode! If  you are taking pictures of people, it can even detect if someone blinks! For the most part, 95% of my shooting was in the Auto Mode, but occasionally I would use the Museum Mode which disables the flash.Another great feature of this camera is its ability to take HD video in 1080p (with audio of course).One of the annoyances for me is the position of the lens. The normal tendancy is to hold the camera between your thumbs and index fingers. Unfortunately, if you are not paying attention, it is easy for the middle finger of your left hand to block the lens.As for the GPS (which is the main reason I bought the camera), it did its job well. One issue is that it rarely works indoors. Another issue is that you have to give the camera adequate time to acquire the GPS signal before taking the picture. There is an icon on the screen that flashes red while it is acquiring the signal then changes to solid when it is ready. About 95% of the time, the location of the picture on the map was spot on, but there were a few cases when it was off by as much as 100-150 feet (by my estimation).This leads me to the biggest negative of this camera; battery life. When the GPS feature is on, the GPS unit is still using up the battery even when the camera is off. Even when the GPS is off, the battery is still being drained by the camera. If you put a fully charged battery in the camera and do not even take any pictures, the battery will be drained in about a week. There is ample capacity to last all day with room to spare, but if you are on vacation or will be using the camera every day, you will have to charge the battery daily. My advice is to buy extra batteries. Even though Nikon (obviously) advises against using non-OEM batteries, I bought two non-OEM batteries and a charger and they worked just fine. One advantage of the non-OEM batteries is that they are 1400mAH as opposed to the Nikon battery which is 1050mAH so I was able to get a little more use out of the camera. I also bought a charger that plugs directly into the wall socket (as opposed to the Nikon unit that has a charger and a separate power cord) to save space.The bottom line is that this is a great little camera jam-packed with tons of fearures (most of which you will probably never even use) that takes decent pictures. Be sure to spend some time with the Reference Manual (avilable online for free from Nikon) to get the most out of the AW100.

Reviews.Title: Camera works great
Reviews.Author: Christopher Dons "Chris"
Reviews.Content: This isn't an SLR camera so don't expect it to be. What does incredibly well is take great stills and video and does it just as well underwater. The auto focus setting adjusts in low light settings and the zoom (again, for a camera that goes UNDERWATER and therefore can't physically zoom closer) is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Excellent pics, horrible battery life!
Reviews.Author: Sara "Teacher"
Reviews.Content: I'm very please with the pictures and videos.  this worked great on our snorkling trips. No problems with leaks.  HOWEVER, I was NOT happy when the battery died before we were done that day.  Battery lasted about 4 hours.  I will get a spare battery before another trip, and gripe while I do so!

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!!
Reviews.Author: Zac93218
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything I expected and MORE!!! Extremely high resolution and plenty of options to get the perfect picture and multiple effects. I bought this camera for the waterproof feature because my fiance and I are avid wakeboarders and lake goers. I bought the CHUMS wrist leash floaty and it keeps the camera from sinking perfectly. The waterproof feature works great!! we jump in the water with the camera and do not have to worry about a thing. To test out the camera my fiance and I along with 2 of our friends jumped in the water in a huge circle and started taking a video. We took turns throwing the camera to each other letting camera land in the water next to us and float to the surface....no issues with the water what so ever and the video was pretty kool to seeing the camera fly through the air and land in the water then being pulled out of the water!!! Havnt messed with the GPS feature much yet but i think that will be a pretty kool feature as well. ALL in ALL i give this camera a 5 out of 5 stars!!!! a must have for avid sports goers in all genres!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Byron Goodman "goodman"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It is water proof and it takes great pictures. I am really happy with it. I wanted a rugged camera that takes great pictures. The reviews about the buttons being hard to press are wrong. I don't find any issues with them and I have large fingers.

Reviews.Title: Scuba observations
Reviews.Author: Richard W. Beck
Reviews.Content: Just used the camera for the first time on a scuba trip.  I know the Nikons well over many years, and appreciate their general features.  For scuba I noticed the following on this unit: - The battery only lasted for one dive: 30 minutes - The depth tolerance is slightly less than preferable for a beginning diver (33 feet, versus 40-ish feet).  I took a chance by going below 33 feet, and it survived.  However, I would prefer an external case that I could buy. - The flash is a disaster underwater, at least in low visibility water.  Only non-flash is acceptable.Overall the value is good, but the biggest disappointment is the battery and depth performance.  I plan to hunt for additional equipment that might overcome this . . .

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: krieger000
Reviews.Content: This camera is sufficient for hiking and other outdoor activities. It takes excellent photos and has numerous and useful tools and modes. GPS works quite well.

Reviews.Title: The best Digital/Underwater camera for the $$$
Reviews.Author: Andrew Racca "Accce"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife to take on a girls trip to the caymans.  She is lucky to get a good picture from her iPhone.  She brought back some of the best above and under water pictures I have ever seen.  I set the camera up for auto everything before giving it to her and there was not 1 bad shot out od 200 + pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great but buggy
Reviews.Author: TX2PDX
Reviews.Content: Great camera that takes even better video than pictures I think and the GPS is a nice extra. I took it on a trip and loved the rugged ability taking in and out of the water.Now for the bad ...1/2 way through the trip my screen went black and although I could view pics I had taken I couldn't take pictures. I took the battery out tried everything but nothing worked. I then threw it across the room in frustration (it is shockproof ya know) and it fixed it!! It worked great for a few days then black screen so I smacked it on my hand a few times and presto it's fixed. This occurred several more times on my 5 week trip.A women saw my camera and said she had the same one and loved it but the screen went black and she couldn't take pictures anymore and received no help from Nikon. I passed on my tough love treatment advise and hope it worked. Also several times in the water when it was cold the lens would fog up. Also when the outside air was cool (65 degrees) the LCD screen would heat up and then cause the lens to fog up. Not what you want when on top of a tropical forest zip lining and can't take pictures of that amazing place. That fix was to wait 10 minutes to defog and then take a pic then turn off the camera so it doesn't heat up. I will exchange the camera maybe I got a bad one which is a shame because it seems great.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Buc
Reviews.Content: I got this for a dive in the South China Sea. I like this camera a lot. It takes great photos and video. The large screen is great for underwater photos. I like that it saves lots of information about the photos, including aperture, exposure time etc, including longitude and latitude if GPS function is turned on. It was not as fast taking repeat photos sometime as I would have liked. I wish it could have had more actual zoom than 4x but understand the limitation due to internal lens zooming. Other than that great camera would recommend and purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Best camera
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Works awesome. Easy panorama, 1080 hd recording, super slow mo. This camera rocks.  Waterproof opens up a whole new world of pictures and videos.

Reviews.Title: easy & nice
Reviews.Author: fd
Reviews.Content: I just take a few photo, And they are great! Nice scnene mode and video modes (specially 240fps). I haven't read the manual yet, but I'm having a nice perfomance., not the GPS...I JUST TAKE 1 georreferienced photo, but don't know how. My problem.

Reviews.Title: Purchased the Nikon AW100 for my trip to Cabo, Mexico.
Reviews.Author: Weston Neuschafer
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Nikon AW100 for my recent trip to Cabo, Mexico.  I was so impressed by the quality and toughness of this camera so far.  I took it in the salty ocean, in the pools, used as a regular point and shoot, taking pictures of landscapes while our driver is going well over the speed limit. And all the pictures and videos turned out awesome.  It's funny to think that I washed my camera in the sink after every underwater or sandy use.

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Sprad75
Reviews.Content: So far the camera has been great. Will know moreLater but it seems to be a very good buy for the price

Reviews.Title: fantastic
Reviews.Author: Precious
Reviews.Content: This is my second latest Nikon Product since 2005.  My old 5200 is very tested and still working until at present but only it has a little screen on it.  And when I saw this latest product and reading the features on it, it's very convincing of buying this latest product and I am enjoying taking pictures & vedios.  I loved it and it is very easy to operate and very handy to carry with.  My intention of having this Nikon AW100 is to use for my coming trip in the Holy Land and in Europe someday & of my vacation in the Philippines my born place.  I am hoping that this will work perfectly and no trouble at all.  This is a highly recommended digital camera to other buyers, although it says, shockproof, freeze proof & water proof but bear in mind that it has limitation on every electronic products and all we have to do is to take care as much as we can as we take care ourselves so that it may last long of using and enoying it and most of all we can say, it is a worth paying product for our every moment in life to treasure with.

Reviews.Title: Mixed results
Reviews.Author: David F. Wald
Reviews.Content: Took it to the Galapagos Islands recently. You have to be careful not to block part of the lens with a finger when holding it since the lens is right at the top.  The Chums float works perfectly with this camera fitting nicely around the wrist and able to float the camera if dropped. The battery door worked perfectly to keep water out.  I don't see how anyone can have a problem with water damaging this camera so ignore all the messages here claiming that.  The camera takes nice photos in bright light and nice videos without hearing any sounds from zooming.  It's not as good in dimmer light as shutter speeds aren't kept high enough for moving objects.  The big problem I found was even though I set the ISO to AUTO, when taking photos underwater in underwater mode it didn't adjust the ISO high enough to keep high shutter speeds when pointing the camera down. As a result almost all photos of moving fish and sea lions came out blurred (not possible to get sharp shots of fast swimmers at 1/60 or 1/80 or even 1/100 sec).  It seemed to increase the ISO automatically only to 125 or 200.  My other camera I used underwater (Canon in a 10 ft max depth housing) increased ISO to very high numbers (800+) to keep shutter speed fast.  It was worth it to get non-blurred shots with that camera even though they came out grainy.  I guess the only way to get the Nikon to work well underwater with moving objects is to fix the ISO at 400 or 800.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Francisco Maldonado
Reviews.Content: I like too much this camera, its takes great pictures, the shoot is faster than other cameras the same type.Only two things in this camera could be improve: The camera parameters could be a bit more adjustable by the user, like the fp and shutter speed.  It's too automatic.The battery charger could be more portable for traveling, its come with a very long cable, is very unconfortable.

Reviews.Title: coolpix AW100
Reviews.Author: Modesto Lombardo "Modesto"
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing, take very HD pictures and very easy to use, and downloaded pictures in the pc without any problems, I had others and take more care to use this is for the modern man, always in a hurry, thanks for produce it Nikon!

Reviews.Title: Memory Card comments
Reviews.Author: Terri
Reviews.Content: For anyone else trying to find info on what type of memory card to use, it is on page 21 of the user's manual which is available through Nikon. I had trouble figuring out what memory card to buy when I ordered the camera. The short answer is an SDHC or SDXC memory card - "SPEED CLASS 6 OR HIGHER" for shooting movies. On the approved list are SanDisk, Toshiba, Panasonic, and Lexar. I just got it so my 5 stars is based on expectation. I will report back after I have had experience.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Lenore
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a year. The only complaint is that the images can be a bit overexposed, but that is probably user error. I have had it under water, it has slid down rocks, stuffed in packs and pockets and has never complained. It takes great macro shots, I love close up shots of flora. The fit and finish is good, a few scuff marks, but that just means that there has been adventure along the way. The battery life is also good, I would suggest a back up, I have a charger that I use to recharge the lithium battery. I don't have to worry about being caught in the rain and getting it wet. I would recommend this to anyone who, like me, just likes to snap pictures along the trail.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: stephen sikorski
Reviews.Content: This is a great "life-proof" camera. Have used it in the pool, lake and ocean. dropped it banged it up. does not dent or scratch easily. Takes outstanding pictures. Very easy interface and simplistic menus. If you are looking for a camera that has "beauty fix" and other add ins to make your pictures pretty, this is not your camera. If you are looking for a no shit camera that can take some punishment and provide beautiful pictures, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Best one yet
Reviews.Author: Gringo
Reviews.Content: we live on a small island south of the Bahamas, and I write a  photo-heavy blog about 2 Gringos living on a small island.in the Caribbean.  I carry a point and shoot camera in the pocket of my cargo shorts every day.  In 9 years here, I have averaged a camera a year.  I have been through most major waterproof cameras, and since we spend a lot of time on and in the water, ruggedness is critical.  I've been through Sony, Reefstar, Olympus, Pentax, and Canon cameras, and now this Nikon.It's battered, and scratched.  It's been strapped to a kite, the mast of a sailboat, and a dog.  I've been underwater with it, and literally carried it with me in a pocket along with keys, pocketknives, etc. for almost two years now.  It takes great photos, decent video, and has outstanding battery life.  If it died today, I would call it good value and buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Can't be without it
Reviews.Author: Muriah
Reviews.Content: I misplaced this camera recently for about a week and it seems like everyday is was exasperated to not be able to get the shot I could have gotten with it but couldn't get with either my DSLR, Nikon 700, or with my very good and handy compact Canon S95. I bought this camera mainly to use when I didn't dare take one of the other cameras out in so much water. It is even nice not to have to be concerned about the rain, or the wet updraft from a waterfall, let alone at the beach, the river, the ocean, kayaking, rock terrain, sand, dusty riding or hiking. Yes the lens stays behind it protective glass that is itself quite will protected by the frame protruding just adequately beyond it. The other main attraction was the dropability. I was impressed by the shock-resistant aspect. I brag that I can drop it about the distance of my height onto any surface. But I can't get myself to intentionally do that. Still. I feel confident of its durability. I am also glad to have the GPS onboard. When I was considering ordering it, I was concerned about whether the resolution would be satisfactory, so, I chose to buy a refurbished one. The warrantee sounded good enough to take a chance. If I had known how much I was going to be using it and enjoying it, I would have bought the brand new one instead. But, I am very pleased with this refurbished one. No problem! One of the reasons that I can hardly stand to not have it at hand at all times is because it is so easy to take a really close shot. I am a beekeeper and I have been trying to get close-ups of the bees with the other two cameras and haven't been able to do with them what I can do with this one. The resolution isn't as good as I would like to be able to get eventually, but it is much better than anything that I have gotten at the beehive previously and the images that I send to the newspaper look good in print. This is the third water camera that I have gotten, and by far the best so far. I am very glad to have this at hand. Oh, and by the way, almost every time I open and close the water-tight door to the battery and SD card, I realize how much I appreciate the technology of that door and its latch and remember that comment about one of the reviews that criticized the latch as overly complicated and difficult to use. I get a really satisfied feeling from closing this particular latch that seems to have the feel of closing a submarine hatch. And opening the latch with only one hand is a skill that is pleasing to be a master of and takes little effort in accomplishing. And yes, if you guessed, I relocated the missing camera in the pocket of my beekeeping jacket. Now to get some close-ups of the kittens that are just beginning to get a little tiny bit of their eyes open. Of course, I can't get quite as close to them as I get to the honeybees that I can be almost touching with the lens and fill the frame with the bee and get fairly good focus and detail. Good enough for most uses, at a price that you wouldn't expect to be getting gallery quality, anyway. Yes, I did get the orange face. Sometimes I am really glad when it is so easy to find. In the beginning, sometimes I couldn't find it because I didn't see any orange face anywhere. That is when I learned to always set it monitor down. That side is all black. I like the looks of the black better, but the orange is handy and it is good for me to set the monitor face down to protect it from anything damaging it from above. Oh, and I really like how well it rides with me when the strap is around my neck. Excellent that it wears like a necklace, secured at with each end of the strap at a side of the camera instead of the wrist strap kind of tether. It is so easy to wear and to just lift and shoot. Easiest of any compact camera that I have ever used. It is when I am wearing it, though, that I would prefer that it had a the dignity of a black face. But, such a good image buddy, I can't complain. If you get one, I hope that you enjoy it at least as much.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: C. Garalis "Charlie Garalis"
Reviews.Content: This is my second water proof camera.  My first one wasn't very waterproof.  But this Nikon is doing a great job.  Great pics and great videos too.  I ride a motorcycle and often (more than I care for) get caught in the rain.  I don't scurry to put away the camera.  It's still working like a champ.  I also took it to he beach and went swimming with it... all good.  Just be sure to follow the instructions. If it gets dirty or in salt water rinse it off thoroughly and THEN dry it completely before you open it (I let is sit for a few hours after getting wet before I open it.).  Be sure the gasket around the battery compartment is clean.  If it's not clean and smooth water will get in.. then you can just throw the camera away.

Reviews.Title: Water proof, freeze proof, shockproof but not scratch proof
Reviews.Author: Rene Campos
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 2 years ago, I loved it and still love it, I take it to every vacation trip I do that I know there will be water involved. I have scuba dived with it 35 to 40 ft and works perfectly. I accidentally dropped it from 2 feet into rocks. It just scratched a little bit the metal paint but, it still works really well and battery will last a full day of use.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: J. Kittel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this camera as a gift for our son who was serving in Kuwait.  He wanted a camera that could withstand harsh conditions, including sand storms.  This camera has fit the bill.  My husband and I even took it to Hawaii to use while snorkeling since it is waterproof.  We had no problems with the camera and it took great underwater pictures.  I did get the warranty because of some of the reviews, but have never had to use it.

Reviews.Title: Ideal Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: Richard K Wong
Reviews.Content: I like to be able to take a camera to the beach for snorkeling.  Had a Nikon S7c and was able to get a waterproof case to go with it.  But it made the contraption bulky and somewhat hard to use.  The AW100 is more compact, easier to use and waterproof, cold proof, drop resistant, etc..  There are other cameras that have those features.  But the clincher for me was the filter adaptor accessory.  This accessory made it possible for me to add a polarizer to this compact point and shoot to handle glare and higher contrast situations.  Wish I had had this arrangement when I was backpacking in the Rockies.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: D. Faulkner
Reviews.Content: It holds charge well, has a fast shutter for a point and shoot. Nice effects.  Waterproof-shockproof-but not sand proof.  Be care with this thing on the beach.  We took it to Pictured rocks and the photos are great, but if you get sand in the navigation controls its will mess with the controls until you clean it out.3 stars for poor menu setup, its a pain trying to find the menues since the menues are contextual based on where you are in the camera.  Sand is a problem for this camera and since it is market as a outdoor takes abuse camera sand should have been more of the equation than it was.Photos are clear and the panorama feature is really cool, but my cellphone can do that now.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing little camera.  I have higher end cameras too and this little thing continues to impress me.  When you can't lug the big camera's with you, this little thing will amaze you.  I have been fairly abusive to it and it is holding up perfectly.

Reviews.Title: worked great!
Reviews.Author: Denisha C. Edmonds
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about this camera based on a few previous reviews regarding taking it into the water and then it ceasing to work.  i took my new underwater camera to the waterpark and had it completely submerged in the pool.  The pictures came out clear and it never stopped working.  The pics under and above water were very clear and i have no complaints.  I'm not sure if the other reviewers followed the directions for 'cleaning' the camera after using it underwater, but it seems that if those directions are followed there should be no issues.

Reviews.Title: MY MOST-USED CAMERA LATELY
Reviews.Author: P. Centeno
Reviews.Content: I got this one to keep in the car and for trips when we take photos of waterfalls or in the rain or snow or near a lake or in a boat.  Waterproofness was what I was lacking in my large, heavy Canon SLRs with interchangeable lenses.  This one's lens is built-in, so I don't worry about water or dust getting inside while I'm using it.  I don't usually drop my equipment, but if I should happen to slip, it has some measure of protection against the shock of falling, even if I don't.  I liked that it was a black color that didn't scream "waterproof" like some bright yellow camera would.  I still haven't taken it into a pool, but it survived big splashes on an airboat recently.  It's so light, I keep it around my neck on a car or bus trip and thus take some quick shots of local color along the road that others who keep their equipment safely in their camera bags miss out on.  As they say, the best camera is the one you have along with you.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, Lousy Proprietary Battery
Reviews.Author: JD Douglas
Reviews.Content: Bought this about a year and a half ago. Has some great features, takes nices pictures, looks good, sturdy design, decent accessories offered. The battery however died on me after only charging to capacity a few times. Have contacted Nikon about it, not yet received any word back. Will update review if/when I do. Overall a very good point and shoot camera that is built to survive drops  spills and submersion. Would reccommend getting a lense cover and extended warranty though. Its a bit expensive, but still nice. Worthiness of price TBD by service offered, by features though would says Yes.

Reviews.Title: A great waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: comikaze96
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything it should as a point and shoot. It doesn't take the best pics in the world but does great to be a tough camera. The underwater settings are great. Even going down a water slide it takes great video.  Still loving it two years later.

Reviews.Title: Rugged, but poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: I have tried a few waterproof cameras, and they all share something in common - subpar picture quality. This is a tough little camera and has some really nice features like GPS and Wifi and a very fast response when you press the shutter button, but I have a very hard time getting a quality picture. In anything other than ideal lighting conditions, or with any motion at all, the pics are always blurry and just generally disappointing. And the other waterproof cameras I've tried suffer similar problems compared to other quality traditional point and shoot cameras.So unless you REALLY need an indestructible camera, I recommend a traditional one for better photo quality.

Reviews.Title: Great idea but...
Reviews.Author: Kugelspritzer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I've had several Nikons in the past and they have all worked flawlessly.  Not the case with this camera.  It wouldn't power up when I got it.  I made sure the battery was charged fully, tried it again, nothing.  I was not foiled by its refusal to submit to my commands so easy however, and I continued to remove the battery and push the power button until... It came on!  I thought maybe I could work with it, but alas, the next time I attempted to power it up, same thing. After several more attempts, I came to the conclusion it was never going to work and as much as I hate to I was going to have to send it back. Praise be to AMAZON... I was able to send it back with no hassle what so ever.  I then read others reviews of this camera and decided to go with thePamasonic Lumix DMC-TS5A and couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Camera died within a year
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: After about a year of use, this camera died.  I never took it underwater but it did get wet on my kayak trips so I guess the underwater claims are not that reliable.  My second Nikon Coolpix and probably my last.  When the camera worked, the picture and video quality was good.

Reviews.Title: Nice Results
Reviews.Author: Philip Welch
Reviews.Content: Very nice photos and videos including underwater.  It has way too many features than really needed.  I recommend it for anyone looking for a water proof camera.

Reviews.Title: The best compact camera I have ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Gordon
Reviews.Content: The best compact camera I have ever owned.  Excellent photo quality.  Waterproof, shockproof and dustproof to reasonable standards.  Some of the settings are overkill for what I am using it for.  I can bring it with me on my moutain bike and not worry about breaking it.

Reviews.Title: Good waterproof camera, but bad general camera
Reviews.Author: Rodan
Reviews.Content: I am a professional photographer, with a rather substantial array of Nikon cameras and lenses.  I like to take a point and shoot on my travels (or to events) to grab the occasional shot when I'm not carrying my camera gear.  I had a great Canon PowerShot SD-950, which was small and took great pix, but it died during a recent trip.  After considerable investigation, I got the Coolpix AW100, since it was both small/light and waterproof.  It also had GPS, which was an added bonus.On the positive side, this is a very small camera, with a 10mp sensor that shoots full HD video.  Really terrific in a small package.This camera has several major drawbacks.  Principle among them is the poor quality shadow detail.  Pictures are just not very good - something I would not expect in a Nikon camera (even a point and shoot).  The image quality is quite unacceptable to me.  Granted that I am picky, but other point and shoots seem to have better image quality.Secondly, this camera a very slow from the time you press the shutter until the image is captured.  This is especially true on flash mode.  Very annoying.  And, if you hold the shutter down in low light, but the camera decides it doesn't need a flash, it will capture multiple images.In flash mode, the camera seems to overexpose all pictures.  You can compensate for this using the manual exposure adjustment.  But you have to remember to do that each time you turn the camera on.  Sort of defeats the concept of point and shoot.And lastly, the battery life is pretty poor.  Probably due to the GPS to some degree.  (On my Nikon D4, adding the GPS attachment cuts the battery life in half or more.)If you really need a waterproof camera, this might be a good choice.  But if you want an all-around point and shoot, pick a different one.  I just bought the Sony Cybershot RX100M2.  I'll post a review soon.

Reviews.Title: Water vacation necessity
Reviews.Author: FeliniVega
Reviews.Content: For an inexpensive camera, it takes wonderful underwater pictures. It survives the bumps and the body is securely locked and protected.  I compared features with other similar cameras and this really is a good purchase. On a recent sailing/snorkeling trip, there were 3 of these cameras in our group of 6.  It is easy to download photos.

Reviews.Title: Works as described
Reviews.Author: PR from Colorado
Reviews.Content: I had this camera in the pool. in the ocean, in the snow and in the pouring rain, in addition to nice weather from real cold to 115F heat. It never skipped a beat. Color rendition is classic Nikon, on the simpler Nikon scale I'd say, meaning bright and saturated like most consumer cameras. GPS function is placed in a menu that is so un-intuitively hidden that I ended up actually looking through the manual to find where it was. Plus it is disabled by default - duh, Nikon!Overall it is well worth having to not have to worry about it getting wet if you are fishing or hunting, or outdoors for other activities. I think this would be perfect for kayakers and white water rafting.I own and routinely use 4 DSLRs and 5 compacts, and this one has proven well worth its keep. No, it will not give you what a DSLR with good lenses can (at twenty times the price), but it will give you plenty to be very useful.

Reviews.Title: Splashproof but definately not waterproof!
Reviews.Author: C.W.
Reviews.Content: We purchased this 'waterproof' camera a year and a half ago so that we could take it to the beach and take some underwater shots.  Until recently the camera had only been splashed with water.  It seemed to hold up to this fine.  I thought the quality of pictures outside was average but not as good as a canon powershot we use in the same price range.  Indoors the photo quality was typically blurred, over / underexposed, and very inconsistent.  Our canon powershot outperformed in this area too.Perhaps the above could be attributed to not spending enough time to figure out the optimal settings or simply me not using the camera effectively...Then, several days ago I finally tried some underwater shots.  I was no deeper than 5 feet below the surface of the water.  I took 4 shots and then the camera stopped working... Afterwards I dried the camera giving it time to air dry for a while as well.  I opened the battery chamber and there was a small amount of water that had leaked in.  Apparently it was enough to fry the camera.  I checked the seal around the edges and there was absolutely no sign of dirt.Awful camera, waste of $300, and the last time I ever consider buying a Nikon.If you buy this camera, take it into the water right away to see if it leaks.  If it does I believe Amazon will take it back withing 30 days.  Or just find another waterproof camera option.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Takes OK pictures, but after our trip to Hawaii it doesn't turn on.  The top light goes on, but not the LCD screen.  Sending it back to Nikon for repair, but for a nine-month-old camera, that earns it a 1-star review.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Photos
Reviews.Author: Stasia Nielsen "tiastasia"
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately you will not be getting a very technical review from me on this camera.  I am not a technical type of person.  I am a mom of 6 and one is special needs.  When I bought this camera I was running an orphanage and a shelter for women and children in the mountains of Mexico.  I wanted an easy to use, waterproof camera that would communicate in pictures the work we were doing.  I needed a shock resistant and child proof type camera.  I found it all in this little guy.  I have had it for nearly a year and a half and the pictures are absolutely breathtaking.  It is easy for me to use, but a camera techie could get even better photos and videos out of it than I could I am sure.  It is compact as well.  I really love it.  We have dropped it in sea water, and dirt and it continues to take great photos and videos.  Super easy to use, which is what I need.  My husband IS a techie and went and bought an expensive camera with all the little gadgets.  I have to admit it takes great photos, but not SO much better than this Nikon.  As a matter of fact when we need a photo quick he runs for mine because he does not have to wait, or set it up.  I give this camera a HIGH 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Warning!  Do not get this camera wet!!
Reviews.Author: jaanthb
Reviews.Content: Pros:This camera is easy to use and takes fantastic pictures.  It does allow a little too much light in on daytime exposures, however it is easy to adjust the settings to offset that dilema.Cons:The microphone pics up any trace amount of wind and distorts the audio.This camera is not waterproof.  If this is your primary camera that you are using for vacation purposes, it will ruin your vacation.

Reviews.Title: Good Pictures but not very sturdy
Reviews.Author: Jean Marie Galang
Reviews.Content: I am already sending this camera to Nikon for a second fix.  First, I dropped the camera about 4 feet and the LCD screen cracked. Not in the middle but coming from the upper corner of the screen.  The camera is shockproof at 5ft. Second, the camera is waterproof for 33ft, I used it for snorkeling and did not dive and it won't turn on.

Reviews.Title: A great little camera
Reviews.Author: Dario Carrera
Reviews.Content: Yes there are better cameras out there, but the AW100 has taken everthing from dorps, to water submerssion for hours, pouring rain, dusty trails and it is still like new.  The focus is moody sometimes, but its a great all aound little camera.

Reviews.Title: GZ
Reviews.Author: zabi
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this camera!!!!  It is not designed for continuous water submersion as the seal design is just a very thin rubber pad to protect your battery, memory stick, and internal parts of the camera.  The seal loses some elasticity over time and the hinge and locking mechanism design are not durable for longer term active use in water.  My camera picked up moisture, then water, and failed within 11 months.  I am very disappointed with this product, especially based on the price.

Reviews.Title: Goes deeper than listed (oops!)
Reviews.Author: Alice Thomas-Smyth
Reviews.Content: I was debating between this camera and another waterproof that went deeper but ended up with this one. Silly me, when I went diving I forgot this went only to 30ft and took it deeper (yes, I know it says right on the casing how deep it goes, but I just assumed I was remembering correctly). Anyways, I took this puppy down to 60 ft once and to 45ish a few other times. Thankfully, it is extremely well built, and there was no water damage!
