Obviously buttons stopped working at that kind of pressure and there was a little warping of the screen but once at surface that disappeared. At 40 it was still working and taking beautiful shots (just required a bit more pressure on the buttons). S this thing is very well built.Only wish that there was some way to adjust the focus, but so far I haven't figured out how to manually select an object for focus. At any rate is takes beautiful pictures in/out of water, and the geotagging function let me use it to make a hiking field guide, extremely precise locations!

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: J. Buss
Reviews.Content: Worked well underwater, GPS is slow but works and the world map is pretty cool.  Love how rugged it is.

Reviews.Title: Worth it!
Reviews.Author: jpt
Reviews.Content: The price was right. took great pictures underwater. Although, it is not good underwater in dark caves, unless you are recording video. For some reason pictures in the dark were tracing. However, the video feature worked in that setting and I captured some sweet footage!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for snorkeling!
Reviews.Author: Lizzie S.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my trip to Maui. It works well with snorkeling-- I did not dare to bring it with my to my scuba diving trips for fear that the depth may exceed its pressure limit. The pictures came out beautifully. Compared with its performance underwater, this camera does not impress me during my hiking trip as it twists the figures at the corner of the picture (I guess it could be because of the lens deficiency). But overall, this camera served its purpose well.

Reviews.Title: Love it - takes incredible pictures
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: I have a professional Nikon - which I never take anymore as this one takes unbelievable pictures and you can put it in your pocket. Well we are also into boating and I wouldn't want to destroy an expensive camera. This is a must for anybody who loves water!

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: L. Adams "Loving Mom"
Reviews.Content: Takes decent pictures, decent color, decent image clarity.  Very durable and great for water activities and for pictures in the water.

Reviews.Title: Died in the Water the First Day
Reviews.Author: T. C. Geis "drgeis"
Reviews.Content: Looked at lots of reviews before deciding on the Nikon (professional ones on the web, user reviews here on Amazon, etc).Lots of features I liked swayed me to the Nikon, but to make it short - I can not recommend it.I was very cautious to follow care instructions when in the water with it, but it still died the second time I turned it on there.In Hawaii...snorkeling a reef...where sea turtles hang out.....Bummer.Fortunately, I brought our other water-resistant camera: Olympus Tough TG-1 - This was ITS first real water test also (we've brought it snowboarding several times) and it passed fine. Even had it out with me surfing in chest-high waves. No prob.So maybe go Olympus.By the way - the Chums Waterproof Camera Float was GREAT.BOTH cameras stayed up in the water with it.http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003CK10DG/ref=oh_details_o07_s00_i02?ie=UTF8&psc;=1

Reviews.Title: Awesome underwater camera!
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I bought this for our trip to Discovery Cove and am so glad I did!  The colors it captured under water were amazing!  The video under water was also excellent!  I primarily bought it for underwater pictures, but since it was the only camera we brought to Florida it was used in all settings.  It takes such clear, crisp pictures all around and will definitely be my go to camera from now on.

Reviews.Title: Lens condensation blurs photos
Reviews.Author: R. Waddell
Reviews.Content: I purchase this camera 9/1/2012 because I wanted a camera to take with me while boating. It takes nice pictures at first, but after getting splashed a few times it gets condensation on the lens that will either leave images foggy, or leave them with fog spots. It is frustrating as there is no water getting into the camera. Perhaps it is the change of temperature from cold water and warm weather, but after seeing other reviews it seems like others experience the same issue without splashing the camera.

Reviews.Title: Name brand?
Reviews.Author: Bob Hoang
Reviews.Content: You bought it because it is the name brand "Nikon" it turns out to be not a very good in picture quality.  I am not happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Very slow write speed. Not good for apnea underwater shooting
Reviews.Author: Stefano Giovannini
Reviews.Content: Slow, slow write speed to class 6 SD card. I can slowly count to 9 or 10 before I can take another shot. I am using it for shooting underwater in apnea. Means that it takes 30 seconds to take 3 shot if not more. It is not great to wait that long while you are maybe 5m/17 ft underwater holding your breath. last year i used a Canon Elph with a cheap Canon enclosure. better quality shots and faster, But was not waterproof to 10 m/ 33 ft deep. It is not a camera for shooting underwater. Today I was in Akumal Mexico, Sea turtles do not wait. I wanted to dive and take 5 / 6 shots in 30 / 40 seconds underwater. Felt like an eternity and the turtles move so do the fish.The GPS is great. gets the signal pretty fast and I can copy and paste the GPS metadata to my DSLR shots. It also shows where you are on the map.Other reviews covered other aspects. I wish I had known about the write to card crawl. It is 2013 not 2004.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but lens condensation is annoying
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews, I bought the Nikon coolpix AW100 camera and took it to a trip in a tropical area. I was disappointed when I lost many scenic pictures and video moments due to lens condensations.  At times it was worst then the fog at Golden Gate bridge. It took more than 15 minutes before the condensation cleared after turning it off and pointing the lens to the sun.  I thought it was due to the heat and humidity, but the same happened under water and it was not because it leaked.  My guess is because it (the battery or memory chip) overheats. The recommendation I received from Nikon is to open the battery & memory compartment to clear the condensation but you certainly do not want to do that under water or when the camera is wet. Other than that the camera is functional but responds very slowly under low light (even on a fully charged battery). In other words if you expected to take picture when the groom kissed the bride, oops it's too late.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera above and below the surface
Reviews.Author: Jason J.
Reviews.Content: We picked this camera up 5 months ago and have given it a good water workout. We use it on boats, in the water and at the beach. The pictures and movies look great, even when taken transitioning between under and above water. Underwater use has principally been snorkeling, taking it to about 8-10 feet, and the occasional fall off the boat. The GPS tracks pretty accurately above water, but no surprise - it doesn't carry the signal below water.Care for the camera is pretty easy: per the instructions, after we've been in the water/ocean, we set the camera in a bowl of tap water for about 10 minutes. After soaking, we lay it out to dry for a while and wipe it down before opening the SD card access. So far, we've found no water inside the camera's battery/SD card enclosure.Great performance from a multi-use camera.

Reviews.Title: Quick snapshots
Reviews.Author: victoria
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our trip to Ireland and I am very pleased. It has a function that cuts of hand shaking and I love it since I have tremors. My husband used it more than me but he was able to get some great pictures of the country side. I would recommend this camera to any one. I love Nikon products.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jrgmodelo
Reviews.Content: Clear pictures above and underwater. Great functionality and perfect choice as a vacation camera. I would recommend this to other buyers.

Reviews.Title: Camera is great, but...
Reviews.Author: Troy
Reviews.Content: The camera was everything I was looking for, especially the built in GPS.  However, I am two weeks into a six week trip in Africa and the battery charger quit working!  Im not exactly the happiest customer at the moment..

Reviews.Title: Waterprooft???....so why it fails the first time i use it in water???
Reviews.Author: Mario Anton
Reviews.Content: It has been a year since i got this camera and I really don't have anything bad to say about it while I have used on land. A couple of weeks ago I used it for the first time under water and for my surprise it stopped working after a while. When I got out of the water I checked it and found out it has a little bit of water inside. The camera never turn on again. I just have to say I'm very disappointed with this outcome. Also, I was checking the seller page and they  are offering a leakage insurance which I think is a fraud since the camera allegedly is supposed to be WATERPROOF AND IMPACT RESISTANT.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Bolow
Reviews.Content: This is my third Nikon Coolpix.  Don't get me wrong it has nothing to do with the camera being defective, I still have mine and use it all the time.  The other two were gifts for my sister and dad.  I guess you can say we are a Nikon family everyone love their respective model and still has/uses them.  Even my dad who is really bad with technical things had no problem using this camera and transferring photos to his PC.  In addition, the software the camera uses is really easy to install and use.

Reviews.Title: The best point-and-shoot I've owned
Reviews.Author: Jane
Reviews.Content: Basically, the pictures come out really crisp and clear. It adjusts for low lighting with longer exposure time and it really is waterproof. I was really close to a waterfall and the camera got pretty soaked and it works just fine. The really cool thing is it has and internal memory card, very same amount of space, but nevertheless if you forget your SD card in the computer or something, you can take a good amount of pictures without it. It does a really good job at focusing really quickly too, so you can snap the picture pretty quick. So far, I have no complaints. Great purchase at under $200. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: nice camera, but one down side
Reviews.Author: L. Day
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera--great photo quality, very easy to slip in a pocket and go. It took very nice pics--both on land and worked well in the water (playing in the surf, snorkeling, nothing too deep). The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is there seems to be a problem with water leaking between the layers of the lcd display. It doesn't affect the lens or pictures, but does show up as bubbles or fog on the viewer. Amazon replaced the first one (it happened within a month of purchase), but the second one also seems to have a similar problem. But it's still a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Convenience
Reviews.Author: Jim Lornklang
Reviews.Content: This is perfect for my motorcycle trips, marathon runs, and daily quick picture taking.  After buying this, I rarely use my Nikon SLR

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Meg
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for myself and now just bought another one for my parents. It's a great camera! It works well underwater and is great out of water too!

Reviews.Title: Terrific camera
Reviews.Author: Cheryl L Trobee
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a friend who is currently deployed to a very hot, rugged and sandy place. I have heard that the camera is perfect in size, durability and quality and the recipient is very pleased with the pictures taken. The camera was received in a very timely manner and I am very pleased with the purchase.  I would highly recommend both the vendor and the product.

Reviews.Title: My Nikon AW100 paperweight
Reviews.Author: Mark from SoCal
Reviews.Content: I bought my Nikon AW100 in August and tested it on land right away.  The photos were only Okay but I was mainly buying it for underwater use.The camera worked fine when I snorkeled in September.The first time I took it underwater in May, the LCD screen stopped working and never came back on during my 10-day trip.I had used the camera less than a total of 10 hours and followed the care instructions to the letter and ended up with a paperweight.Based on what I have read here, I dread trying to get Nikon to repair it under warranty.  And even if it is repaired, I wouldn't trust it again.

Reviews.Title: Above and beyond
Reviews.Author: rchusker
Reviews.Content: This camera has so many features I still have yet to try them all. Just in case you get it wet or want to take some sweet underwater shots it will! Very rugged design and I expect it will do whatever I throw at it. I am impressed so far!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: amazing camera. This camera is very rugged and just was water and weather proof as it advertises. I've taken it Snorkeling, skiing and hiking. I've dropped it and its taken several tumble with me and with only minor scratches to show.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Branden Kern
Reviews.Content: Good pics and I abuse this thing rock climbing, kayaking, hiking, and fishing. Had it under water many times, even in cold water! Would buy similar camera again!!!

Reviews.Title: Came on time and works great!
Reviews.Author: Ashton
Reviews.Content: It came in on time or before and with all necessary equipment. Works great and i immediately had the urge to put it under water and it worked great. I am very pleased with the camera so far. Havent put it through much rigorous tests though yet.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: Bill Lundgren
Reviews.Content: The Nikon COOLPIX AW100 was a fallback position when my research into underwater camera housings for my Nikon D200 found prices at 3x what I paid for the camera body alone. I didn't want another camera, although the idea of a point-and-shoot other than my smartphone did appeal to me.This camera did not disappoint. It has many of the same features as my D200 at double the resolution. Besides waterproof, it's shockproof, freezeproof, and sandproof - something I can't say about the D200.I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone no matter what they need a camera to do.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for what we do.
Reviews.Author: dryBgerG
Reviews.Content: I have 2 of these Nikon AW100 cameras one orange and one camouflage. I have taken over 10,000 photos with these and have had absolutely no problems. I was going through about 5 Sony Cyber-Shots a year from the dust and rain, since switching to these have had absolutely no issues.Takes great photos. Has an abundance of options. I'm very pleased with these cameras especially with the abuse we put them through.

Reviews.Title: Good overall
Reviews.Author: Douglas Basballe
Reviews.Content: I have had a chance to shoot several hundred pictures and videos through this camera.  Most of the pictures taken have been crystal clear and excellent color.  I was absolutely amazed at the quality of the video this is able to shoot as well.  The video is amazingly sharp, although the audio is not very tightly focused on where the video is being shot.The only pictures I have had trouble with are inside pics with no flash - I haven't always been happy with the color reproduction.I have not had a chance to try to waterproof feature yet, although I am looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: Amateur photographer but great for what I need
Reviews.Author: Nicole Warnek
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a camera to take on camping and fishing trips. This one looked rugged enough to fit the bill. I was shocked by the quality of pictures it takes, both under water and out of water. The view screen is huge. So happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Broke after a few uses
Reviews.Author: Xiaoyun Zhang
Reviews.Content: Really wanted to like it and for it to work but to no avail. I bought it for my Caribbean vacation and used it a few times before leaving and it worked fine. Used it a few times in the pool, and still worked ok. When I took it out on a cruise it just died- the camera would still turn on but the screen on the back was black and it would not take pictures. Now sometimes it will turn on and work for some time but then at points will end up not working. It seems like something is just loose inside the camera- the technology is just not there yet. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: First use it leaked and the screen stopped working
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Kordash
Reviews.Content: I used this for the first time on vacation this past week. It leaked, and then the screen on the back stopped working! I am going to go back to using my Canon waterproof, it was much much better.DO NOT BUY THIS.

Reviews.Title: good video, horrible snap shots
Reviews.Author: Krista "KS"
Reviews.Content: I am a photographer and bought this for my husband to use on trips or to use when we were around water so I wouldn't ruin my good camera.  I thought for the price and the reviews that it would be great.  I have such a hard time getting a clear picture especially indoors.  I think my phone is comparable to the quality which is not good at all.  The GPS feature is not accurate and uses the battery quick.I would not recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Had it, returned it
Reviews.Author: R. Kyle
Reviews.Content: My husband purchased this camera recently to be a carry about camera when he didn't want to take his DSLR with him.  He has been in photography for many years and has used many cameras but this is one camera he did not like and had a very difficult time controlling.Even with IS the images were blurry and out-of-focus.  He worked to overcome things the camera was wanting to do and he never did get the auto-focus lamp to shut off completely, which is sometimes required when doing available light or night photography.In the end he returned the camera within 24 hours of purchasing it.Before anyone jumps on him, the day before he used a 5 year old Canon SX110 compact camera with no issue in a dimly lit building taking photos of a cat show and had no issues with that camera.  Using the Nikon CoolPix AW100 though is a much different story.What he said is the camera is good for outdoor photography and anyone who does any rafting, skiing (water or snow), or needs a rugged camera may very well like the Nikon.  For his purposes though the camera did not fit his needs or style of shooting. Outside, in good light the camera performed well enough but in low light situations he was very unhappy with the auto white balance (AWB) and the exposure settings.  He also indicated some of his issues could have been with the Nikon menu system and not thinking like Nikon but more like a Canon user.Rebecca Kyle, March 2013

Reviews.Title: FUN!
Reviews.Author: Joann Stankiewicz
Reviews.Content: I went snorkeling for the first time on vacation this past year and this camera made me look GOOD!! I have many people who can't believe this small camera took them.

Reviews.Title: As advertised.
Reviews.Author: wilbeksky
Reviews.Content: Worked great in dry land and underwater on my trip to Hawaii. I was impressed with the ease of use and picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great warranty
Reviews.Author: TedT
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. Pictures are sharp and clear with flawless color. Easy to use and very versatile. Took a great picture of a sea turtle underwater in Hawaii while skin diving. Shortly after the camera flooded and was returned to Nikon. Nikon is honoring the warranty and repairing the camera free of charge. This is very different from Casio which attributed every warranty claim to customer abuse and denies the claim. Great camera, should be good to 30 feet underwater. Think I'll keep it above 10 feet in the future.

Reviews.Title: Not a waterproof camera. Got water in lense first time in water. Nikon won't replace!
Reviews.Author: Zahily
Reviews.Content: Save your money and don't buy this camera. It is not waterproof. We took it to the beach, and on the first trip that got in the water, it got water in the lense. When we call Nikon to replace it, they first told us we would get an email with instructions on how to return, which we never got. Then we called again and this time they took the deffensive approach and told us it was OUR FAULT! that the only way they replace it under warranty is if water comes in from the battery compartment. REALLY!??? First of all this is being marketed and sold as a WATERPROOF DIGITAL CAMERA, and not a water resistant camera. Waterproof means exactly that, you can completly submerge the camera under water and NO WATER WILL GET INSIDE THE CAMERA COMPONENTS FROM ANYWHERE!! Second of all, how do you proof where the water came in from?, the water is INSIDE already, who cares where/how it got in, WHAT MATTERS IS THAT IT GOT IN WHEN IT SHOULD NOT HAVE!!!!This was incredibly insulting!! We will NEVER buy or recommend Nikon products again! YOU GUYS ARE A FRAUD!We thank Amazon since they were ethical enough as to take the camera back for a refund despite being passed the return period. Thank you Amazon!!!Save yourself the aggravation and don't buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Rock
Reviews.Content: It takes very nice pictures, downloads great to my devices. I would highly recmend this camera. You most definitely have to get a battery pack.

Reviews.Title: Great for the beach
Reviews.Author: MF
Reviews.Content: I live on a barrier island in Florida so I spend a lot of time in and near the water. I like the peace of mind I get that the camera is water proof. This camera is small and light. I carry it in my cargo shorts or in my bathing suit. Either way, I sometimes forget I'm carrying it. The photo quality is great and the camera feels sturdy in my hand. The menu system is easy to use and the dedicated buttons eliminate the need to burrow thru a menu to perform common tasks like switching between shooting and viewing. I'm also finding the battery life suits my needs.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: justin
Reviews.Content: One of the bed cameras I have ever owned. The quality of pictures is grew. It is a very tough piece of equipment, I took it through a deployment to Afghanistan and through all the heat, sand, and occasional river it still works perfect.

Reviews.Title: great general purpose camera, plus good for snorkeling or shallow SNUBA
Reviews.Author: D. Weaver
Reviews.Content: This camera was perfect on our vacation. One camera that did everything from snorkeling to depths of 15 to 20 ft, to snapping pics during our land based excursions. The compact design fit easily in a pocket. When fitted with a float strap it worked well under water. GPS time/location tagging was an added bonus. With advanced features like auto face tracking and underwater photo settings it is very nicely equipped.On the downside, a protective carrying case was not included in the box. Also, the battery is Nikon's own CoolPix Li-ion, which works well. However, I would be happier if it took standard high output AA rechargeables.Quite happy with this. I only hope that someday they might make a version that can go deeper, to say 120 ft / 40 M for SCUBA.

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot
Reviews.Author: W. W.
Reviews.Content: This camera seems to do it all for you.  Stills, video, or panorama I'mvery pleased with the results. The GPS is a nice feature if you travel a lot.

Reviews.Title: This Camera is in my pocket EVERY day
Reviews.Author: NJ Night Rider
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Carry it with me every day, literally. I kayak on the Hudson River and the Atlantic Ocean. Great, no worry about getting it wet in salt or sweet water. Just make sure you rinse off the salt water when you get home ... ahhh... note to self. I also teach kayaking in NYC. At the pool it fell, unknown to me, out of my PFD (life vest) and sat at the bottom of the pool (5 feet) for over 30 minutes ... no problem.  Love the close up feature. Was out west in Bryce Canyon National Park, saw this crazy insect. With the close-up feature, you're able to literally get within an inch of the bugger and fill the frame. Sharp and good color. Speaking of color; Bought the orange body, liked its brightness and the high visibility (helped finding it at the bottom of the pool), PLUS, the orange color is typically at the lowest price on Amazon. Now (Feb, 2013) it's like $214 ??!!!! Makes me want to buy another one.Oh, and the video is great too. Since I carry it at all times, it's great for recording thoughts and ideas for latter writings.

Reviews.Title: not impressed...this must be used OUTDOOR only
Reviews.Author: wsabi
Reviews.Content: I must belive mine was total defective camera- 8/10 of shots taken are totally out of wack! They aren't forcus or too dark, just pure bad pictures...and it was on auto mode. After I played a little in different seting, they didn't improve at all. I guess this is a point and shoot OUTDOOR camera, and never use it indoor, period. Well, actually I've tried underwater but they still are horrible!!I think Nikon totally missed the quality control on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Much much better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Dave E. Khor "CampDad"
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd waterproof camera - my 1st was an entry-level Olympus which takes good still images but the video was low-rent.  I'm going to one of Mexico's seaside resorts this April and wanted a better waterproof camera.  At the end of my research, it came down to the Sony TX20 and the AW100.  I am a Nikon fan(D90 + V1) as well as Sony's(Nex-5N).  The AW100 has GPS and better ergonomics IMO.  I like external controls whereas on Sony, everything must go through the menu.  I have high regards for both Nikon and Sony, but when it comes to digital camera/photography, my vote goes to Nikon.  On the AW100, IQ is good, video is good and GPS(geo-tagging) is good.  The level of control is good for a P&S; but nowhere close to dSLR or high-end mirrorless.  But for its class, the AW100 is just right for me.  Coolest feature - GPS!

Reviews.Title: Cool camera, Sub-Par Pictures
Reviews.Author: NJO
Reviews.Content: BLUF:  Cool camera, poor picturesHaven't tested the "Water Proofing" yet....I bought the camera for durable camping, fishing and hunting uses not underwater diving, etc.Indoor pic quality miserable...Outdoor, overcast shooting....poorsunny, bright...bearable picsLook elsewhere....

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY FOR ANY UNDERWATER PHOTOGRAPHY
Reviews.Author: C. Palmer "CSP"
Reviews.Content: Product failed first time I submerged it in the water. Worked for a while then shut off. Then lens fogged over completely and LED screen stopped working. The camera worked great for any other non underwater photography. It simply just isn't waterproof. Why Nikon advertises this as being waterproof and shockproof is beyond me. Water resistant maybe but if you submerge it then it will fail eventually. Read the other 80 reviews on amazon if you don't believe me. I AM PISSED.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera so Far.... 1 Little Problem
Reviews.Author: Lori
Reviews.Content: The camera is great for me so far! I got it at christmas and have used it in the water 1 time... and it worked AWESOME! It was an indoor water park and the pictures still turned out great! I looked after and there wasn't any water in the battery/memory card chamber. I got lots of fun pictures! I am not very knowledgeable about cameras, but for me, this one works great! The reason for the 4 stars is because of the action response. I don't really get the point. I have mine on the lowest setting, but in playback mode it still changes the picture if I try to pass it to somebody. I don't know how or if you can turn it off, but I haven't been able to. That is the only complaint from me! It is a great camera for me! I love it! Hopefully it keeps up it's awesome waterproofness!

Reviews.Title: a gem
Reviews.Author: Shudder Bug
Reviews.Content: The kids and I canoe down a Florida river several times each summer. I always brought a camera but mostly left it in the ziploc because of fear of damage. This Nikon CoolPix AW100 is a fantastic, tough, outdoor ready camera. My daughter took several surprising videos of underwater events as we paddled along and we all used it to capture our adventures during stops along the way downstream. Playing it back at home in the evening reinforces the fun we had. Taking it to the Gulf beaches is no longer a concern either. Just rinse off the sand and salt - good to go. The drop protection, waterproof, built-in GPS (coarse), long battery life and many other features makes this a keeper. Over a year in service and still going strong. Nice clear pics and videos with minimal training. We love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher Sosnowski
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera. Bought it to replace an aged Coolpix s610 with lens error. This unit has a very intelligent Easy Auto Mode that analyses whats coming into the lens and changes the scene automatically, very useful. Also comes with an adapter that clips over the lens that allows for filters etc. Very pleased with this product.

Reviews.Title: A big challenge
Reviews.Author: Subash Bijlani
Reviews.Content: Coolpix AW100 stayed a challenge for the couple of weeks I tried to come to terms with it. I found the focusing cumbersome. The flash produced over-exposed pictures and back lighting gave underexposed images.My experience with cameras of another make gave sharp pictures. The build is robust and feels good in hand but the response times and the toughness of its buttons made me wish I had not purchased it. It was finally the poor quality of pictures that led me to return the product.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Divegirl
Reviews.Content: This camera was a great purchase.  I wanted one for biking trips so I didn't have to worry about keeping it dry in bad weather and it does that and more.  The picture resolution is wonderful.  I have even won a local photo contest with the pics I have taken with it.  Have not tried it underwater, but kayaking it rocks.  Have not really figured out the GPS, but didn't buy it for that feature.

Reviews.Title: Best Compact Digital Add On Camera
Reviews.Author: OhioFM
Reviews.Content: I own a Nikon D300 series DLSR Camera and decided I needed a compact addition for those times when I didnt want to carry around the D300 and my various accessories.  This camera exceeded my expectations for a $200 level compact camera.The shots taken with the default settings are amazing, The functionality is awsome and easy to use and it offers custom settings for those who like to go outside the box.  It is built to withstand my 2 year old grand daughters attempts at becoming a photo buff and its easy to carry with you.The battery life is better than expected before requiring a recharge.  I have shot over a thousand pictures since purchasing this camera without issue.  I have purchased 3 other Nikon compacts models for family members and when they all saw and shot with this camera they were will and ready to upgrade to it!The product was delivered as expected. You will be very pleased with this Nikon compact.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Scott Phillips
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome!  It's been on several trips with me and stands up to everything as advertised!  It's been snorkeling in the Caribbean, on a jungle adventure in Costa Rica, and it's nice to not have to worry about the camera on hikes.  If you're doing a bunch of water activities, a floaty device is recommended.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Jerry O. Potter
Reviews.Content: Has been used already, takes great pictures, in water or out.  Very very good product and would suggest it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Amanda B.
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much from this camera since it seems to be more designed to survive rather than take a good photo - but I was SO surprised! Takes AMAZING photos! Just a little nervous about taking it underwater...but we'll see!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: user
Reviews.Content: The camera has three main issues: it can do the panorama picures to express atmospherics. second it is HD video capable and third it is "foolproof and resistant"

Reviews.Title: I have so much fun with this thing
Reviews.Author: vonna
Reviews.Content: I love taking it in the water! it takes great pictures and video. its a good size and i also take it to record while im roller skating or skateboarding around town. I had to chose between this or a big dslr camera and I'm glad I chose this just because I seriously take it everywhere and I know I wouldnt want to bring a fat camera bag around everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Quality camera.
Reviews.Author: D. Crum "crumvoc"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my daughter when she worked in Hawaii last summer. The instructions indicate that one should keep the seal clean and even replace it after about a year of use.  It must be a fairly robust little device because my daughter did not manage to ruin it during the course of the summer, even with going to the beach several dozen times!  It even takes excellent photographs! I'm impressed.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Ramiro Arenas Vargas
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a practical and functional camera and I made a survey on different branches. This is the best one. Underwater feature is exciting.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Q "Q"
Reviews.Content: Perfect for what I wanted to do with the camera.  Used it while snorkling, kayaking, hiking, and just ever day use.  Still a 5 star product even though the lens would get a bit foggy due to wind such as taking pictures from a helicopter.

Reviews.Title: great gift
Reviews.Author: Larry Sutton, LCDR, USN(ret.)
Reviews.Content: My husband was so pleased when he recieved this CoolPix!  It saves his back, neck & shoulders from having to carry a heavy camera and attachments all the time, and the quality of the pictures are great.

Reviews.Title: As good as advertized
Reviews.Author: Jim Fangman "JRFLLINK"
Reviews.Content: Haven't dropped it or taken it under water, takes great pictures and easy to use.  Would recommend this camera, thanks

Reviews.Title: Not acceptable as an everyday point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Bookclubber
Reviews.Content: We are a family that hikes, camps, swims, etc., so we buy these rugged cameras so we can take them anywhere and don't need to worry as much about banging or dropping. So, sometimes we are in water situations, but often we are just living life like hanging out at home or going to the children's museum or indoors at my kids' schools. We need a camera that can do the "rugged" thing, but that also can take standard point and shoot pictures in everyday indoor/outdoor situations. This camera does not take good pictures in those everyday indoor situations, and therefore we are sending it back.  I have used it for several weeks and can't seem to find the "right" way to take an indoor photo. If I use the flash, sometimes it will blow out the whole photo. If I don't, everyone has to hold perfectly still or else the image is blurred, even in what I would not consider to be low light. Sometimes the photo is great. I never know how it's going to turn out, so I have to just try it and if it's blown out or blurry I either have missed the opportunity or I have to stage the photo to happen again, after I have adjusted the flash. The intelligent auto does not seem to ever do the right thing.I also don't like the tiny buttons on this thing. I have managed it without much trouble, but I don't like having to navigate all the menus with tiny buttons.For reference, our previous camera was a beloved Panasonic TS1 which served us faithfully for several years before it finally got a permanently blurry lens. So I know that I'm not asking too much when I ask for good point and shoot capability from a waterproof and shockproof camera. Not everyone who buys these is mountain climbing and scuba diving! Many purchasers are just families who want a versatile, durable and easy to use everyday camera, and I don't recommend the Nikon AW100 for that purpose.

Reviews.Title: Lacking.
Reviews.Author: Drea
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to Kauai this month. Ran into a bunch of annoying problems during the trip. I'll keep it short and sweet -PROS:- 1080 HD video- Good sound quality- Durable- Easy to capture video- Somewhat user friendly- Battery/SD card were kept nice & dryCONS:- The lens kept fogging up EVERYWHERE we went. Water, land, air. It would take forever for it to clear. Lots of our pictures had a haze or a circular blurry spot due to the fogging of the lens.- Battery life is poor. Consistent use gave us about 5-6 hours per day. (Not enough if you're out an about doing activities & you're unable to charge the battery!)- It's hard to see the screen in daylight & underwater.- Picture quality is mediocre. I tested shots using a Canon & Canon had nicer images.- Nikon's flash washes everything out & the images look dull.Overall, I would NOT recommend this camera for others. The fogging of the lens was the biggest problem we ran into. We were just lucky we had another camera & our phones handy to take pictures with instead.

Reviews.Title: I'm used to Coolpix cameras, but...
Reviews.Author: David L. Dare "simplyconnected"
Reviews.Content: I restore classic Ford cars.  Sometimes I'm up very late with my hobby.  My last Coolpix (8700) crapped-out because it was exposed to dew.  Frustrated, I tried getting it fixed.  Then I found this camera.  It's sooooo much better for my purposes, instead of fixing the old, I threw it out.  Sometimes I have to wipe grease off my hands to take restoration pics. Most of my shots show close details.  I need fine resolution to crop and share pics with my club members.  No problem with this little jewel.  It's compact, light, and very hearty.  Pictures are even better than I expected and I'm used to large-lens cameras.I don't take it to the beach so it won't see sand or water but I'm around automotive chemicals (which are far worse).  It does just fine for me and I admit that it is easier to use.and has much faster recovery than my old Coolpix.8700.  I would buy another AW100 if this got lost.

Reviews.Title: nikon
Reviews.Author: SATURNINO CORONADO
Reviews.Content: is a product of excellent quality and durability, I recommend to fill the demands and expectations required by my very good

Reviews.Title: Very expensive disposable
Reviews.Author: Alex Eaf
Reviews.Content: Great camera while it worked. It was absolutely perfect for my needs. However after the second time in water the seals failed and the camera is dead. Im am in Asia for a year and need to be a replacement camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas M Foran
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, not having to worry about the weather and keeping it dry allows me to take a lot of shots with my labs in rain and snow.

Reviews.Title: Slow and Unfocused Images, Bad Camera
Reviews.Author: Paul M. Barth
Reviews.Content: We tend to but a lot of point and shoot cameras.  In the last year I've purchased four cameras and this one is by far the worst of the bunch.  Some specific examples:- Forget the ability to take spontaneous pictures.  The camera takes upwards of five seconds from the moment you are ready to take a picture until the camera actually takes the picture.  What is it doing?- The flash sensor is essentially useless.  I did not purchase a completely manual camera or a high end DSLR where I can tweak the settings -- I bought a point and shoot to quickly take candids of my family.  Be prepared to throw away the majority of indoor shots as the flash will not fire when you would expect it to, and it will when you don't need it.- The recharge time on the flash is far greater than any camera I've used in years, about ten seconds.- Notice the lens does not have a cover in the off position.  How is this a good design?- Focus.  Even in good outdoor lighting conditions this camera fails to take crisp photos.This camera is straight out of 2005.  If you have not purchased a camera since then you might think these functions are normal or that this is a decent camera.  It is not.  Stay away and look at any alternative brands as you can do a lot better for the same cost (or even less).

Reviews.Title: Beach Vacation must-have
Reviews.Author: Matthew Nelson
Reviews.Content: Takes great underwater pics. Very responsive no "load" time when turning on and reviewing photos. Only complaint menu is expansive and can take a while to change modes.

Reviews.Title: "Cool" & Waterproof!
Reviews.Author: RAC
Reviews.Content: Love my Nikon Coolpix AW100!  Very easy to use.  Photos are clear & crisp.  My husband used it underwater while snorkeling several times.  Pictures turned out really nice and the camera seems to be truly waterproof.  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Amy Buck
Reviews.Content: I travel 4-6 times a year and bought this camera for the underwater and shockproof capabilities. It take great pictures, with many customizable settings. I took this camera on a 3500 foot zip line tour last year in Hawaii and have some amazing pictures. Awesome camera and I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for snorkeling/scuba
Reviews.Author: Marlane
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my trip to Hawaii. Used it in the ocean as far down as 25feet or so for 30min at a time with no problems. Battery life went beyond my expectations...used it for an hour straight and then on and off for another two days and the battery was only halfway empty.Pictures were very clear especially for so far down in the water. At 25feet underwater no flash was needed!!!Easy one click movie button. Great for when an unexpected sea turtle swims by...no fumbling or settings change needed to start a video!Despite the moving fish and swimming while trying to photograph images are clear ( most of the time)Good zoom but better for up close photos. Varied settings available and very easy to navigate the menu (buttons a bit small if you have larger fingers).Only problem I had was the lens fogging up when camera left under the sun heat then taken into the cold ocean right away. Fog cleared within a few minutes. If not, you just need to dry camera and open where you store battery and the lens will clear right up.Very happy! More than worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: TK
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing small point and shoot camera. Great sensor for dark areas, clear images and lightweight but not flimsy. I like it a lot for my on-the-move photography and the fact it is waterproof can give me new ideas for fun videos. Recommended highly!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Wourms
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a trip to Italy. Well worth the $$, it takes very nice pics for a P&S;, has some nice features like the easy-panorama setting which I enjoyed trying out. Also took it underwater in the ocean, & it survived no problems!

Reviews.Title: Solid Camera!
Reviews.Author: Michael Bobbitt "IB Mike"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace my non-rugged Nikon compact that took a beating for a few years and finally had enough. I carry this camera in my uniform pocket all day and I'm currently deployed to Afghanistan, so I was concerned about the dust. After doing quite a bit of research, I decided to go with the AW100. Have had it for just over a month and I'm pretty happy with it. It fires up quicky and snaps off shots as quickly as I need it to.Menus are easy to access, the easy mode gets the conditions right every time and when I want to select a mode, I can do so quickly and easily.Would definitely buy it again and recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: Great Idea Fails To Deliver
Reviews.Author: 3ddy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item primarily so that I could do some photos while snorkeling.  And while the camera does a serviceable job on normal photos, it suffers from two large issues. (1) The lens window fogs easily, making any photos taken pretty much useless until the window clears. (2) The low light performance is poor.  In addition, my unit went into a lock/freeze mode in the ON condition (couldn't turn it OFF) where no buttons would function and it significantly discharged the battery in the span of 2 or 3 minutes. Had to remove the battery to reset it so that I could use it again. This only happened once; but, I'd only just purchased the unit a couple of weeks prior and have since sent it to NIKON for repair.By the way, NIKON's current return/repair process is not all that great.  Basically send it in at your expense and we'll get back to you at some point. No easy way to talk to anyone about your issue at all prior to sending an item in. Again, I'm surprised since my prior NIKON experiences several years back were great.The first item was surprising, as I was taking this camera to the beach and had some minor sea spray splash on the camera window. Guess what, the window fogged right where the drops of water hit. I could only imagine what would happen if I submerged it. In addition, as I was exploring some ancient temple ruins and went from the outdoors to inside the temple the lens fogged again. Same for some caves I was in.  Fogged lens = no or poor photos. While I have sent the camera in for repair, a late arriving email (took NIKON 2 weeks to answer) indicated that NIKON does have some language in the manual (and in the small print on it's advertisements if you can find it) that the lens may fog when the camera is subjected to "extreme" temperature shocks in humid environments.  Just how many of you have ever jumped into water that was warmer than the outside air when snorkeling? And by definition, snorkeling is normally a humid environment. But, NIKON did cover their behind I suppose.  Buyer beware and read the small print. I don't think they will be repairing my unit for this unanticipated feature, but we'll see.However, the camera is light and takes a pretty good photo if you have plenty of light. And, hopefully I'll be surprised at NIKON service after a rocky start. I'd really like to like this camera.

Reviews.Title: FIRST RATE MACHINE.
Reviews.Author: A. C. Lima "NAGUAL MD"
Reviews.Content: I think nikon has done a great job with this jewel.,coming from 2 olympus 770sw.Worth every penny.,I DO RECOMMEND.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera
Reviews.Author: White Bear
Reviews.Content: Photo and video quality is excellent.  Well made, with good seals on the battery/SD Card compartment.No problems with water intrusion.GPS feature is very nice and works well with Picasa Web Photo Albums.Easy to operate.I've recommended this camera to friends.

Reviews.Title: Next generation?
Reviews.Author: brittany b
Reviews.Content: So after having my first waterproof camera stolen while in Thailand (Panasonic TS3) I had to buy another one because the trip was only a week in, and we had many water activities to come. In Asia the Panasonic TS3 was sold out so I went with this here Nikon because my friend had also bought it, and it was $399 there!!!! ANYWAYS, that aside. Used it for about 4 weeks and it was great, always careful to rinse in clean water after snorkelling with it or whatever, I was really impressed! EXCEPT, the lens area and display area would fog up on about week 3 and it got extremely frustrating -- you go to take a picture and not miss that one moment in time and what do you know, the picture looks like a foggy blob. It could take hours for these fogged areas to go away. Second trip comes, and it completely fails on week 5. No different usage than before, and the depth of the water submersion was maybe 5 inches this time? The seal is obviously not great. No sand or anything was in the way of the seal. Really disappointed. Because it was bought in Thailand I could only have it warranty serviced in Bangkok and when I tried this... well... you can imagine how impossible it was. Hopefully the next generation of this camera will be better because the photos were great!

Reviews.Title: Solid camera, easy to use
Reviews.Author: A. Roseto
Reviews.Content: Solid feel to the camera, well constructed, no rattles or loose parts internally not externally. Quick start up no lag, can snap a photo instantly on start up and subsequently after a photo. No lag on shutdown. Waterproof, shockproof and GPS with a world base map and some landmarks is pretty awesome. Next needs wifi. Price is coming down on this camera which is good because it is our work camera and we tend to lose them or get one stolen every 6 months or so which is better that other cameras we've had at work which tend to be paperweights within a year of on the job service.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and it is everything it was advertised as. I haven't dropped it yes but so far the quality is great! :)

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: peggy thomas
Reviews.Content: its a wonderful lovely digital camera. with a nice big screen and it takes wonderful pictures. i love everything about it.

Reviews.Title: Great rugged camera
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: I just wanted a camera to use under water, and this camera took some great pictures and video under water. Using the camera on land was another story, not that it took bad pictures it was just frustrating to have to switch from the different camera settings.I would recommend this camera for people who are active and want some good shots.

Reviews.Title: Nice, but...
Reviews.Author: Fine Art "Art*nstuff"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that would hold up on a trip to Costa Rica that included zip-lining, fishing and horseback riding, etc.I also purchased filters for it.The video jumps at regular intervals, and if you use filters in a high humidity area, don't put them on in an air conditioned room. They will fog.Otherwise, the camera works well.

Reviews.Title: Don't expect too much
Reviews.Author: A user
Reviews.Content: First,  the good things about this camera, it's small, light, and most important, it does a very good job underwater.  Water resistance is the only reason I bought it.  If you're looking for picture quality, you will be disappointed. The camera software is buggy.  The flash for night scene is horrible.  The flash is overwashing the whole picture.  The response time is very slow too.  If you turn on GPS, your battery would die about 20 pictures(literally).  That's just not acceptable for a camera with this price.I feel like Nikon just put the cheapest stuff in this camera and it does not worth its price..

Reviews.Title: Sweet Sell
Reviews.Author: Cynthia M. Nichols "Think Snow"
Reviews.Content: Whether we're skiing or swimming, this great deal will do the job nicely.  Looking forward to bringing this puppy on all our vacas.

Reviews.Title: good outdoor camera
Reviews.Author: fatjimbo
Reviews.Content: have used this camera on atv trail riding so it geets real dusty, I just clean off with water with a little dish soap. The camera is easy to use have used it with gloves on also has acceptable pixs.

Reviews.Title: Beyond my expectations
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I wasn't quite sure if this camera would live up to my expectations. It blew me away! I have used many of those one time use underwater cameras and vowed to buy no more. The quality definately lagged on those. When we first viewed our free dives on the tv later in the day we were taken by the sharp clear images and videos. Don't waste your money on those one time use cameras. You spend a lot of money for gear, spend a little more to show your friends just how beautiful the reefs really are. Even great for those days at the pool with no worries.

Reviews.Title: Awesomeness!
Reviews.Author: sheepgirl
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for work because we have to take pictures in wet weather and in streams. Awesome camera and features. I just bought a second one for another staff member.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: OSFurther
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I paddle and wanted a camera I didn't have to worry about.  I have enjoyed it thoroughly.  I've been able to take pictures immediately, getting shots that I would otherwise have missed because of the weather conditions.  I find it easy to handle;to push the buttons.  I don't even mind just using the screen to focus. The pictures are good quality and with a bit of practice I've learned to use the zoom - that is the one aspect of the camera I found to be  cumbersome. I still prefer my DSLR but you can't put it in your pocket that might get wet, pull it out, snap a shot, throw it back in your pocket and resume paddling in a matter of a minute or two.  Highly recommend this camera for people who love  the out-of-doors.

Reviews.Title: Best camera!
Reviews.Author: Susan Calfa
Reviews.Content: I met someone who had this camera and I thought it was great. As soon as I got home I ordered it. I LOVE IT! This is the best camera I have owned. Extremely user friendly.  The pictures come out great in any setting. I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: B. Kolean "Carpe Diem"
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera.  It takes great pics/vids.  It's great for people who are active and will be taking this camera on hikes, excursions, etc.  Very easy to use.  Point and shoot pretty much and you can trust it that it took a great pic.  The GPS works good and the Panoramic is the easiest one that I have used on a camera like this.  I owned the Olympus freeze/water/shock proof camera, and that Panoramic was horrible.  I highly recommend this camera and the accessory pack that is available also here on Amazon.One negative,  I wish it had a lens cover that would automatically cover the lens when you powered off.  That is my only real negative thing about this camera.  But, I've had no issue with lens scratching or anything.  Still great buy.

Reviews.Title: Great All-Weather Camera
Reviews.Author: MikeS
Reviews.Content: Great all-weather camera that you don't ever have to be worried about getting wet.  We have used it at the beach in the waves and under water at the pool.  Takes great pictures and videos as you would expect from a Nikon.  Also purchased a floating strap so you don't have to worry about dropping in the water either.  GPS works - gets your location in the right place - but if you're looking for a usable GPS device this is not it.  Not a deal breaker but worth mentioning...

Reviews.Title: Tested at the beach - not underwater
Reviews.Author: ocean2
Reviews.Content: I never liked the idea of bringing my Nikon SLR to the sandy salty beach, so I thought a waterproof Nikon Coolpix might hold up better. It did a good job, but don't think it will match the pictures you get from a good SLR - there just is no comparison.This is the first camera that I've used without a view finder to look thru. Trying to look at the back LCD screen in bright daylight to frame a moving ocean wave or person proved to be challenge that didn't often work, thankfully digital lets you click a bunch of bad shots in hope that something comes out. Motion shots are also made difficult by the 'delay' in the shutter - actually I think it grabs a frame or two in advance of what you see on the screen. I notice this when trying to shoot a breaking wave and often got it before it broke.Having a Nikon previously helped a great deal in figuring out the crazy menus and adjusting the settings when needed - nice to be able to read them without my glasses. There are still things and menus after a month of shooting that I do not fully understand and have trouble getting back to - sometimes I get 3 consecutive shots, sometime I don't and how to view or pick one of them is still a mystery - may have try the manual someday.I did have the lens and back screen fog up several times and that ruined any shots taken until the condensation was removed (had to bring it back to the house and leave it open in dry conditions as recommended). This is without ever putting the camera underwater, but I did recharge the battery when it was humid outside. The next day was dry, bright, and sunny and that is when it fogged.

Reviews.Title: Good rugged camera, terrible general use camera
Reviews.Author: carpenttree
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a sort of fun camera to throw around when I don't want to expose my dslr to danger. I've taken this camera underwater, in the snow, and on regular shoots. Image quality definitely is lacking, but in my opinion, you can't expect much if you are buying into a camera that is shock, water, and freeze proof. I would not recommend this camera as a daily use camera, but would definitely recommend it as a secondary shooter when one wants to capture memories in places normal cameras cannot go. My favorite feature is the video capabilities on this camera as it is fun to play with the slow motion (60, 120, 240 fps) and record things underwater or dust storms. There is no manual control feature which I wish was included as almost everything is based on presets. Low light performance is poor. Focusing isn't very sharp. Colors are acceptable but barely. If you're looking for a camera that you can throw around and capture fun moments in the water or in times when a dslr or higher end camera would get too dirty or destroyed, then yes by all means get this camera. However make sure you know you are not buying this for image quality (stills). Based purely on camera characteristics, I would give this camera two stars, but with the additional perks of being rugged and my philosophy of use with this camera as it fits into my photography system, I give it four stars.As a side note, lithium ion batters in general are depleted extremely fast in cold weather so although this camera is freeze proof, the battery does drain fast in snow conditions so try to keep the camera as warm as possible!

Reviews.Title: Good, not great!
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with the original intention of going to Costa Rica.  This was going to be a tough trip, so I knew I needed a tough camera. about a 5 days in to the trip the lens started fogging up at very inopportune times, both in the water and out! This was inside the viewing screen as well as the actual lens.  Then later it would go back to normal and take good pictures.  I really loves this camera and the ease of use, but it failed me in so many situations.  On top of this when I sent it back to the manufacturer to be repaired, they said they no longer make the part the camera needs (even though it is a relatively new camera) and would be sending me a check.  This is after them having the camera for around two months and I am still waiting.  I like the camera, but not enough to buy a new one I don't think.

Reviews.Title: Caribbean Review
Reviews.Author: V. Brancart
Reviews.Content: I recently took this camera on a bareboat charter through the British Virgin Islands so we had lots of exposure to the elements, both on the yacht as well as underwater. The camera lives up to its expectations as an underwater camera and I can't find fault with what it has to offer. The pictures and video are what one would expect in ocean waters with various water quality and lighting. To be fair, I did shoot some pics and video in the local pool and they were awesome. My criticism pertains to the pictures as some other reviewers have noted. Due to the small lens, the pictures are not that "crisp" in my opinion. I tried all the various pre-assigned exposures and I was not impressed with the quality. Therefore I am returning the camera and will be purchasing a housing unit for an existing point and shoot that I currently own to use underwater.

Reviews.Title: working great!
Reviews.Author: Angela Davis
Reviews.Content: I've taken this camera out kayaking and paddle boarding; it's gotten totally submerged both times & haven't had any problems.  I also took it to a scuba refresher class I took and it was underwater then also.  I did read some other reviews that said the camera would leak but so far no problems with mine.  Hope it stays that way!

Reviews.Title: Two  brand new cameras, both drowned after few trips in water
Reviews.Author: K. Allen "Sharkbait"
Reviews.Content: I have had two of the these cameras in the last month.  The first received irreversible water damage the very first time in the water.  Nikon replaced it with a brand new one.  I used it three times without any problems.  Today I take it out and within 5 minutes, it too had water inside.  I have always followed the instructions for after care.  I never even opened these up while on the beach.  But two cameras both with the same results.  I will be looking a replacement that is not Nikon.[...]

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Job
Reviews.Author: D. Moncla
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our beach and underwater pictures while on my vacation. It did such a great job of both tasks. (If I can go back and insert pictures in this review I will) I also used it to carry around town to take pictures with as well. It is only OK in this genre. If you are taking pictures at night just leave it in my opinion. After taking about 8 pictures of my wife and daughters in an open air restaurant I went to my iPhone 4 to get the job done. Not one picture was usable from the Nikon (of that scene). All the settings are automatic so if the camera senses any kind of low light it keeps the shutter open longer. I should have been less lazy and brought by good Sony HX1 with me. Anyway, that is not what I bought the camera for. The underwater shots and video were all great. My underwater tip is to get as close as possible if you want good colors in you pics. The zoom works great but your pictures will not have the color they get from the close shots. Also VERY IMPORTANT - BUY A FLOATING STRAP!!! I read that on another review and it saved my camera! We went on a resort scuba session and somehow the camera came off my wrist as we surfaced. It popped up next to my instructor who grabbed it an said  "sure is a good thing you bought that strap".

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Kirk
Reviews.Content: If you need a waterproof camera for seawater/freshwater, this is what you need.  Takes great pictures in & out of the water. I do recommend getting a few extra lithium batteries for the camera but they are under $10 a piece. Be gentle with the camera because it still has breakable parts on it, it is not indestructible.

Reviews.Title: Great water-proof camera
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera at Best Buy before going on a snorkeling vacation.  The outdoor pictures were terrific, the underwater pictures were very good, the GPS feature I left on the whole time.  It drains the battery very quickly (3-4 hours) and the GPS receiver is not very strong (1 inch underwater and you lose the GPS, had to put the GPS receiver right up against the glass in the airplane to get a signal), I didn't like the shake feature which can't be turned off (you can adjust the sensitivity for shake) which toggles between pictures, or shooting modes.  There is no built in manual for the camera and with all the options, there is a lot to learn in order to maximize the camera's potential.  I shot pictures in the ocean and the swimming pool making sure I cleaned it with fresh water after each use.  I had no water leakage or dampness when I opened up the battery and SDHC slots.  I had no fogging of the lens.  I did have a few water spots on the glass lens cover after a little time being splashed.  The video shots were alright but not great (the motion when panning smoothly seemed a little catchy on playback on the computer).  I liked the video led light that you could turn on when you made movies, although it just helped rather than lit up shadow spots when snorkeling.  What it would take for me to give it a 5 star rating would be 1) Longer battery life, 2) Smoother motion on videos, 3) Built-in manuals / more intuitive menus.

Reviews.Title: Nikon AW100
Reviews.Author: Juan
Reviews.Content: Just the camera I looking for outdoor activities, great underwater shots and easy to use. The GPS works really good

Reviews.Title: OUTSTANDING CAMERA
Reviews.Author: navymomma26
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I have ever owned. The quality of the pictures and videos both in water and out of water are fabulous. I would recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Nikon AW100
Reviews.Author: Reg
Reviews.Content: As a motorcyclist I need a camera that's ruggedly built and water-resistant... I drop things, and ride in the rain. A recent 2000-mile trip through the Northwest put both these qualities to the test, and the AW100 passed without a glitch. Additionally, I have been particularly impressed with the photo quality; I knew it would be good having owned numerous Nikon's, but not as good as it is.On the downside, having to rely totally on the screen (given the absence of a viewfinder)for composition is problematic in any condition but shade.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for water fun
Reviews.Author: Linda Finken
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because we were going to the Bahamas and I wanted an underwater camera.  I've been very happy with EVERY Nikon Coolpix camera I have already purchased (S570, S6200), so I thought that sticking with a camera I know and trust would be the best bet for me.  It is very easy to use and I am extremely pleased with the pictures and video that I took.  I've been looking at this camera for over a year and finally got it before our Bahamas trip.  It's just a good fit for me and everyone is amazed at the pictures I take with all my Coolpix cameras.  This one is perfect for water shots and fun water video!

Reviews.Title: Proven in Costa Rica!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Nasharr
Reviews.Content: This camera is almost bullet proof.  It survived the adventures of Costa Rica.  From the beaches to the volcanoes to the white water rafting.  It takes a while to learn the camera.  Camera takes pictures that are crisp, easy to download and worry free about the bouncing and hard knocks of adventure travel.  I give this two thumbs up.  Thanks Nikon!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix Aw100
Reviews.Author: Katherine
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an under water camera that could go at least ten feet under, and was shock proof since i tend to drop stuff alot, When i found out about this camera i wasnt so sure about it because of some of the reveiws people saying that it leeks water, well i bought it anyways and i am very happy with it because i went to go test it n the pool, i was in,there for more than five hours, and most of that time the camera was on and takeing pictures and videos in and out,of the water so i was pretty happy When the camera came out fine, and Ive even dropped it acouple of times on accident and the camera seems fine.

Reviews.Title: Great product :-)
Reviews.Author: pradeep
Reviews.Content: Used this camera for scuba diving, snorkeling and dolphin swim. It was perfect. Got very nice pictures and videos. Will definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: Vacation Workhorse
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera. I took it and a larger one with me on a family vacation...after seeing the quality of the pictures was about the same and without having to worry about sand and water, I preferentially used this one.  It's light-weight, takes excellent pictures, and performed admirably while we were bobbing in the ocean.  You also don't have to think too much if you're trying to capture memories (as opposed to composing great works of art).

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: andre
Reviews.Content: all i have to say its a GREAT CAMERA.. clear underwater,gps works great, pics come out awesome. i love it..

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!  Awesome picture and video quality!
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: Used this for a few weeks on a river trip, lake trip, and swimming pool trip.  Takes great still shots and video.  Look on youtube for examples of the 1080p video it can do.  After reading a ton of reviews, I was sold on it, and am very happy that I went with this one.  The still images are great for a small point and shoot.  This is my camera that I carry the most, and have great confidence that my pics always turn out great.  It has a TON of great features and picture settings as well that really help you take great shots.  I won't go into all of them here, but rest assured, they work well.  As I use it, I'll post back with updates if anything changes, but as of right now, this thing rocks!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Sn0w60ard3r
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera specifically for my first trip scuba diving and to the Big Island of HI.  It took amazing pictures while out of the water.  It has an easy panoramic mode you can use which is pretty cool.  Used it a couple times for amazing pictures of our campsite and might even send one in to jeep to use as propaganda, lol.  The clarity is very good.  I did have some problems with taking night pictures of the Volcano.  I discovered if I used my flash on it it worked ten times better although I really didn't want a picture of the bushes in front of volcano. But because it focused on those the picture of the Volcano glow and smoke came out better.  Then I took it underwater snorkeling.  At first I was skeptical of the pictures it was shooting but that was mainly because of the water.  I took pictures while scuba diving and was trying to pay attention to my depth because I didn't want to pass the 33ft max depth rating on the camera.  My guide stated we would stay at 30 ft.  I took incredible pictures of the coral, the fish, other scuba divers in the crystal clear water.  Later on in the dive I discovered  I was still snapping shots at 39ft!!!  Ooops we went deeper than it is rated to go.  The buttons are a little on the tiny side and if I had gloves on it would have been difficult to use, so if you are in cold water where you need gloves I wouldn't recommend this camera or just make sure that you set it to underwater prior to go underwater.  There is also about 2-3 second delay for the record feature to start working.  If you are impatient like myself you might screw up the 3 minute video of you swimming around a sea turtle!!  GRRRRR!!!  Still upset about that missed opportunity.  But I still got 2 amazing pictures of him/her and a short 1 second clip.:)  This camera does the job REALLY WELL above and under water.  Just remember watch your depth and READ the manual on proper care of your camera.  Rinse with fresh water immediately after it was in salt water and I tried to make sure I never used it under water more than 60 minutes as well.

Reviews.Title: Must have this Camera!!! Love it!
Reviews.Author: Betty
Reviews.Content: I am in love with my new camera. I travel alot, i needed a camera to take pool, outdoor and indoor photos. This camera was the best purchase ever. I took pictures everywhere on my last trip. Picture Quality is great. It work inside the water which i cary with me all the time.This is a must have Camera for very one that travels. The color looks great as well.I am very Happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great for underwater pictures
Reviews.Author: Cliente Kindle
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and was somewhat skeptical because of the bad reviews I had read about how for some people the camara did not work when used under water. I just received the camara on Friday and on Sunday I used it while at the beach. We took underwater pictures and they all looked great. The camara's screen did not fog and the camra did not leak or stopped working after a day where it was submerged in salt water numerous times. I guess, the people who that happened to received a "deffective" camera. This camera is also very good to use on a daily basis. It is veyr easy to use, has plenty of options for point and shoot. The battery lasted 2 days of full usage, which I don't think is bad. I would definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Good video, disappointing photos
Reviews.Author: octopus
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before choosing this camera.  The video has been a pleasant surprise but the photos themselves have been very disappointing.  I used to have the Olympus version but decided to 'upgrade' to the Nikon.  The Olympus was cheaper but took much better photos.  The Nikon is not very intuitive with the flash.  It often over or underexposes shots.  I wish I had just gotten another Olympus and saved the money.

Reviews.Title: Eceeded Ex[ectations new
Reviews.Author: John Pollock
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on a trip to Patagonia.  In the majority of the aspects it out performed my DSLR in terms of ease of getting a shot and the clarity of the shot.  It held up well in the weather which was below freezing and wet,  The panorama feature allowed me to capture the glacier masses that I would never have been able to do with the DSLR.  For the money well worth the buy

Reviews.Title: Standout Camera in it's Class
Reviews.Author: LOSKayaker155
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Nikon AW100 specifically because I wanted something that was capable of both high quality still shots and HD Video, and it HAD to be fully waterproof as I use it from my sea kayak, often while rolling/ surfing in large waves or teaching in a pool.  So far it has exceeded my expectations.  Video is amazingly crisp and the camera is able to maintain focus and clarity in changing conditions without any issues.  I was able to mount it to the front of a kayak and film myself rolling repeatedly and it stayed sharp from bright sunlight, through transition to underwater and again transitioning quickly back up.  Stills are also impressive for a camera and lens this size.  I've noticed almost no distortion around the edges and excellent color reproduction.Pros: Waterproof, HD Video is truly HD, LED flash/ light is versatile and surprisingly bright, built in GPS geotagging function is great, excellent all around outdoor digital camera/ video camera.Cons: For a camera that is being sold to a more active target consumer, the body of the camera seems to be very prone to scratching, even when handled gently.  The same with the rear screen.  Nikon should provide a screen cover as they do on there DSLR's  (Which are more likely to be treated with kid gloves than something be advertized as being "rugged").  Controls are not always all that easy to handle even with thin gloves on.  I often had to remove gloves to operate the camera.Compared to it's competition from Panasonic, Canon, and Olympus, I think this camera stands out!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent on beach, mixed results indoors
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I bought this for use on the beach and in the water snorkeling on my recent trip to Cozumel, and it served that purpose very well.  I am very happy with the beautiful beach pics, the skies are brilliant blue and the overall exposure is excellent in spite of the bright white beach on the sunny day.  The underwater snorkeling pics are great, and there were no problems, but I did not go very deep.  I also used the camera for some indoor shots and some were OK but some were blown out by the flash - way overexposed.  My other big complaint is that there is no raw option - jpeg only - unlike my Canon S95.  That's a big reason why I normally carry my S95 when I can't or don't want to carry my D7000.  I considered buying the underwater case for my S95, but I liked being able to carry around the AW100 in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Water leak
Reviews.Author: mark r. walters
Reviews.Content: After 1 week of use there was a water leak in the battery compartment that fried the screen. Compartment was closed correctly, same as I had done for 10 previous uses that week.Anybody else had the same problem?

Reviews.Title: Waterproof casing did not hold
Reviews.Author: Sandhya Iyer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our family spring break vacation. After looking around this camera seemed to be the best available waterproof camera..so decided to buy it on Amazon through a vendor. Found out soon enough that the battery life was exceedingly limited and I kept running out of battery. The first day of snorkeling the battery died within 10 minutes of underwater usage. I was shooting video. The second day...the camera stopped functioning while I was shooting underwater...only to find water had entered the battery case!!..the LCD screen stopped working and obviously the battery terminals showed some corrosion due to the salt water. So I am disappointed ...did not get the pictures I was dreaming of getting from our spring break vacation. I have returned the camera and am back on the hunt for a better underwater camera.

Reviews.Title: SIMPLY AMAZING!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ramirezsaad
Reviews.Content: WOW!! Simply amazing camera. Ease of use, stong, waterproof, good battery life, looks awesome...ITs perfect.Thank you for a great sell. The price was a bit steep but i believe it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: great little camera for cruising
Reviews.Author: wise1owl
Reviews.Content: I'm generally a "Canon guy" (A400, A570, T1i) but we just bought a Nikon AW100 point and shoot for a cruise and are pleased with the results.Pro- Small, lightweight- Reasonably rugged- Watertight to 10 meters (33 ft.) for beach, swimming, and snorkeling (few snorkelers are going to make the 10 meter depth)- Image stabilization ("vibration reduction" for the "Nikon purists")Con- lag between pressing shutter release and actually taking the photo.- proprietary battery (but non-o.e.m readily available from Amazon - buy a couple with a combo home/car charger)- charger has a separate power cord - not very compact. Resolved by buying a 3rd party charger and extra batteries.One other important thing to note - be sure you thoroughly clean/rinse off and dry the camera before opening it if you've taken it in the water.  Open carefully and swab out the remaing drop around the seal before changing the battery or SD card.

Reviews.Title: Use Around Water Every Day and, So Far, GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Jonica R. Hall
Reviews.Content: I take this camera with me every day on my Hawaiian outrigger canoe paddles. That means this camera is on the beach and near or in the ocean every day. So far (I haven't had it very long yet) it has performed beautifully and takes awesome pics and vids, with some of the pics having incredible clarity for a little point-and-shoot. Another great thing is the ability to use filters, as polarizers are so important when shooting water. In comparison to my Olympus Tough, this camera starts much faster, there's nearly zero pause between pushing the shutter and having the camera actually take the pic, and there is no lense cover to worry about getting sand in, having it stick open then rendering the camera unusable. Also, the software that this camera comes with, "ViewNX2", is a very useful tool. The camera controls, although a bit rough to get around at first, become pretty simple once you figure them out.
