The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because A) like I've said, I haven't had it very long and B) it doesn't seem to be entirely compatible with PShop Elements 9 (I think it might be that PShop can't handle the resolution, but not sure). It's still usable, though. Overall, though, I'm very, very happy with this camera and its capabilities. It was absolutely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: William Judd "Travis Hawke"
Reviews.Content: After reading several favorable reviews, I ordered the AW100 and it arrived just before Christmas. I am still learning all the features, but very impressed with all the things this little camera does. As others have commented, the battery life is "short" with GPS enabled. So I turned GPS off and purchased a second battery. I haven't tried the View NX2 software, too comfortable with Picasa. One detail not readily apparent on Amazon was that memory card not included. There is a small amount of internal memory, but for trips and video an SD card is essential.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: John R. Mcgarity
Reviews.Content: A little complicated at first.  Takes great pictures especially in low light.  In auto picture mode fast moving objects are blurred, but easly fixed by changing to action mode.

Reviews.Title: Make sure you buy warranty!!!
Reviews.Author: allen Rafael
Reviews.Content: I bought mine from costco and it didn't last a year! It held up normal falls on the ground, dirty and simple water sports. The camera does give great quality, it can take awhile to use. I broke mine at wakiki falling off a small 4 foot wave. Im just glad it broke on the last day plus I bought a new LCD screen off amazon and it still won't work. Not buying this camera again... Look it up! Nikon AW100 camera turns on but won't work. It's the only flaw that I and many others have come across. Im going to stick with a GoPro for now on.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX AW100 16 MP CMOS Waterproof Digital Camera
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent digital camera. Takes very good pictures and underwater photos are great. It is a very good buy.

Reviews.Title: Not up to snuff compared to competitors
Reviews.Author: B. Hayes
Reviews.Content: I was really hoping that this camera would be a keeper.  After putting it through some basic paces, I was disappointed in the functionality and somewhat by the image quality.  Rather than get into a lengthy review here is why I returned it: - Slow shot to shot performance (indoors) - When battery gets to 50%, it takes forever for the flash to recharge - Poor low light performance, especially in video (my iphone 4 took better video with low light) - Poor auto focus tracking when shooting video, especially when zooming - Audible camera sounds in video when zooming and focusing - Image quality not up to standards of competitors such as Canon and Sony - Some barrel distortion at wide angleI understand that this camera is a niche market with the ruggedness, however, there are competitors that have comparable cameras with better performance and image quality.

Reviews.Title: Nikon AW100
Reviews.Author: Julius Glickstein
Reviews.Content: I have two units for my field people to shot field activities, so the waterproof comes handy. I'm not going to go through all details since there are plenty of them on Amazon. However I should mention that both units in AUTO mode have color disbalance while shooting with the flash.  May be they are both defected. I was trying to change settings, but it didn't help. The older underwater Olympus and canon both don't have the above referenced issues. Since we don't need "great photos" for me it's not an issue. However, I expected a better product from Nikon.Update 03/24/2012 - every time we have to add photos in our reports they must be adjusted through the software.  I never had this issue with Canon and Olympus.  All photos don't have enough colors and they aren't "there".  I would return both units, however its to late...

Reviews.Title: Died on the last day of my vacation!
Reviews.Author: Michael Ogrinz "Author, Mashup Patterns"
Reviews.Content: Today is the last day of my vacation on St John. I bought this camera speficially for this trip. After 6 days of snorkeling, this camera was working great! I would rinse it off w/ fresh water at the end of the day, let it dry, and load the pics on my PC.But on our last snorkel today, my daughter saw this amazing lobster (never in 9 years down here have I seen one come out during the day)... I went to take its pic and some video, and THIS CAMERA WAS DEAD! At first I thought it was the battery, but as I swam on, I saw condensation inside the display. Clearly, water had make its way in.On top of that, my kids took their first paddle-board lessons today, and I couldn't take pics of that either. Thanks Nikon!Do not buy this camera. Sure, it's under warranty, but when I get it back - will it die again after 6 uses? How can I ever depend on it again? I will always have to bring a spare camera now, which means I might as well not bring this one at all. I might as well have thrown my money away. Try another waterproof camera if you really want to capture those important memories.

Reviews.Title: Black screen
Reviews.Author: Gloatbridge
Reviews.Content: Birthday present last Christmas.September now, but only second time I have used it. Nieces wedding in Maui. Black screen.Went with the Nikon name.No more.

Reviews.Title: Two of em broke
Reviews.Author: Pana
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these for my trip to Greece, I did all of the water tests and have the video to prove it, the first day in six feet of calm water it stopped working. So when I got home Nikkon was good enough to replace it, in less than four inches of still water it stopped working, fool me once Shane on you, fool me twice shame on me.

Reviews.Title: GREY-MARKET CAMERAS- READ THIS
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth McBride "Graphic Designer, Baker & ...
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this camera as I am going to Hawaii this Friday and wanted something for snorkeling. I haven't really tried out the water-proofing feature (my main reason for purchasing), but upon trying to register my product on Nikon's website I found out that it is a grey-market camera. I tried to use the serial number, and even after triple checking, it told me the serial number wasn't valid and that my camera is likely grey-market. I have shown a photo above of the screenshot of Nikon's warning. Please read what I have copied below from the Nikon website regarding grey market cameras. When I received my camera, the entire box besides major type was in Japanese (I didn't think anything of it), and there was no users manual, just a basic sheet with waterproofing information (also, mainly in Japanese). BUT here's where the problem comes in "Additionally, a genuine Nikon Inc. USA product will include an Owners' Manual and Warranty Registration card in English. It will also include power cables (if applicable) designed for US style plugs. Any other language on the printed material or wrong cables indicates a Gray Market item."So, the verdict is grey market. I give this one star because of it. However, I am going to try out the camera as I will be home before the 30 days return policy is up. If I find that nothing is wrong and everything operates properly I will update this review. If something does go wrong, I will be returning this camera and I will indicate here what happened.What is "Gray Market" ?Generally, a manufacturer works with a single importer who can sell and support their products in a given region. The importer usually has local dealers and distributors who resell the imported products; this is called a "distribution channel". Gray Market refers to merchandise that is imported and sold by methods other than these normal channels.For local safety regulations and certifications (FCC, CE, UL, etc.) and government requirements a manufacturer provides special packaging (manuals in the appropriate language, power cables designed for the local receptacle, etc.) and product engineering designed to meet local codes. Manufacturers also have service and support agreements with the authorized importer.Gray Market items are not designed to be sold in a particular market and cannot be supported by the authorized importer because they may not meet mandatory safety and certification codes. Because these items are not designed for a particular market they may not function properly, or the authorized importer may not be equipped to provide service, support or software.With the opening of international borders and the use of the Internet to sell goods, Gray Market equipment has become extremely common in the photographic and consumer electronics markets. Many different types of equipment are brought into North America for sale without the proper documentation and US consumers do not always know what they are purchasing.Because the resellers' cost is less they can sell Gray Market items for less. Unfortunately this price savings is only on the initial purchase; because service and support is more difficult to obtain it may end up costing the consumer more in the long run.Who is the authorized importer of Nikon Equipment into the USA ?Nikon Incorporated USA is the sole authorized importer of Nikon Corporation of Japan for photographic devices. Nikon Inc. USA pays shipping into the USA, import duties and taxes, and provides service, support and downloads for these products. Nikon Inc. USA ensures that the products they import are fully certified and safe for use in the USA market.Nikon Inc. USA cannot provide service, support or downloads for products that have not been imported by Nikon Inc. USA.How do I know if my Nikon product is "Gray Market"?If the deal was just too good to be true, it probably was. One of the first indicators that a piece of Nikon merchandise might be Gray Market is if the price is considerably less than most other resellers.Additionally, a genuine Nikon Inc. USA product will include an Owners' Manual and Warranty Registration card in English. It will also include power cables (if applicable) designed for US style plugs. Any other language on the printed material or wrong cables indicates a Gray Market item.Another indication of a Gray Market product would be photocopied manuals or manually created software CD's. Nikon Inc. USA always provides professionally printed or duplicated materials with genuine products.What does owning a "Gray Market" Nikon product mean to you?Nikon Inc. USA cannot provide any technical support or warranty service on Gray Market items. Additionally Nikon Inc. USA cannot perform any fee-based repair work on Gray Market items. Please do not contact Nikon Inc. USA for help with any Gray Market products. Please contact the reseller or importer of your Gray Market items for warranty and service information as well as software updates and downloads.Does owning a "Gray Market" Nikon product mean I don't have a warranty?No! All Nikon products come with a warranty by the manufacturer. The designated Nikon service center will always repair "in warranty" Nikon products and perform "out of warranty" repairs. If you own a Gray Market product it will need to be returned to the reseller or importer for service. Refer to your reseller or to the warranty cards included with the product for service contact information.

Reviews.Title: COOLPIX AW100 DOG.
Reviews.Author: hotengineer
Reviews.Content: I bought one. I used it here in the States. Namely Arizona. I used it for 3 months. It worked OK. I took it to Ecuador. After the first battery recharge the lens system kept fogging up. I was unable to keep it from fogging. Basically, for my 3 month trip to Ecuador, I got 2 weeks of good pictures. After that the camera was a real DOG. I never got decent shots after the first battery recharge in Ecuador. The humidity killed the quality. I tried for satisfaction from Nikon. I had registered the camera upon purchase. They demanded that I supply the original sales receipt in order for me to return for their evaluation. I am an Engineer. A Quality Engineer, Rocket Scientist. I worked 10 years for ORBITAL SCIENCES, I was Flight Assurance for 3 launches out of Vandenberg. The COOLPIX AW100 IS NOT a good camera. Back in 3% to 21% humidity in AZ it works OK Again! DON'T BUY ONE.

Reviews.Title: cover is held on with tape!
Reviews.Author: sjsalina
Reviews.Content: Bought it for a trip to Thailand, took it snorkeling once, and noticed a gap between the cover and the camera when I got back on the boat. The gap kept getting bigger that day, and the cover finally fell right off. ITS HELD TOGETHER WITH DOUBLE SIDED TAPE! When I got back to the states, I took it straight back to the store. Just an FYI, if anyone decides to buy this item, KEEP EVERYTHING JUST IN CASE IT NEEDS TO BE RETURNED! Or else you'll find yourself being charged 15% plus...

Reviews.Title: Unreliable camera...dont ever take it on a vacation
Reviews.Author: Fredric Oliver
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Nikon AW 100 and it stopped working after 5 days of use, I returned it to amazon when I returned from vacation for a second AW 100, it failed after 4 days of useIt's one thing for a Nikon product to fail once but unbelievable for it to fail twice...wont buy it again

Reviews.Title: Not for SCUBA diving or ANY water sports!
Reviews.Author: goodel
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews posted here on Amazon I decided this was the camera for us! WRONG WRONG WRONG. This camera at best will take a couple of pool pix for about 20 mins and needs to rest. Before getting wet again. BTW the rest thing is what Nikon told me! I was under the impression this was going to be great for SCUBA diving, again wrong. It only goes down 33ft. And according to Nikon they wouldn't push that!So if you want to spend 250. on a camera that will take a couple of pix's in a pool and then needs a nap this one's for you.BTW  - I'm still looking for a REAL underwater camera if anyone can suggest.

Reviews.Title: Was happy at first
Reviews.Author: Brandyt
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when it was first available on the market thinking with nikon's reputation that it would live up to what it says it does. It takes some awesome pictures, at least for those of us who dont really care about perfect lighting, photo school or whatever you call it. However, i took pictures in a pool that was only 4 1/2 feet deep and the camera flooded. I sent it back and got fixed one in two weeks. I love how they send a little pamphlet that explains how to use it under water. Bottom line is the seals are faulty and i will not take the chance of the camera flooding again. I do not have a problem with my screen getting too hot but buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: It says 10m Water proof, at 4 it stopped working
Reviews.Author: Alex Flores
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specially to snorkel and little scuba photos. The camera was great for just snorkeling. But when we go deeper...  At 4 meters (12ft) The camera started like crazy. And when we reach 9m (27ft), the camera just turned off..  When we emerged, the camera was dead and with water in its interior.

Reviews.Title: Not Great Nikon
Reviews.Author: Serious Buyer
Reviews.Content: Camera was returned almost immediately to the factory for poor picture quality and repaired under warranty.  I have $100 P&S; cameras that take better pictures. After repairs the pictures are better, but not up to Nikon quality.  Try another brand is you need an underwater/dustproof camera.  They could have left off the GPS.  Too much gimmick and not enough quality.

Reviews.Title: Fogging up
Reviews.Author: Edward J. Patton "ejp"
Reviews.Content: Camera was great until about the 8th day of snorkeling in the BVIs. The viewer and lens are fogging up almost all the time when I immerse it in the water. The water isn't that cold (83 degrees) that fogging should be an issue (it wasn't a problem for 8 of the 10 days). I think I'll try the Fuji next. The camera isn't much use as it is.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality video
Reviews.Author: NYnordic
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Nikon COOLPIX AW100 one week ago and am extremely disappointed in the quality of the video, particularly when I use the zoom. If I try to zoom in on a person, the auto focus doesn't work. They appear as a big fuzzy blob. I'm now trying to decide if I ask for an exchange, hoping the next camera works appropriately or just return it and try another brand.

Reviews.Title: Returned it after a week!
Reviews.Author: elstone
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this camera. Initial pictures on land were just ok--not terribly sharp and with weak color. But at first use in swimming pool photos were fogged. Add to that a camera that is difficult to use and clunky....I could not return it fast enough!! I bought this to replace an old 7mp underwater Olympus, which still takes better pictures!I would not recommend this at all.

Reviews.Title: Not very good pictures for a Nikon camera
Reviews.Author: Mark K. Salamack
Reviews.Content: It has a lot of bells and whistles, but in the long run...the pictures it takes are not really good at all...very disapointing for a Nikon product. They should concentrate on a decent quality picture, rather than world maps and clocks, GPS and all kinds of other stuff that just uses battery power, and do not add to the quality of the picture...I wish I had bought the Panasonic TS4. Its preecessor, the TS3 had won awards and was a proven product, the TS4 is supposed to be better....I bought the Nikon, based upon my experience with my D90, and altough I know that there is no comparison, I have an old SONY 5 megapixel that takes much better quality pictures than this Nikon...if you are considering buying this camera...don't ...not untill you see the pictures it takes. Once you see them you will see what I mean...bad color, no clarity or detail...very, very disapointing

Reviews.Title: First Impression
Reviews.Author: Tek9
Reviews.Content: I bought this for an upcoming trip where I'll be exposed to water & hiking. The two things that made me opt out for the Nikon AW100 vs Canon's D20 was that it had a color option of black & the higher megapixels. While waiting for the battery to charge I went through and read some of the literature that came with the camera. I was immediately concerned when I read in the section of "For Your Safety" & how to care for your camera that it told you not to submerge or expose to moisture & not to expose to shock & vibrations. I initially thought that it might be some default typing for the Coolpix product family, but then I looked at the header & it's strictly for the Coolpix AW100. At this time I felt uneasy of actually exposing this camera to water & I am considering returning it. I wrote to Nikon about the print vs the advertising of what you can do & shouldn't do with this camera. Will post their response when I get it.After battery charged up, I fired some shots at different settings. For a point & shoot with a SanDisk Extreme SDHC card, it takes pretty fast pictures. I noticed about a 1/2 second in delay after pressing the shutter button. I'm already thinking that even though it's smaller & easier to carry around than my DSLR's, it's not going to be a good tool for taking pics of my kids which are constantly on the move. I also noticed that with the flash on auto 60% of my pics were over exposed.Overall, good size. Doesn't look or feel too rugged though, I wouldn't dare try to test it's "5ft Shockproof" advertising.

Reviews.Title: Nice, convenient camera!  Could be easier to use.
Reviews.Author: PurdueFan
Reviews.Content: This camera fit our need well...  something easy to carry that wouldn't be damaged by water, sand, etc.  It takes great pictures in daylight, and we loved the underwater photo/video feature!  Captured some really cool underwater vacation pictures with it!  It has a lot of features.Pros:- Convenient size, easy to carry around in your pocket.- Excellent underwater photos and video.  Daylight photos turned out great!- Decent battery life...  we recharged it each night and it was fine for the next day of moderate usage.- GPS tagging is cool.Cons:- Could have an easier menu and navigation system.- Can be confusing with the different buttons.. you have to configure the button on the side to be GPS, etc.- Does not take very good pictures in low-light.  We didn't have much luck with low-light scenarios.- Battery charger is bulky.  Our Canon has a small wall plug-in charger that it very convenient.  This comes with a long cord and the charger itself is not very compact.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX AW100 - waterproof/shockproof
Reviews.Author: Bridge
Reviews.Content: I'm usually an SLR user and only use my old (now broken) panasonic to take 'snapshots' when an SLR is just to big to carry.I was very impressed with the Nikon COOLPIX AW100. The photo size and quality largely exceeded my expectations.And the zoom and focus range is incredible, especially when you consider that this is restricted (waterproof).Video quality when later displayed on a big screen is  quite good with minimal issues with focus when zoomed in excessively close.I Managed to film an entire snowboard run in flat light with full focus change as I changed my zoom through the video.Still yet to explore fully all the features but am pleased with the amount of manual settings this camera has.The only issue I have so far is an occasional random image change when viewing my photos on the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon digital Camera
Reviews.Author: cdalaska
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the camera.  Lightweight and easy to use.  The strap could have been better but over all very happy with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!!!!
Reviews.Author: Greg Kindel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this camera for a special trip to Punta Cana.  We were so excited to take underwater shots.  However, after only one use in only about 5 ft of water, the screen went black and doesn't work.  The real kicker is that we bought in March, packed into our suitcase after inspecting and reading the book, took out only while vacationing last week.  Guess what...time is up to return it!!!Feel so ripped off!!!!!  I've purchased a $5 disposable camera that holds up longer and better!!!I would think twice before you purchase this camera.

Reviews.Title: NOT waterproof!
Reviews.Author: Ayako Sawanobori
Reviews.Content: I am soooo disappointed.  I used it ONCE on a kayaking trip and it is already ruined. Water got into the camera and it is not useless.  It's a few months past the return expiration date, so I now have a foggy camera that I cannot even use.  Can I return this?!?!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: The Nikon COOLPIX AW100 16 MP CMOS Waterproof Digital Camera with GPS and Full HD 1080p Video is really amazing!  This camera is for the outdoors person that goes hiking, rafting, skiing, etc.  My dad had me order this camera for him.  It takes amazing photos and video that you can't wait to share with friends and family.  It's been dropped in snow and gotten really wet while rafting and it keeps on ticking.  I suggest you buy this orange color if you're like my dad who loses stuff easily.  The orange color is easy to spot in the snow if you lose it like he has.  I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: The AW100 is the 2011 model--even the AW110 is selling for less!
Reviews.Author: Curt Story
Reviews.Content: Just an FYI--I noticed this model is being sold for more than a newer model--on Amazon too!  There's no reason to buy this older model, except at a deep discount. I got the AW110, as a Nikon refurb, for nearly $100 less! The current Nikon model is the AW120 (it has a faster f2.8 lens). Hope this helps someone. :)

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Marianna Zambrano
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. Very very good quality. a very good option for parents with small childrens. The image quality is excellent

Reviews.Title: Good quality
Reviews.Author: chiki_cam
Reviews.Content: We used it during our vacation for underwater purposes mainly, had no issues with leakage, and the quality of the pictures and movies is quite good.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Kirk E. Kemmler "Bean Eatin Fool"
Reviews.Content: Works great underwater. Purchased for a Caribbean trip and was able to shoot some really great clips. The GPS feature is great as well helping to keep track of where the shots were taken.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: We love this camera.They Grandkids love that they can take it in the pool.We have gotten some great underwater pic's of them and friends

Reviews.Title: AWFUL for low light/indoor pictures
Reviews.Author: katie
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great pictures in outdoor/high light environments and underwater photos. In low light environments it's AWFUL- I've tried multiple settings and the pictures either come out blurry or with the orange tint to them.

Reviews.Title: Died
Reviews.Author: Juan, PTY
Reviews.Content: I only had the oportunity to use it 3 times, 2 in pools and 1 in beach and the camera died.The seals are not well designed since as well as you closed it, water ingress into the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix AW100
Reviews.Author: lynn
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix AW100 is a great little camera for anyone who likes to snorkel.  It's easy to use and took good underwater pictures.  Further, it took acceptable pictures on land as well.  I had no issues with the functionality of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Backpacker's dream
Reviews.Author: William Cardinal "William E. Cardinal Jr."
Reviews.Content: I used to hump my favorite camera from another company, full size digital and that was a bear, not to mention I was always scared it was going over the mountain or into the stream. This baby takes EXCELLENT quality photos, is lite and much more portable. The GPS feature is particularly awesome when overlaying maps, I always write down compass direction to really orient people when showing off the photos. I don't worry when it rains, and the strap stays around my neck when in precarious positions, so no dropping worries.

Reviews.Title: Would Recommend Again & Again
Reviews.Author: Jenna Rae
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with this camera.  I bought it for the underwater aspect but have begun using it for all my picture taking.  Pictures and video are great quality and color.  Camera holds a charge for a long time.  Buttons could be a little bigger but they're workable.  I've recommended this camera to so many friends and I'll continue to do so.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: Schufles
Reviews.Content: just a great camera. waterproof and handles very well in the cold. I have not dropped it to test the shockprove up it seems rugged enough for what it is rated. takes very fast pictures! turn it on, and once the image is in focus you snap and take the pic, very responsive.

Reviews.Title: Only had for a few months
Reviews.Author: Amanda C Wachob
Reviews.Content: I bought this item online, pretty satisfied, although it doesn't do well when subject is in motion.  Haven't had the chance to try underwater.

Reviews.Title: Cool pix underwater
Reviews.Author: Kathy3
Reviews.Content: Love this camera especially the underwater shots. It is easy to use and very compact. It makes a nice gift.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: FIVE-O
Reviews.Content: Great camera, the only thing about it that I don't like is there is no lens cover. If it had one I would give it 5 stars all the way.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Love this Bad Boy!
Reviews.Author: Chelsea
Reviews.Content: This camera is sick and indestructible! It a bad ass camera for sure! I use it all the time and have so many great memories captured through it!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Elisia Greenwood
Reviews.Content: This camera is excellent for both in and out of the water. It takes great shots and you don't have to worry about it getting wet making it extremely versitle. Light weight and can pretty much go on any adventure

Reviews.Title: This camera is great for most purposes
Reviews.Author: David Leggat "Delphin007"
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for almost a year and it has performed very well. I used it in sub-zero temperatures, in chlorinated and sea water, and for everyday use. I also dropped it rather hard when I got it. There is a small dent on the camera, but no change in performance. Underwater pictures looked great, the only problem I had was making sure the lens was dry if I came out the water. It often was, but some pictures show water droplets. It works well with a camera float too. There doesn't seem to be a way to turn off the tap feature completely. Bluetooth might make this product better so I wouldn't have to open the seal as often. Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: It took good underwater pics on my last vacation as well as regular pics and videos. I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Used for about six months before it fogged
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I used this camera hiking and on the beach for about six months before it got condensation inside.  This caused the lens to ALWAYS fog up and the pictures were useless.  On the other hand, Nikon replaced it with the AW110 which has not had this issue yet.Pros:- The GPS works well and embeds the coordinates and location info right into the picture- Pictures are pretty good both in and out of the water

Reviews.Title: A bit difficult for me to use
Reviews.Author: Barbara Steinman "Cat Pillow"
Reviews.Content: This takes good pictures and works underwater.  Where I had problems was with the control for making movies.  It seems that just about every time I use this camera, I end up hitting the button to make movies by mistake.  I end up with lots of unwanted, unexpected movies and run down batteries.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Ddalrymple
Reviews.Content: very good camera so far.Its easy to use and seems pretty durable.Takes great pictures and videos.The battery seems to last a decent amount of time too.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little camera!
Reviews.Author: Pamela
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on a great white shark, cage diving trip and you would not believe the awesome pictures I got. Just remember to change the settings (for the elements) and you will get great pics. So compact and easy to use. I would definitely purchase another one, if something happened to mine.

Reviews.Title: Lasted less than 1 year.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Hale
Reviews.Content: I have only used this camera 8 times previously and on our last snorkeling trip the monitor/screen stopped working. I spent $299 and feel the product has not lived up to the expected quality for that price. It's less than 2 years old and is no longer functional.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after 1 day-battery will not charge ;(
Reviews.Author: Aristotle Health
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for a vacation, knowing we would want to take pictures while snorkeling. We were not able to recharge the battery so it is now useless.

Reviews.Title: Bet point and shoot I ever had
Reviews.Author: Alexander Chimon "aceman"
Reviews.Content: I'm usually a canon fan, but for some reason I love this camera way more and have used it in the water hundreds of time and it works great!

Reviews.Title: View screen blacked out on the first day of our vacation
Reviews.Author: Tracy Marcotte
Reviews.Content: We were excited to get this camera. It worked great for the first three days. On the third day the view screen blacked out. We were out of the country so customer service for Nikon was no help at all. Basically told us that we were out of luck. We were unable to capture any photos on our honeymoon. No pictures of our dives. I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix Aw100
Reviews.Author: SMG
Reviews.Content: Another fantastic product from Nikon. I have not had any problems as of yet. Provides great pictures, and easy to download all to computer.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera, but freezes up
Reviews.Author: Melinda cline
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for shallow (snorkeling) underwater pics and video and so I wouldn't have to worry about water damage in everyday use. I also have young kids around, and didn't want to have to worry about dropping damage. I used it for snorkeling and it worked ok. Pictures are decent. It frequently had too slow of shutter speed in auto mode so pics were blurred. The major problem is that the first one I got would freeze up(no button would work and it wouldn't turn off) and I would have to take the battery out to restart it. I exchanged it and the new one is doing the same thing. I just have to remember to turn it off after every picture instead of letting it go into sleep mode.  I hadn't seen this in any other review, but maybe I missed it. Frustrating.  Not convinced any other would be better, so just going to work with it.  I have not had it leak yet.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: This camera is just an amazing one,Coz i have used this last month on my vacation,and the result was awesome and clear photos inside the water,,Love it

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Donald J. Koller "smasher"
Reviews.Content: This thing takes great underwater pics. The only problem I had was seeing the screen under water in the sunlight. Other than that it works great.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Lyndsay Tyler
Reviews.Content: This camera takes awesome pictures and has many cool features. It was worth the cost for sure! The GPS is a neat additional feature.

Reviews.Title: waterproof
Reviews.Author: jeryork
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter who wanted a point and shoot camera around water, She is very pleased with it. Works very well.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Carey L. Eddins "dsgnce"
Reviews.Content: this camera takes great pictures, whether on land or underwater.  I used it on a trip to the Bahamas and dove about 30 feet down to take some pictures of sea turtles, coral, fish, etc.  all of the pictures came out great and clear.  I continue to use this as our main "event" camera.  Also, no leaks, no problems with the seal.  I have rinsed it after using in water and it is still like new after filling up several 16gb SD cards.

Reviews.Title: love the underwater pics
Reviews.Author: Amit K. Singh
Reviews.Content: a great camera to have on active adventure trips.  hard to figure out the GPS feature but takes good pictures even under water.

Reviews.Title: It's ok I guess
Reviews.Author: Douglas K. Jones "D  Jones"
Reviews.Content: I used this camara several times in water without incident, and it took wonderful pictures in and out of water.  I give it to my friend to use in the jacuzzi and it sucked in water somehow and became unusable.  Since I wasn't the one operating it, it may have been operater error.  I found that if you are not sure how to properly operate the camara, you could easily and mistakenly open it while in use in water.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, good value.
Reviews.Author: Clifford R. Collier
Reviews.Content: Haven't had it too long but seems durable; takes good pics and video.  Will hold further until proven in the long run.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: cb@northernvirginia "cb@northernvirginia"
Reviews.Content: Well worth the price.  Takes great underwater pictures.  You simply MuST follow the directions for its care with rinsing and drying.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Neola
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic, rugged and takes beautiful pictures and videos. I bought it with the olympus strap float and just hooked the float around my arm when going snorkelling.My one complaint is that after one use, the front cover appears to not be intact and slightly coming away from the camera and I had to press it down to get it back on there. However, this did not appear to affect the camera's ability to take pictures and there was no fogging up afterwards.

Reviews.Title: Good pictures on land or in the water
Reviews.Author: William A. Brown
Reviews.Content: This camera is recommended by a family member that scuba dives regularly. We used it for snorkeling on vacation and were impressed by the quality of the pictures in the water and on land.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for pcice
Reviews.Author: socksman
Reviews.Content: Great point and shoot for early photographers. Settings are easy to use and intuitive, fun to use underwater as well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for outdoorsy types
Reviews.Author: Steve Schneider
Reviews.Content: An excellent durable stand-alone camera. I have taken it rafting, hiking, swimming, and camping. The GPS tracks bike rides well, and the battery life is better than any smartphone. The pictures are crisp, but I haven't found a reliable high-speed indoor setting. The underwater, panoramic, and landscape settings are excellent. The only setback is the same setback all digital cameras now face: it is not imbedded in a phone.

Reviews.Title: Nikon should do something abiut the ink
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "linghuey"
Reviews.Content: Love this but after being in chlorine, sea, sand, and snow the ink on the buttons fade or are gone completely so it takes me a while to figure out which button I am pressing all the time.  Really sucks.

Reviews.Title: Decent, but not perfect camera
Reviews.Author: E. Engel
Reviews.Content: This is a decent camera with some flaws. The photos are comparable to other point and shoot cameras, but not as nice as those taken with an SLR. Also the GPS function needs to be turned on and is t enabled by default (which is a major feature). We traveled abroad for almost a year before I realized that the GPS wasn't enabled. It is decent when it comes to water. We dropped it in about 30ft working on the boat  and recovered it fine.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Destiny T.
Reviews.Content: Takes awesome pics. Left it overnight in the snow, it got stepped on and still worked. It has been dropped in water, splashed with water and on a very sandy beach. The camera is incredibly tough. Takes great stills and action shots. I don't mountain climb or do any kind of extreme outdoor activity, I got this camera to stand up to my 14 month old, hyperactive 8 year old and their mom who is a serial dropper/spiller who takes too many pictures. Trust me when I say this camera has been through a ridiculous amount of abuse.

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera
Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I was going snorkeling down in Dominican Republic.  The camera worked, but the pictures on the underwater setting were very washed out looking.  I only snorkeled for about 2 hours.  The next day I was taking pictures with it, and noticed a haze right in the middle of the pictures.  Water had gotten inside the camera.  After waiting a while (and letting the camera sit in the sun) the haze went away after the water inside evaporated, but it would come and go.  Thank goodness I brought my other camera with me or I would have missed a lot of great pictures.  My other camera is a Nikon & never had any problems with it, but this one was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Great for underwater adventure !!
Reviews.Author: PistolPete1952
Reviews.Content: Works perfectly underwater ~ whether I'm in my pool, lake (kayaking) &/or SCUBA diving in the ocean .... NEVER leaks and ALWAYS takes good/GREAT pic.'s in or out of the water !!

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera for the price!!!
Reviews.Author: Mario Fendry Utama "dought"
Reviews.Content: I was an amateur in digital photography and bought two Nikon cameras (P300 and AW100). I bought these for the intention on taking pictures of kids outdoor sports and family water sports related activities... and of course vacations.The top-most thing I like about this camera is the high-speed capture that takes up-to 16 pictures in series when you hold-down the snap-button. So far, I have not missed the precious moments!!!What I really like:1. Light weight and compact2. Take amazing good pictures3. Outdoor location tagging via built-in GPS4. Water proof5. ToughThe ONLY one feature I hope it has; even though I understand it is due to circuitry protection from water damage -Batter charging: It has to be charged on an external chargerMultiple vacations tested in the swimming pool, at the beach, taking under water videos:- Puerto vallarta- Cancun- HongKong- South Korea- Singapore- Jakarta- BaliLike the P300, it produces excellent color balance, clarity and (less impressive than P300) on semi/medium low-light. Sadly, I was not able to compare and explore more of its function as my car was broken into and happened to have the camera (serial number is 32108552) in the car. And, I replaced the stolen one for the same model (AW100); I did not go for AW110 as I think the WIFI is pointless for outdoor and battery drains.

Reviews.Title: Good functional camera for my needs
Reviews.Author: Eric K "Just zis guy"
Reviews.Content: I like this camera.  It meets my expectations and needs, which include photo documentation of field projects at work and recreational photos with decent resolution.  Before i bought this camera online a year ago, I compared it with other brands of rugged outdoor digital cameras via online reviews.  Some cameras with lower resolution had comparable picture quality (measured by objective means) in these reviews.  One feature that attracted me to this camera was that it comes with a little bitty filter adapter, so if i like, i can play with filters (it actually takes fair photos with an IR filter -needs a tripod or steady base for that, of course) and protect the lens with either a skylight filter or lens cap. The adapter is plastic and the tab that holds it onto the camera body will wear out with long term use.  Also, the filter size that fits the adapter is pretty oddball: 40.5mm, which means you probably have to find a filter or lens cap through a comprehensive online photography supply shop or through mail order.  On a few occasions, I have gotten odd reflections in photos while using a filter.  Generally, I am very happy with the picture quality and resolution of photos i have taken with this camera.  I have gotten nice resolution on the closeup setting while capturing flowers or bugs or the odd soil or rock texture.  Photos and movie clips that i have taken of stage performances at night or in dark theatres turn out fairly sharp if the stage is brightly lit.  I generally have problems with blurry or grainy photos in low lighting conditions if i am not using the flash or a tripod, but that is not unusual for many cameras.  The controls on the camera are mostly intuitive, but the camera settings buttons and menu buttons on the back are pretty small and difficult to operate while wearing gloves.  The GPS function was not something I was interested in when i purchased the camera, but it seems to work.  At one point I copied the Lat/Long information from the EXIF data of a photo file and plugged it into Google Maps; and the location it yielded seemed pretty ball-parky.  It might be my imagination, but the compass and panorama functions seem to flake out in strong electrical or magnetic fields, like near high voltage power lines or large chunks of steel, but one can recalibrate these functions in the Map/GPS menu using the compass correction function. I have never dunked this camera underwater and don't intend to without a waterproof case after reading so many accounts of rugged outdoor digital cameras leaking.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get my husband a digital underwater camera that didn't cost an arm and a leg but still performed.  This fit the bill perfectly.  He loves it and only wishes I had given it to him before he went to the Keys.  Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: niceeee camera
Reviews.Author: Tathys
Reviews.Content: excelent camera I used alrady in the beach and in the pool work perfectly the picture come nice, just have carefull and keep clean the lent.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Vanessa
Reviews.Content: takes good bright pictures under the water I took it too cancun and it took awesome pictures while I was swimming with the dolphins I like this camera a lot

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: steiny805
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great waterproof camera.  I've never gotten excited about a camera before but I really do love this camera.  It works great in the water and my wife and I bring this for all of our trips.  We get great pictures and the waterproof feature is awesome.  The only complaint is that it does not take good nighttime pictures.  Would not recommend if you are looking to take pictures at night with this camera as you will be disappointed.  But if you want a good waterproof camera for day time pictures then I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Neat Camera
Reviews.Author: Linda Honerkamp
Reviews.Content: It is bright in color and cool looking. Used it to capture surf boarders at the California beaches this summer. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: M. Maldonado
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my wife, she loves it. It takes great pictures and the underwater pictures are great as well. Waterproof is awesome, never have to worry about the camera getting destroyed.

Reviews.Title: So much fun!
Reviews.Author: J. Starkey "js"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera.  I have taken lots of underwater video and pictures and they have come out fantastic!  Regular picture taking is great, lots of options as on any digital camera and the pictures are clear and look wonderful!  Very happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Brigid
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for our honeymoon in Fiji.  I knew we would want to take some under water pictures and not have to worry about it if it got knocked around a bit.  It has been a  Great camera.  The only thing I was a little disappointed in was when we took a hike to a waterfall, I went to take some pictures and the lens got foggy.  The pictures turned out looking very hazy.  The lens ended up clearing up after a while but it shouldn't have done that at all.  We did take the camera down with us on a dive and it did great down low and the pictures turned out great!  Other than that one time at the waterfall we have been very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Size - Shape - Function is just ok
Reviews.Author: Boise Nelson
Reviews.Content: I got this as our family does lots of active outdoor adventures together (rafting, snow skiing, boating, mtn biking, hiking, camping, etc.).  I felt this product would offer solid solution in price/size/toughness for us.  I was not expecting DSLR quality photos but did expect better pic quality then we are getting.  It is very touchy leaving minimal room for error on taking photos and that you must really slow down on getting the 'hold button half way down' before taking photo.  This does help on static photos but action photos are often blurry, even when using the 'Sports' setting.  I am finding the best method is to put into continuous mode and hope that 1 out of the 20 or so that get exposed turn out.  Somewhat disappointed here.Other then that I love everything else, the size, waterproof, etc.  In fact the kids take photos frequently in the pool and this function has surprisingly been better then expected.  Overall if you want 'decent' photos on a camera that is easy to carry around then this one works for you.

Reviews.Title: Solid camera
Reviews.Author: Sustainability
Reviews.Content: Good features easy to operate.  Very easy to obscure lens when holding camera to take pictures.  But a fair price.  Fairly compact.

Reviews.Title: Works great for underwater photos!
Reviews.Author: Musican09
Reviews.Content: This camera works well for underwater photos during vacation, which is why I bought it. The down side of the camp style is it does blend in, but we tied a bright color to the strap and that problem was solved. Sometimes pictures look a tad blurry since the autofocus sometimes takes a little longer than others. Overall I would recommend this camera if you need an underwater camera. Best one I have owned.

Reviews.Title: Screen went black on 4th day of use
Reviews.Author: T. Martin
Reviews.Content: Was very disappointed with this camera. Bought it specifically for waterproof / under water abilities. Went on vacation with it and took it to swim with sea turtles and shoot coral reefs. 1/2 way through dive the screen went black though the camera had power. VERY disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Best outdoor waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: cutie19
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera almost a year already. Its picture quality is very good even underwater. Some people complaint leaking or defective after used but I found no problem in my experience. I think those people just misused or did not close the battery door tight enough. I usually rinse the camera with tap water after each underwater usage. Those preset smart picture mode are handy and shoot good quality pictures. Of course it is no way to compare to DSLR quality, but for point and shot outdoor camera, Nikon AW100 is the best choice.

Reviews.Title: great camers
Reviews.Author: Kellie Baker
Reviews.Content: i was totally surprised by how great this camera is.It is 100% waterproof.i used it in the pool ocean river ect. just run it under a water tap for a couple min after to clean it off allow to dry before opening the battery/cable/card door no problems.it takes great photos and videos it has a great optical zoom that it also has a digital zoom to go further.the battery lasts a long time i take alot of photos and videos i have a second battery but have only needed it once. just dont buy those cheap off brand batteries buy the nikon it is worth the extra 10 bucks. you cant beat the value of this camera. also just a tip buy a scandisc extream card just in case they are waterproof freeze proof also

Reviews.Title: Can't live without .... Best rugged cam ever
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Hage "Snowman"
Reviews.Content: Having owned the AW100 for almost 2 years now it had undergone the roughest tests imaginable. Used it for climbing, diving (yes and sometimes slightly beyond 10 meters depth), snowmobiling, off roading, caving, snowshoeing in the worst weather and blizzard scenarios and many other improvised activities, it still functions flawlessly even though the body and the lcd screen are full of deep scratches, I even lost it in a mud hole stepped on by a 4x4. Excellent quality pictures (It's a Nikon), brilliant videos, fantastic GPS functions. I highly recommend this camera and surely will stick to its lineup.

Reviews.Title: I really did want to love this camera, but....
Reviews.Author: Robert C Flickinger
Reviews.Content: First off let me preface with saying that I wanted a new camera to take on our up-coming trip to Kauai to get HD footage while (shallow) SCUBA diving.I was in the market for a new waterproof camera and did a little research and decided on the Nikon AW100. I wanted a camera that took 1080P HD video and I liked that it had 16MP's and a CMOS chip. I found it on sale at my local Office Max and said "what the hell" and bought it. It cost about as much as it is here on Amazon. I had a few really good months on the lake with this camera, on the boat, in the water, under the water, and thought it was a good underwater camera. See some of my You Tube videos from this camera by typing RobertFlickinger AW100.I liked the interface and functions and took a lot of nice pics and HD videos. Until one day at the river everybody was jumping off the bridge (about 15'up)and decided to jump in while taking a video. So in I went, and when I came to the surface and inspected it I found that the display was black. Thinking that I might have just accidentally turned it off, I swam to the shore. Upon inspecting it I found that the DISPLAY SCREEN HAD FILLED WITH WATER. Later I removed the back display screen with a #3 Torx, (a specialty tool that I could only find online), cleaned it and dried the insides. The camera mostly works now with the exception of a couple of functions but can be worked around. But it still has those malfunctions.IF SOMEONE FROM NIKON READS THIS, CAN YOU HELP ME PLEASE?I guess I should have bought the extended warranty but Consumer Reports says to never do that, as in the long run you will save money.I originally  decided on this camera because it was rated for 33' underwater and was supposed to be shock proof from a 5' drop on a hard surface. I have an older Canon that was rated for only 13' underwater and jumped off that same bridge with it and did a lot off other crazy things; water skiing and crashing, snow skiing and crashing, and never a problem. As a matter of fact that Canon still works fine, but it only takes 480 video and is only 8MP.If you are never going to go swimming with the AW100, never going to jump off that damn bridge, and are only looking for a camera that takes nice videos and pics in the rain or on the beach, then I would say buy it. But if you are looking for a point-and-shoot that you actually want to use under the water, then do a little more research.If someone out there in Amazonland can tell me which waterproof camera to buy, I would love to hear your recommendation.Pros: 16MP, CMOS sensor, nice 1080p video.Cons: (somewhat, but) Not really waterproof.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: B
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this camera. I like being able to take photos and video under water. Also nice to be able to use it in wet places like rafting.

Reviews.Title: Great and convenient waterproof camera!
Reviews.Author: Ben Rainchild
Reviews.Content: I am a river guide and I carry this on whitewater rafting trips. Excellent close up and wide. Dosen't do the best job with distance and the sky. But it's a tiny camera. I love it. Video is great too.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater/outdoors camera
Reviews.Author: KRISTIN A VINJE
Reviews.Content: We ordered this prior to a trip in Belize and it did not disappoint!  We took it on several snorkeling trips, cave tubing, zip-lining, and on the beach.  All of our water photos all turned out great. At one point, i noticed some condensation under that view screen right before submerging it, but it went away and didn't affect the quality of our photos.  We bought the olympus strap float to keep it buoyant, together they worked out great.  I would highly recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Fantatic Camera
Reviews.Author: Laura Larsen
Reviews.Content: I got this camera right before a camping trip and it worked so well, even underwater.The battery last a long time. Can't say enough great things about the mapping capabilities they rock!!Love it wish I had bought it sooner.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix Waterproof Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Whitney
Reviews.Content: I took this camera with me to Destin, Florida on a family vacation.  I am not a novice with digital cameras but am not a techy either.I love this camera. It takes great pictures on land and underwater.  I had no problems with the underwater features (i.e. leaking, lens fogging up, etc.)As long as you read the quick start manual and a little bit of the full manual on how to set the correct settings (which is pretty self explanitory) you will be ready to take great pictures in no time.The battery life is great as well.  I took 300 pictures in the week trip we took and only had to charge the battery once.Overall this is a great camera!  I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a rugged, waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: NOT waterproof like it claims
Reviews.Author: Colleen
Reviews.Content: I figured oh hey 33ft awesome. so i went to the river where it wasnt even submerged completely and if it gets wet, when u take a pic, there are blurry waterspots all over the pics ruining them. everytime i got it near water id have to take the battery out and let it dry overnight. Not exactly what i was picturing. Other than that, camera works OK

Reviews.Title: perfect for field  sampling
Reviews.Author: Pablo Vigliano
Reviews.Content: Thsi little vamera is `perfect for field data recording and keeping track when you are a field biologist working in the middle of no where

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Kate O'Connor "Katesie"
Reviews.Content: Glad that I got this one. I have quite a few cameras in my days... But this one is bigger than I though, and the photos are just great. It's no power zoom. But I'd have to say it is great for the fact that this camera is water proof, drop resistant, and freeze resistant. Good choice here. This is a rugged camera. Not a model and family portrait camera. There is a difference.  Enjoying my new toy!

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: Johnathan
Reviews.Content: It takes great quality pictures and is very durable. It doesn't zoom out very far but I bought it for mainly because it was good for any environment and a fairly reasonable price. I don't have to worry what kind of weather I will been in either.

Reviews.Title: Grainy pictures
Reviews.Author: CP
Reviews.Content: Even the standard VGA size for photos comes out well on most cameras... an overrated camera like this, I expected it to at least take good standard photos even in small size. Did not even try it out underwater before I returned it for another underwater digital.

Reviews.Title: Pricey and not thoroughly "waterproof"
Reviews.Author: Lara M. Lichten
Reviews.Content: At first I was very pleased with this camera, having been my first purchase of an underwater camera (though not my only experience using one). Compared to others I have tried, this one is a bit less impressive. While it serves its purpose underwater (if the water is clear enough, that is), it takes a while for the lens to dry off to take smear- and drip-free photos in dry air. Additionally, in heat/humidity, the lens fogs up, preventing clear images from being taken when not underwater. Moisture must have gotten inside during some of our underwater exploits. It's disappointing to have this problem in an UNDERWATER camera. An additional complaint I have to report regards the camera's lack of promptness in rapidly taking multiple photos. It takes a good 10 seconds to recuperate and ready itself for another image to be shot, which is frustrating for users who are not familiar with the camera (i.e. volunteer tourists who offer to take a photo for you, and then don't realize that 1. the button needs to be pressed and HELD for at least 2-3 seconds in order to effectively take the photo, and 2. it takes a LONG time for the camera to ready itself for subsequent photo-taking attempts). I wouldn't recommend this camera at the top of my list for buying an underwater camera. However, it has done the job, mostly, and is less aggravating than other cameras that have shutters (which have caused me the most problems in my past experience with digital cameras).

Reviews.Title: Works awesome
Reviews.Author: D. Goodrum "Dave G"
Reviews.Content: I've taken some amazing underwater shots with this.  The GPS feature is over rated, but the underwater performance is very good.  I had an older Olympus 1050 SW, and this one is twice as good as that one.  Well worth it for our vacations to the beach and the Caribbean and Mexico.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: LISBETH Y MAYO
Reviews.Content: I HAD BOUGHT LIKE 4 WATERPROOF CAMERAS BEFORE THIS ONE, AND FOR SURE THIS IS THE MOST AMAZING CAMERA I HAVE EVER HAD! TOTALLY RECOMMENDED, GREAT QULITY, GREAT PURCHASE!

Reviews.Title: Great camera but complicated
Reviews.Author: Ruky
Reviews.Content: Used it for our honeymoon. It works great and has crisp pictures. Have not used it under water yet but looking forward to testing it.Lots of features I need to read about. Not as intuitive as I would like. Overall great camera.

Reviews.Title: Didn't last more than a few months
Reviews.Author: Blondie
Reviews.Content: Expected more after reading reviews. The camera failed after just a few months of very light use. Search a little more for a better camera.

Reviews.Title: works great underater
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Very stylish, the video and underwater feature works great. When playing the video back on the camera, the sound doesn't get very loud but when playing a video recorded from the camera on the computer, the sound is just fine

Reviews.Title: Nikon AW100 -This camera does what it should!
Reviews.Author: Nancy Olds "sealady"
Reviews.Content: They must've broken the mold on the Nikon AW100, because its successor is not living up to the hype! After checking on reviews, on Amazon, for the new Nikon AW110, I have decided to stay with the older model, the Nikon AW100.  I read too many reviews describing camera failure when taken into the water at relatively shallow depths.  I am a SCUBA diver who went to Bonaire (Netherland Antilles in the Caribbean) this past July.  I used a pro underwater camera outfit for my deep dives, but I also did some shallow offshore dives that hovered around 30 feet.  Sometimes I slipped a few feet below. I always checked my depth gauge to make sure that I stayed on course, even on a night dive with the Nikon AW100.  The camera worked fabulously well!  I've even taken it kayaking and to the pool with no issues.  Perhaps the Nikon AW110 needs to be recalled.  I am sticking with what works for me now until the lumps are taken out of the Nikon AW110.  Thank you Amazon for posting these reviews!

Reviews.Title: Can't say enough about this fantastic underwater camera!
Reviews.Author: weluvpugs
Reviews.Content: This was a gift from a friend who bought it on Amazon a couple of mos ago for $235!  The WiFi updated version is at Costco for $310, but I didn't want that version.I'm an ocean swimmer in Hawaii and use this all the time, getting rave reviews from everyone!  It's super easy to use, takes amazing pix while I'm dealing with current, elusive fish, holding my breath and they come out so sharp and clear. It has this adaptable box in the view finder that seems to track the moving object to hone in and focus, it really works.I would absolutely recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Durable
Reviews.Author: A. Pulido
Reviews.Content: Dropped it on my first day of use on a concrete floor.  While it got a scuff mark, it didn't skip a beat and takes great pictures.  I still need to get used to all it's functions.

Reviews.Title: Grand Canyon Raft Trip Approved...
Reviews.Author: simplyfoote
Reviews.Content: This camera stayed tucked into my PFD, attached to its Croakie float strap, buckled to my PFD. I could take pics quickly this way. Thanks to the fast start-up time and the waterproofing I documented most of the Grand Canyon from my raft when I wasn't paddling or holding on with both hands. 3 batteries were good for 6 days on the Colorado River. Class 5 rapid tested... class 5 rapid smiles documented. Excellent camera. 625 pics, 5 min of video from that inaugural trip and I don't plan on leaving it behind on any future trip.

Reviews.Title: Lens fogs up from the inside
Reviews.Author: Mother Sunshine
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, when the lens is not fogged-up. It fogs up from the inside which means somehow water got inside. I used it one time for about 5 gentle minutes in the water. All other uses have been on land in regular conditions. I haven't even begun to use it in the rugged way it advertises. I've been very careful with the seal door, followed all the rules, haven't let anything get caught in the door, nothing that would break the seal. So it's defective. I wish I could return it.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Tiffany deRamos
Reviews.Content: This camera takes nice pictures.  You really need to get up close to the fish to get the best picture - so that is pretty tricky.  The zoom doesn't provide the best clarity out of the water, but in the water, helps to get better pictures of the fish.  I think it would help if there was some light produced by it to get nicer pictures under water.  Still lots of fun to use this camera.  Have some really fun vacation pictures.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for a year. Now very slow write speed
Reviews.Author: dcdude
Reviews.Content: This camera worked great for a year, and it indeed took underwater HD movies. The macro function is very good, better than my Canon DSLR.Now, after the warranty expired(!) the image write speed is v-e-r-y slow, like up to 30 seconds until I can take another photo. Also, I don't think it's recording movies. We've never dropped it, and even if we did, it's supposed to be shock proof as well. We've even tried a different SD card to no avail. I guess I should have stuck with Canon...

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: The person who received it was happy as all get out to get it, for the purpose it was bought it has been amazing

Reviews.Title: Best rugged camera
Reviews.Author: Em
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my husband who is an avid fisherman. I'm jealous. I totally want one now. Great quality pictures! They blow up to 8x10 with great quality. Shoots well in all conditions. Don't know how much he has used the underwater mode because he usually shoots underwater video and stills with our Kodak playsport cameras but this takes much better quality stills than that camera. Bought myself another camera a few years ago that I never use because this camera has much better quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great product and quality. I like so much. It is a good product and good price I would buy again. Thank you.
Reviews.Author: Sinometer pen type multimeter
Reviews.Content: Great product and quality. I like so much. It is a good product and good price I would buy again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: a winner
Reviews.Author: Shirley
Reviews.Content: It fulfilled every claim it made, unlike most products of today, I really like it and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Amatuer user - love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am not great with cameras and if I can make a picture come out blurry, I will inevitably do so accidentally. We also have two little kids and are replacing a camera that had the shutter break when it was dropped.  I also hate having to replace batteries all the time.This camera is perfect.  Every picture is easy and clear, the shutter speed is fast so you can get a lot quickly in a row, it is easy to charge and battery life lasts a long time (weeks with use a few times a week), and although it has already been dropped several times, it is still working perfectly.  My only complaint is the hand strap - I have rather small hands (female) and can't fit my hand through so I don't know how anyone else would. This is a minor problem and I just need to find another regular sized one to use with it. I have not tested the waterproof feature yet.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Badreyyah Alireza
Reviews.Content: I am learning on the camera. Easy to use. Tested the picture and video. Looks good. Will be taking it on vacation.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Fishing Camera
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It's perfect for toting around while I'm out fishing or just about any other activity.  It fits in my pocket, its light, battery life seems good and it's made for one hand operation.  The only complaint I have is the pictures are a little soft.  At full size, you can't tell but if your planning on cropping the big photos down much, you might be disappointed.  But that's not really what this is for.  This camera is for snap shots and some cropping can be done without loss of quality.So far the camera is waterproof and has worked well for me.  The video modes are great.  Sure, the 240 FPS mode is at 320 pixels but it's still cool and the 720p 60 FPS mode is great for catching action or subtle slo mo.  The menus are a little clunky but when you figure out where things are, it's no big deal.  The ability to geo-tag shots and the map feature is kind of neat.  Easy to remember where you took the shot later.All in all, a sweet little camera.  Like everything else, there's a newer model with wi-fi but it's easy enough to put the memory card in my card reader.  Four and a half stars, half a star deduction for the soft photos but otherwise a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: tg
Reviews.Content: great camera, nice video feature. I used it at Victoria Falls and has no problem with rain fall even this camera is soaking wet.

Reviews.Title: Item listed as new although.......
Reviews.Author: Rocky
Reviews.Content: I never used this camera because it was listed as new although the packaging/box was opened and damaged. All of the items that came with the camera appeared to be in the box, although I put the items back in returned the camera. I saw a comparable Canon with a sd card and case included @ Costco I'll get instead.

Reviews.Title: Just learning how to use it
Reviews.Author: Anne Whittington
Reviews.Content: But so far so good! Took it on my first trip and have been very happy with the quality of photos. Looking forward to learning how to use the gps since I hike a lot.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Eva
Reviews.Content: For this one for my 2 years old son when he swim in the pool did really good job in the water good pics

Reviews.Title: Keep in mind
Reviews.Author: Onur Buyukceran
Reviews.Content: This was my second water-proof camera. They all surived only one season. I like snowboarding, and windsurfing. In winter I like to go to mountains for snowboarding, since my Nikon D90 is not the optimal camera for such kind of events, I bought this camera (AW100). It was almost good (a couple of flows) in the mountains. Later summer came, and I went to seaside with my camera. Second time in see, the LCD screen stopped working, because the camera took some water in from battery compartment. If you want to use it underwater, buy something designed specially for underwater, not all conditions kind of thing; they all die quick in the water. :)Snowboarding: Good for the value. Strange side button. Moisture on lens sometimes. Battery life relatively better compared to other similar cameras.Windsurfing: Dont use it. It will take water in.

Reviews.Title: It really works under water
Reviews.Author: Gil Samson
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2KNPIKNCUONA3', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2KNPIKNCUONA3loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } // ]]> var cv_mo2KNPIKNCUONA3RollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo2KNPIKNCUONA3RollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/71qIPPwbR4S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png";
