Reviews.Content: This is a great camera it has so many settings on it for different scens, great pics in the dark. The video that comes out of this baby is super it's like seeing a dvd movie. I highly reccomend this camera to whom ever needs a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Excelente
Reviews.Author: Luis Mendez
Reviews.Content: Desde Venezuela confirmo que este producto es excelente. entregas eficaz. Muchas gracias.. espero volver a realizar compras a este vendedor.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Mauro
Reviews.Content: excellent camera, very good in the water is very waterproof, has a good resolution, the pictures come out very clear and perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for when I go Kayaking.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a new waterproof camera for when I go Kayaking. With the built in GPS, tagging my pictures will make it easy to map out my adventures. Takes great pictures even for everyday use.

Reviews.Title: meh.
Reviews.Author: Michael "I drive an average of 350 miles a we...
Reviews.Content: Nice camera.  Rugged.  Works as advertised, but it just takes a long time to focus when taking pics.  I like catching candid shots of people and it's nearly impossible to do with this.  Also, when you select the flash setting to 'off' it only stays off for one pic.

Reviews.Title: Little Tiger
Reviews.Author: Susan J. Christensen "Sueabc600"
Reviews.Content: This little camera did a great job in Hawaii. My Nikon D90 got wet and had to go in for repair but not this little tiger! It did a good job in rough and very wet seas photographing lava pouring into the ocean. I also brought it to a very bright wedding (sun shining in on the bride and groom) and it did a decent job!

Reviews.Title: Not really waterproof
Reviews.Author: T. Augsten
Reviews.Content: It tested the camera a few times as a waterproof camera but unfortunately small water drops goes into the battery/sd card slot.

Reviews.Title: good but not waterproof completely
Reviews.Author: nate
Reviews.Content: This camera was perfect for me in every way besides when it stopped working due to water damage about a month after I bought it. If you still want I would highly recommend buying a waterproof case for this camera just to be safe and a floater so when you drop it you wont loose it forever.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Camera
Reviews.Author: Edgar
Reviews.Content: I have not tried to run it effectively in the water or resistance, however, has met my expectations. I like it.

Reviews.Title: A Good Outdoor Camera
Reviews.Author: Gerry
Reviews.Content: It's a good outdoor camera. I wanted something with a GPS I could use while hiking, boating or in a light rain. The pictures are pretty good. There's almost no lag between shots. There are two minor downsides: when shooting video, it won't refocus as you pan and it comes with a neck-strap (I like a wrist strap for a camera this size.) On the upside, it comes with a 40.5mm filter adapter ring and the GPS is super fast, if you keep the data up to date. It won't replace a good D-SLR, but it will be a handy pocket camera to get those surprise photos.

Reviews.Title: Like it so good for the price
Reviews.Author: R.Peter
Reviews.Content: Like the product, even child can handle without care :-). Dont compare against a SLR quality, records poor at low lights.

Reviews.Title: This was a gift
Reviews.Author: vjnnc
Reviews.Content: And it takes AWESOME photos and is pretty easy to use.  I would highly recommend this to anyone who likes to go out and hike....well, I'd actually recommend it to anyone at all.

Reviews.Title: Nikon rules
Reviews.Author: scott manatt
Reviews.Content: good compact camera, although I haven't been in the tub yet.  Like all compacts, its time is limited.  The Iphone will end up taking its place.

Reviews.Title: great outdoor camera
Reviews.Author: Sergio
Reviews.Content: as far as underwater pictures/viedeo, and shock proof components, this is a great camera. Picture quality is not so good in low light conditions.Satelite GPS options are pretty much useless unless you use the software provided by NIkkon. And it consumes battery life fairly quickly.

Reviews.Title: Pictures
Reviews.Author: Suzanne
Reviews.Content: I like everything about it.  The zoom, video, pictures, and still learning more.  Easy to move around from all phases of picture taking!

Reviews.Title: my new camera
Reviews.Author: LINDA MONTGOMERY
Reviews.Content: it is easy to use and the directions were easy to follow. we tried it out for Thanksgiving and all the photos were "picture perfect"

Reviews.Title: Husbands birthday
Reviews.Author: L. Miller
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband's birthday. We are also going on our honeymoon to Hawaii in a few weeks and thought it would be nice to have a camera that we can take with us kayaking. While we haven't gone on our honeymoon yet we have taken pictures and video. The pictures come out nice and clean. The camera is the most user friendly of the waterproof versions available. I went to a box store and played with them all before I chose to purchase this one. We shot some HD video recently of us running through an obstacle course and uploaded it for our family to see. It turned out really nice, like a few of the other reviews stated the picture quality is great but may be a bit dark at times. The sound quality was really awesome as well. Can't wait to see how it does underwater.

Reviews.Title: handy
Reviews.Author: R. Everett
Reviews.Content: great for vacations, one small device to take great pics and video in the pool or in the sea. very convienant. one draw back the lens for some reason would fog up, had to keep checking the lens before pics otherwise i love it

Reviews.Title: Great little Camera
Reviews.Author: jenna Lake
Reviews.Content: This camera is great if you are "rough" on things.  I used it while deployed and it held up great against all of the dust.  I also dropped it a couple of times and it seems fine.  I got it semi wet but not completely submerged so I'm not sure how waterproof it really is.

Reviews.Title: Has great feuture that no one points
Reviews.Author: Gboston
Reviews.Content: Just received this camera. Tested out, great, however I want to point out feature no one points that it comes with a fairly long handle that you can hang the camera around your neck/attach it to your arm.  Usually small cameras do not come with long cords/handles but this one does. So when you ski it hangs on your neck, when you swim you can wrap it to your hand and still has pleanty of handle to move and maneuver.

Reviews.Title: Go everywhere
Reviews.Author: Fred
Reviews.Content: Got this camera to take hiking, to the pool, street, malls that send security if I use my high end camera. Hope it holds up to this type of treatment. Didn't shoot much with it but am somewhat encouraged with the few test shots. Anxious to shoot in water. Nice to have video too. Only thing missing is that it doesn't shoot in Raw (NEF files) hence the 4 star rating instead of 5. The picture styles menu a little hard to navigate with 4 buttons. I'm a Nikon guy so - - -

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: phoenixkat
Reviews.Content: I took this on a cruise for my first use....and got great pics even though I had not had much time to learn about the camera - used 11 gig of my 16 gig card in a week....Love it!

Reviews.Title: Makes ok pictures
Reviews.Author: Lindstrom Morten
Reviews.Content: The camera does what it should, and takes decent pictures for a compact camera.One feature I like in particular is the option to Film in 240 fps, which gives some cool slow effects. The resolution with high-speed is not good, but for small sections - should do the job.There is one thing though - the body is from plastic. And being sold as a water proof camera that also can handle being dropped on the ground ... I am not confident in that it won't crack open.A good buy, worth the price

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX AW100 16 MP CMOS Waterproof Digital Camera with GPS and Full HD 1080p Video (Black)
Reviews.Author: Clay Walker
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome! It does more than any other compact camera I've ever had.  My favorite features are the High Speed video and Panoramic features. The only thing, and its a small thing, that I don't particularly like about the camera is how easy the the display is to scratch.  Another thing is that the first one I got was messed up to where when I plugged it in to the TV, it somehow picked up some static from the TV and gave me a little shock. After that, the LCD colors were way off and it kept spazzing out.  Amazon handled the return very well in my opinion.  They replaced it with a new one and paid return shipping AND gave me one day shipping which I paid for the first time around.  So despite the screen problem, this camera still deserves 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Laqch
Reviews.Content: Great price for all the features it has. Finally a rugged camera for hiking, camping, hunting or the beach. Waterproof and shock resistant and takes excellent pictures. Very short blush time with the ability to shoot multiple frames of action at sporting events. Video is incredible.

Reviews.Title: Nice Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Patrick L "Engrpat"
Reviews.Content: I use SLRs mostly, but this pocket camera is convenient. The GPS feature encodes the pitcure with where the photo was taken and which direction the camera was pointed. I have not taken it underwater, but don't mid having with me when I bike on days that might rain.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Aw100
Reviews.Author: Kayak Angler
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to take kayak fishing. Had been awesome takes really good pictures in and out of water. I'm not a professional not even sure I could be considered am amateur, yet I am turning out high quality photos with great clarity and no blur. Also have taken to a few football games the video is amazing and clarity of the charts. One con I have had is in low light its not the best but since i bought this essentially for water situations this issue really doesn't bother me. Would definitely recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix Aw100
Reviews.Author: asmith
Reviews.Content: love it. takes great pix and video. i have taken out to the lake and under water and for five hours or so. have no had a problem with it at all just need to clean it like it says to after taking to the lake oh than that work great.

Reviews.Title: Does the Job in Water Settings
Reviews.Author: KS
Reviews.Content: Bought this for an adventure trip to Costa Rica.  It can rain there everyday and we were doing watersport activities everyday.  I would say 1st off - I owned a Canon SD650 point and shoot camera prior to purchasing this one (which is not waterproof).  This is the 1st waterproof camera I've ever purchased.  It does the job.  It was very liberating NOT to worry about any type of moisture.  The camera actually took good shots of fish underwater as long as there was enough light.  That being said - I think my canon took better quality pictures overall.  I used the EASY AUTO MODE 1st thinking it would be great but the auto mode is not so smart.  Always seem to switch to some crazy mode like "sunset" mode when it was clearly bright outside.  I got some really crappy pictures because of some crazy modes it was in.  After a few days - I just put it in simple AUTO MODE because it simply worked better.  The switching of modes buttons and screen menus were not intuitive.  It was not impossible to learn but the canon was better.  The reaction time to shutter button was the worse thing - it would take a good 1-2 seconds for the shutter to release - monkeys would have swung away by then!!  That was slightly annoying.  LASTLY - on day 3 - after taking a picture on a sunny hike - the camera crapped out - all the buttons seemed to be working but all I got was a black screen.  Took pictures but thought that it was night time and flashed.  I figured out the shutter was stuck closed since everything was working but camera kept thinking it was nighttime.  I read over the manual that night to no avail so I did what every good consumer would do - looked up the problem on google.  Low and behold - someone blogged about the same exact problem - the shutter gets stuck and you "gently" bang the unit to your thigh (seriously??).  I tried that the 1st night to no avail so I was hopelessly sad that I purchased this new camera that worked for only 3 days of our vacation.  However, my tour guide said that it was probably partially due to moisture condensation so gave me a bag of rice to put the camera in to draw the moisture out.  Next morning - shutter was still stuck but when I banged it on my knee (gently) - the shutter came loose and the camera was back on!!  It hasn't stuck again for the next 5 days of vacation and now.In Summary - if you need a water proof camera but don't need UBER wonderful quality photos - this will be just fine.  The camera's talent is "waterproofness" so I am tolerant of less beautiful pictures than my canon. Shutter speed could improve and don't use auto easy mode (sucks).  I still want another "land" point and shoot camera for beautiful pics.  If I could give it 3.5 stars, I would but round up to 4.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Wang
Reviews.Content: Love my new camera.  Takes good pictures. Easy to use point and shoot.  Of course small cameras aren't the best for low light but this one does ok.  Good flash.  Interface is a little weird but up to now (still am) have been a Canon guy.  The Canon waterproof shock proof camera was a little bulky so couldn't buy it.  The Panasonic one seemed to routinely get good reviews over the Nikon but couldn't bring myself to give my business to Panasonic after they hosed me on my Superzoom that failed after 1 yr.Word of advice, make sure you buy the right SDHC card for the camera.  Nikon only approves 4 makers: Sandisk, Toshiba, panasonic, and Lexar.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT!
Reviews.Author: Jenni Roderick
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a birthday present and within a day of owning it took it on a Caribbean cruise. All I can say is that I absolutely love it!! I took it snorkeling several times and each and every single time got amazing pictures from it. Better than that and almost unexpectedly is that the video function works amazingly underwater as well. I genuinely couldn't be happier with this camera.I was really apprehensive about buying it since several reviews stated that it died the first time it entered the water and that the camera was unreliable and poorly made. I can assure you that the camera doesn't die and isn't poorly made. The quality of the pictures that I took easily compete and in most environments exceed that of my digital SLR camera. In fact for my vacation I used my digital SLR on the first day and then after using the AW100 a few times didn't pick up the SLR once for the remainder of the vacation.One recommendation I would make is that if you're going to get this camera then definitely spend the extra $10 and get the Extreme SDHC card to go with it rather than a standard card. This guarantees that your memory card can withstand the same conditions that your camera does in addition to protecting the images taken and stored on it.Overall, absolutely great camera and having owned it for a month I've taken it snorkeling and hiking, on planes, trains and automobiles, in addition to using it in extreme humid, hot and conversely cool conditions and am yet to find a single fault! If I do I'll be sure to update this review...

Reviews.Title: bueno
Reviews.Author: Wichito
Reviews.Content: es un aparato con mucha tecnologia, la misma que se es utilizada para as actividades cotidianas del hogar, asi como tambien para el trabajo

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX AW100
Reviews.Author: Roxane Johnson
Reviews.Content: Great Camera.  Used this in Maui and got wonderful underwater shots of the kids and turtles!  Very clear pictures and easy to use. I love the video's you can create too.

Reviews.Title: A great camera!
Reviews.Author: Okie Gal
Reviews.Content: I am still learning how to use this camera.  That may be a long project.  It has so many cool features.  I wanted a camera without a protruding lens to enable carrying in my purse as opposed to a strap around the neck.  This camera fills that bill very nicely but in addition has tremendous features.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Donna Noble
Reviews.Content: Haven't tested it in bad weather, but it took some great pictures in the hot, dry, dusty Grand Canyon. The easy panorama is great.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for outdoor / on the water use
Reviews.Author: Edward Giardina
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera this week at Best Buy; normally I'd buy it at Amazon but needed it next day for a trip on the lake. Takes amazing photos and video, for sure. Takes a beating (spent 2 hours jetskiing and 2 hours on a ropes course). Good battery life (been using it a week and haven't had to recharge the battery.) The only drawback is that it seems to perform rather average in low-light. other than that, it's a great camera.

Reviews.Title: waterproof damera
Reviews.Author: G. Glaser
Reviews.Content: nice little camera.  Good size and comfortable in your hand.  Have not used it under water yet but takes good pictures otherwise. Purchased this one because I have two other Nikon cameras and they have never failed me. I totally trust this brand.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Customer Service by Nikon - Excellent Service by Amazon
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Camera takes excellent pictures, but the charger for the battery failed after less than 2 charges and as per Nikon customer service it is not under warranty!!!!!!!!  But they would gladly sell me a new one...  what nuisance.  I guess I will return the camera and charger to Amazon and ask for a replacement unit.Update:  outside of the 30 day return period ;-(  - contacted Amazon customer service and they gave me a cash back discount allowing me to purchase a replacement unit.... Way to go  AMAZON !!!!!!!!!  you have gained a customer for life.  Thanks

Reviews.Title: Good Times Captured
Reviews.Author: Matt W
Reviews.Content: This camera is exactly what i expected.  It takes very quality shots, I have not had any come out fuzzy.  Those who are having problems must be missing something.  I have yet to use the underwater functions, but i have a vacation coming up and will update then. The only reason i rate 4 stars instead of 5, is the shake function on the camera.  I really wish there was a way to turn this off.  It gets very annoying when looking through pictures, if you turn the camera to show another person the picture, it thinks you are shaking it and changes to another picture.

Reviews.Title: Nikon cool pics aw100
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing digital camera!! I originally bought this for my honeymoon. We took a cruise to grand cayman, jamaica, and Mexico. At every stop we had water based excursions. The pics and video both above and below water are amazing. I would highly recommend this camera with the accy kit as well!!!

Reviews.Title: rugged camera with many features
Reviews.Author: BSummer
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of reviews I decided this was the rugged camera to get for dismount operations in Afghanistan. The problem with normal cameras in the desert is the fine sand gets in between the zoom lens and you get lens errors. One of my soldier also bought this camera but from a grey market seller (not Amazon) and he had lens errors when it is new. Unlike a lot of the Rugged cameras before it this one actually has an optical zoom its just all internal so fine sand cant get to it. For my normal camera I use a Canon S100. while this doesn't take nearly as nice pictures it takes decent pictures for what it is. The Gps feature eats batteries and I just turn it off. Buttons are easy to understand, and access. Menus are simple and clear. One of Coolest features is an auto-pan picture feature. You click start and slowly turn and the camera does the stitching on the fly making or more seamless panoramic view.

Reviews.Title: This camera rocks!
Reviews.Author: Sally Cox
Reviews.Content: I did my homework before buying this camera. We love Nikon at our house - we own many. I needed a sturdy waterproof camera for my daughter and this one fits the bill nicely. Enough megapixels to please the geek in me, but still easy for her to use and upload photos to her computer. Love the large viewscreen, and because we are Nikon gals, so easy for both of us to use. Came in orange or blue but we like the black one. This camera will get a lot of use at our house.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: David A. Carballeira MD
Reviews.Content: Product excellent with many features. The only problem is in case of damage I have to send the product to Nikon USA since I have no insurance in Puerto Rico as available in the 50 states.

Reviews.Title: GREAT WATERPROOF CAMERA
Reviews.Author: ALI
Reviews.Content: The camera was bought because it was waterproof and shock proof.  Used it on a white water rafting trip where at times it was submerged in a foot of water and it still works great.  The pictures look great and it satisfied the reason I bough it.

Reviews.Title: Foul Weather Friend
Reviews.Author: Drumrdan
Reviews.Content: It's a nice little digital camera if you plan to shoot anything in wet locations. I also like that it has the option to mount a 40.5mm polarized lens to it.

Reviews.Title: This camera leaked the first time I put it in water!
Reviews.Author: Vicki (from Coronado)
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in January to take with me on some planned upcoming trips. I took it skiing with me and it took great pictures, mountain bike riding...perfect.But when i took it to Costa Rica and submerged it in water for the first time...that was the end of the camera!Sadly it happened on the first day of my trip...Luckily I was able to get my money back from Costco...I'm looking for a good camera, simple, easy to use and ...ahem...waterproof if it says it is!

Reviews.Title: i have the black one
Reviews.Author: A. Spies
Reviews.Content: not a bad camera def. worth it. The controls are user friendly and the video quality is also good. The mic is a little touchy but not that big a deal when compaired to its ruggedness and picture quality. The auto smile photo mode? is touchy in certain light but was pleasently suprised to see it as an added option. Sometimes the buttons stick or go past the image i was attempting to view but it could be im pushing the "next" button too hard. Over All 4 star rating due to not having the camera long enough to take into account its longevity.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Kim Mcphee "smart shopper"
Reviews.Content: I received this as a birthday gift and just got back from Florida using it in salt water and chlorine pools. Absolutely love it! Worked great, has wonderful color and I love the flash underwater.Would recommend this to anyone. The battery life is a little short but the picture quality more than makes up for that at the price you get it for. Oh yeah, the underwater video is also terrific! Don't be afraid to spring foer this one.

Reviews.Title: Very soft focus
Reviews.Author: PT
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a robust waterproof camera for snowboarding and sea kayaking, and this thing seemed to fit the bill.  I have always shot with Canon and Panasonic Lumix cameras in the past, but the features and video capabilities of this unit intrigued me, so I took the plunge.Yuck.The stills are very soft in focus.  Anything detailed in the distance gets washed out.  It looks like a 2MP camera, not a 16MP (yes, I am shooting at full res).  I thought I must be dreaming so I shot identical stills with my old Lumix DMC-ZS3 and the Nikon AW100, and the Panasonic stapled the Nikon's nipples to the wall and stole its girlfriend in terms of image definition.  The focus point the Nikon chooses seems to be the far point of the depth of field, because the object that the green focus indicator in the center of the image lights up on and everything closer seems to be in ok focus, but anything farther away is soft and undefined.  The Panasonic gives much deeper depth of field and everything from near objects to infinity are very sharp and defined.  The Lumix only shoots 720p vid, but even that looks better than the 1080 the Nikon puts out, and the zoom when filming on the Nikon is a single speed and faaaar too fast.  The Lumix will zoom in slowly if you move the rocker switch a short distance, and zoom in faster if you move it farther.  The Nikon has a single zoom speed on it's tele/wide rocker button, and it's distractingly fast.I returned this camera.  Maybe I'm spoiled by my Lumix DMC-ZS3 and my Lumix FZ100, but I expected at least moderate image quality and performance from this Nikon.  It was a definite letdown.

Reviews.Title: Seems good
Reviews.Author: Hunter
Reviews.Content: So far seems good, needs a big SD card and special batteries if your going to be away from recharge. Adds about $100 to the cost, but I'm hopping the the paying is over.

Reviews.Title: Great photos
Reviews.Author: turtle297
Reviews.Content: So far this little camera is amazing. Great photos all around. I have not used this camera underwater so no comments about that aspect.

Reviews.Title: Nikon AW100
Reviews.Author: Dan Eggert
Reviews.Content: I work for regional publications and visitor bureaus capturing the lifestyle of a unique area of WI. With this, I put myself in lots of situations that require a more sturdy camera. The AW100 is small enough to fit in my pocket so I have a camera on me at all times. It is also rugged enough to take the beatings that I often put on my equipment. The waterproof to 33' feature is great too as I like to be out in the rain and also live around water so unique angels can be obtained without worrying about my camera ending up in the drink. I have tried most all the functions so far and am very pleased with the quality and results that I am getting. The one thing I have not tried yet, is video underwater, being that it is winter, the water is too cold to get into yet. It is a great overall camera!

Reviews.Title: Takes Abuse & Records Well
Reviews.Author: M. Cohen
Reviews.Content: I have already fell onto asphalt with camera face down. Shell abused but lens not scratched and still works as designed. Remains water tight (not used underwater yet). Has withstood heat, humidity, spaahes while canoeing an kayaking. Image stabilization works well even under zoom. Graet to alternate slides and video.Keep in mind that this is not a SLR camera with great lenses. However also remember that the best camera is the one you take with you and this one is easy to take and the resolution is wonderful within its catagory.Only drawback is battery time not exceptional. Keep extra battery on hand just in case, especially if you use GPS function.

Reviews.Title: Worked like a Charm!
Reviews.Author: Debra E Byars
Reviews.Content: Got this camera to go snorkeling in Hawaii.  The camera worked great.  Took it in the water every day.  Brought it back to the condo and soaked it for 15 minutes in a pitcher of water and back into the ocean the next day.  As long as you are very careful when closing the battery/SD card door, you shouldn't have any problems.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Walter S. Rozen
Reviews.Content: Have used the camera a few weeks and am impressed.Takes sharp and clear pictures top side and worked well down at 33' underwater.The GPS feature is amazing.Money well spent on a carry everywhere camera.Walt

Reviews.Title: Used it in Thailand and loved it!
Reviews.Author: John Kim
Reviews.Content: I purposefully bought this camera to take underwater photos.  It works!-PROS: quality of the photo and the video is actually better than I expected, very modern looking, easy to use.-CONS: the camera says it is waterproof up to 10m.  I took it to about 8 meters and the water made its way into the camera.  The camera was able to power on and take pictures after it dried, however, the screen would not turn on.  Oh well, i guess that's what I get for testing its limits.  The night shots are not very good quality either.  Even with the ability to control the shutter speed, it wasn't fast enough to bring out the beauty of night.  It makes it look like day.It's a great camera to have to augment a DSLR, but to expect DSLR quality with the 16MP camera is not realistic.  Definitely just another point and shoot with underwater capability...but better than most point and shoot I've owned with canon.

Reviews.Title: Just great!
Reviews.Author: Joao Vicente M. Lebrao "Lebrao"
Reviews.Content: Excelent features! Very easy to operate and durable. You can take very cool pictures without worring with weather conditions and where you are.

Reviews.Title: WOW...underwater never looked so good
Reviews.Author: Andy54
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were heading to Hawaii for a two week break from the cold of Utah and wanted a point and shoot camera we could take underwater pictures with. After researching all the options, we chose the Nikon Coolpix AW100. And we couldn't more pleased! I took it snorkeling and it worked as advertised; all the pictures and movies are amazing. It was watertight (I did not go more than 3 to 5 feet down) and we followed the directions about drying it thoroughly before opening. Fresh or salt water had no ill effects. I highly recommend this camera for shallow underwater pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Leni
Reviews.Content: Love it, great for outside and underwater activity. Very sturdy and the shockproof helps quite a lot since cameras tend to fall

Reviews.Title: last water camera
Reviews.Author: citygirl
Reviews.Content: I bought this as it is now our last water camera we will need in a long time.  It took very nice pictures on the beach and especially some fun water shots in the waves.  My husband is quite picky with his cameras and really liked this choice.  We did buy a floating wristlet when we went snorkeling and even our tour camera guy thought it was a great camera.  The zoom was easy to use as the overall camera itself.  It was nice to have a tiny little camera on our zipline adventure too. We had a few raindrops come our way so having this along with a strap was super nice and saved us money by not having to purchase their photos.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: Enrique Henriquez "Enrique"
Reviews.Content: ONE OF THE BEST COMPACT CAMERAS AGAINST WATER THAT ARE IN THE MARKET, THE QUALITY OF THE PICTURES IS UNBEATABLE, I recommend 100%

Reviews.Title: best camera I've had so far
Reviews.Author: mark twain
Reviews.Content: Good camera to replace my "disappeared" Olympus.  A couple things I like better about this camera than my last, GPS is accurate enough(haven't tested accuracy yet), HD video, and the option to go lower quality but higher speed video is a plus, Also better image quality and can put in auto mode that adjusts itself to what kind of photo being taken.Couple things could've done better, I liked the lens cover on the olympus that shut when you turned it off.  I would prefer if the GPS screen would display the coordinates.Overall very pleased though.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater performance, awful GPS
Reviews.Author: Praty
Reviews.Content: I own other point and shoots: I bought this for underwater use and geo tagging.Underwater performance is very good. It switches to underwater mode on its own - and it is a breeze to use, even for children.I was really disappointed by the GPS - it is virtually useless. It locks only 20% of the time, and takes several minutes to lock if it does- which it promptly loses the moment i switch it off. It feels they have squeezed in a 10yr old GPS chip just for the sake of it. I have several SD card-sized dedicated GPS units for use with my nikon DSLRs, and they are very dependable (they lock in 30 seconds, and work even inside the airplane). I would not buy this unit if you are keen on geo tagging pictures.I wish they had a more reliable GPS in the unit- given the $200 premium to similar 'ordinary' cameras.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Bobby
Reviews.Content: I like to go kayaking, camping, geocaching, hunting, and fishing.  With this camera I don't have to worry about the elements.  I used the camera underwater for pictures and video and it work flawlessly.  I really like the GPS on the camera, no more having to remember where the picture was taken.  As a side note: My grandmother doesn't have a computer, but likes to see the pictures and videos from my adventures.  I purchased a HDMI cable for the camera and use it to plug the camera directly into her TV.  This way we can go through the pictures on a bigger screen.  I'm happy and so is she.

Reviews.Title: Camera testing
Reviews.Author: Thomas Wittmann
Reviews.Content: At first i was a little unsure about bthe buy, but as soon as snapped the first picture i was sold.The camera takes great shots in various lighting conditions, even at night i switched it into one of the suited scenario modes which shot much better pictures than in the auto-mode.I even got to test the durability when the camera dropped from a small cliff shelf when i was shooting on self timer. it fell from approx 5 feet, and no problems at all..When the pictures are shown on a TV with big screen, they are of incredible quality..all in all, this is a great camera when youre on the move, always trekking, doing sports etc. and do not like the big camera gears that take time to setup etc..

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Rhoger Lopez
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera is amazing, I'm taking wonderful pictures and enjoying a lot this product, is really good!

Reviews.Title: High resolution & ED optics in an all-weather point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Lifeguard
Reviews.Content: I take primarily still images with just the occasional video thrown in.  I got this little camera for those times when I can't carry my DSLR with me at work or on a trail, and in that regard it has not disappointed.  It's light, compact and durable enough to be used in most weather conditions.  I say most because like anything that's dependent on battery power, the AW100's performance is likely to degrade somewhat in extremely cold conditions (below -10 degrees C.)  I'm unlikely to use this camera in underwater shooting conditions or to make much use of the GPS features because I would use other equipment for those things, but I appreciate the ability to take it fearlessly into rainy or snowy weather.Small and light are things that make a camera portable, but they don't contribute anything to your ability to make an image without camera shake.  Enter Nikon's vibration reduction system.  I made a point of checking image sharpness with hand-held shots taken of the moon when it was low on the horizon and other distant light sources on profoundly dark nights.  I found the results to be very satisfactory when I took the simple additional step of bracing myself against something solid and stationary before shooting.I particularly like the 16MP resolution and Nikon's ED lens elements, which make it possible to have high quality enlargements from a small point-and-shoot camera.Two critiques:  1) Nikon advertises the camera as shock resistant after having conducted drop tests at a height of 5 feet onto 2" plyboard.  The camera does seem to be sturdily built and the access door for the battery and SD card seems to be strong and appears to lock simply and securely.  However, Nikon's documentation makes it clear that their tests were conducted under specific circumstances and that dropping the camera may result in loss of its water-tight integrity as well as other functionality.  I'm just sayin'.  :-)  2) Although many people don't bother to read owners' manuals anymore, it would have been nice if Nikon had included a paper version of the manual rather than just a Quick Start Guide and a pdf that you put on your computer.  The camera does offer a number of features that you might not otherwise become aware of or know how to access/operate without the manual, and most of us aren't going to be carrying our laptop or our tablet into the woods all the time.Overall, a very nice little all-weather camera that delivers beautiful images and is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful little thing!
Reviews.Author: Donovan Larson
Reviews.Content: I have been very impressed with this camera and its abilities in low light.  It is very easy to use and takes incredible pictures without hesitation.  Definitely a great buy!!

Reviews.Title: My daughter Just loves it
Reviews.Author: Rick L. Lundgren
Reviews.Content: Great Camera!!!! My Daughter and her husband love all the features.  especially the underwater pictures and videos.  MY grandson loves to watch himself do underwater tricks and turns.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Trips
Reviews.Author: Hillary E. Peaslee "City Girl"
Reviews.Content: This is a great multi purpose camera, great video with underwater capability that is un-compromised. The only draw back is that the colors are not as vibrant as advertised. With this being said, enhancing the photos on my mac with the one click enhance button really made them pop! For those of you who are even more skilled or have better software this is an issue that is easily remedied.

Reviews.Title: Nikon aw100
Reviews.Author: edgardo
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say about this camera? It's fantastic, I used it in Cancun and it was perfect under the water, It's a nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for  my fly fishing trips
Reviews.Author: jbrownie1
Reviews.Content: I really needed a great waterproof camera for fly fishing trips. How else am I to show off the really big ones if I catch and release. The camera is fantastic. Much better than any of the others I have used. Nikon is famous for their optics, colors, and capabilities. I generally use the Nikon d7000, so i was pleasantly surprised at the image quality and ease of use. I think this is the perfect camera for anyone looking for the best waterproof camera which is well suited for outdoor enthusiasts and nature lovers. See you on the Madison at $3 Bridge!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Surprise
Reviews.Author: J. W. Assoc
Reviews.Content: This was gift to my daughter who specifically asked for this camera. Reviews and UTube reviews were very helpful and right on. She has commented this camera has exceeded her expectations. No issues with underwater use and low light pictures have been outstanding.  The video clarity has been an excellent surprise.  Outstanding price from Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Simple the best camera
Reviews.Author: Andre J Anthony
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera just before I went on my sky trip, it worked like a champ, the video in HD was great and the photo in the pool were even better. My kids had so much fun using this camera. If you are looking for a camera that will give you the best photo on your vacation without have to think about "F" stops this is the one to buy. Nikon did it again. You will love itA.Anthony

Reviews.Title: Great build quality, solid pictures
Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: I am really surprised at how great these pictures are for a waterproof sports camera, it really has great abilities and flash. I am very impressed, nice colors as well.

Reviews.Title: does not fully support SDXC cards
Reviews.Author: Felippe
Reviews.Content: Well it is really annoying to figure out camera does not support 128GB Sandisk SDXC card even though it says it supports SDXC cards under tech specs. Miss leading information.

Reviews.Title: Great little underwater video camera
Reviews.Author: Eric Radman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for an upcoming trip.  I wanted an underwater video camera as I am an avid photographer and will be using my Canon SLR 50D for pictures on land and this camera for underwater.  I took this camera to a local pool to test the underwater features.  I had no problem whatsoever. Set camera to wide angle so focus wasn't a problem.  Set camera on highest quality 1080p video.  Image quality was very good but you don't have control over exposure, which could be a big downside.  Don't expect good sound from this camera, however.  Since you have to open up a small waterproof compartment to access the battery & memory card,  tiny grains of sand or salt water could possibly cause this compartment to leak. To prevent leakage, you must be very careful about any foreign objects lodging in the waterproof seals.  This camera doesn't feel rugged and I suspect it will sustain damage if dropped. If you want an underwater video camera, this camera works well for its price range.  It's fairly easy to use, is lightweight, has a slow motion mode (I didn't test) and does a good job with image quality. BEWARE: In the CD Manual, Nikon warns that handling the power cord will expose you to lead- a chemical known to cause birth defects. This is unacceptable and people should call Nikon on this  800-645-6689. I believe many Nikon products also come with this warning.

Reviews.Title: Leaked water during 1st 2 weeks use while snorkeling
Reviews.Author: amf "amf"
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great pictures.  The wifi capability and gps are great features while it lasted.  We bought it at Cost*co and were able to return it after it failed.  We were on a 2 week cruise and my spouse climbed in the water and it wouldn't turn on, we discovered the battery and media compartment flooded.  We just haven't had good luck with this brand.  Back to sony, they have been very reliable

Reviews.Title: DOA just after warranty expiration!
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Shockproof.  Waterproof.  Great pics.  I would have agreed wholeheartedly until it suffered a catastrophic failure last week!I have owned this camera for just over a year and maintain it according to manual specs (I have a full-sized DSLR camera with a waterproof housing that's been maintained and worked perfectly for over 4 years).  I've stored my AW100 in a padded case when not in use and have never dropped it.  Most of my pics are above water in dry conditions.  No pool use and only occasional shallow (5-10') snorkeling use with immediate freshwater wash afterwards.I usually carry several cameras when traveling but I became so confident that this camera was the only point & shoot  I needed that I opted not to bring a "back-up".  Big mistake.My first sign of trouble was when I tried turning it on (on dry land) and got the "this card cannot be used in the camera" message.  Hmmm, I've used this card many times before.  Switch out the cards and a few pics later the same message.  Again, I switch to a third card and all seems ok.  Off to snorkel (no deeper than 5') and the "card error" pops up after a few pics then everything flashes and the camera shuts down.  Hmmmm.After rinsing and drying the camera I opened it to find the inside is now wet.  The camera no longer works at all.  This is absurd for a camera that is marketed to the more adventurous user.And, yes, as I said earlier, I did perform seal maintenance as required.  No sand, salt, etc was ever an issue.  I won't be replacing this with another Nikon!

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Michael Moretz
Reviews.Content: The lens was defective within 1 year of purchase and Nikon refused to repair it under warranty.  I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: This is underwater capable???????????
Reviews.Author: RcBFlorida
Reviews.Content: I was very excited purchasing my first Nikon, but was quickly disillusioned.  Within less than a year, after using it about 20 feet underwater, I noticed minute bubbles on/under the LCD screen and slight fogging in the viewfinder.  Didn't think it to be a problem because both disappeared after a couple of hours out of the water, and the camera still functioned.  Subsequently, this happened every time I took it underwater.  In September 2013, I used it again, this time about 28 feet underwater, and noticed the same issue again but didn't give it too much thought because on prior occasions the problem had always disappeared.  That evening, however, when I wanted to upload my video and photos, the camera didn't even turn on.  I thought it was the battery so charged it but still had no success.  I emailed Nikon and they were very unsupportive.  They said since the camera was out of warranty, I would have to send it in for repair and be charged an unspecified amount.  A week later, after thorough drying out, the bubbles and fogging are still there and I have an unresponsive camera.  Needless to say, that was my first and last, purchase of a Nikon product.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, but not happy with Amazon
Reviews.Author: Dennis G. Mike "GPS User"
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is fine, except for the problem with the condensation on the display that others have noticed.  I would not use this camera for extended underwater use for that reason.  The thing that really ticks me off is this was one of the "deals" that Amazon emailed me.  I ordered it without checking further (my bad), only to found out that I could buy the next model HIGHER (with Wireless connectivity) for about $50 LESS through Amazon.  From now on I'll realize that when Amazon tells me they have a deal for me, they really mean they're trying to unload a less than current model.

Reviews.Title: Camera fell apart after using for only a week
Reviews.Author: lakelandman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading a lot of good reviews I have to say using it for only one week and I did not even use it in the water or anything it started to fall apart will add pictures. I have to say the menu is a pain for the camera setting modes also the flash it was to bright it ends up washing out your pictures half the time but what really got me was how easy the glue they use to hold the camera started to come off I never have had that happen with any other camera but his one. Please spend you money on something else...Thanks

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: When I first took the camera out of the box it worked like a charm.  Recorded a video or two and took maybe 20 pictures just to get used to the new camera, everything seemed great.  Fast forward 5 months when I take the camera on my vacation to Punta Cana.  (This was the reason I purchased this camera) Before going into the water, I checked the seal and I was happy to see everything looked locked in place.Took a couple of pictues and it worked great.  I was able to get a picture of the small fish at a reef directly in front of the hotel.  Next day was our excursion to a remote island.  I was in waist deep water on my second day and the screen goes black after snapping two pictures underwater.  I thought the battery died.  So I changed the battery and nothing.  Camera wouldn't come on at all. You usually see the Coolpix graphic when you turn the camera on and it makes a sound. I soon realized the camera was coming on as it made the sound but the screen was broken. Camera without a view finder really becomes a point and pray camera.Then it turns out I am too late to get a refund on my purchase through Amazon.  Only 50% of my money back, what happened to the great Amazon Return policy that every one talks about...Next time I will buy the camera the week before my trip and then if it fails I can at least get my money back.

Reviews.Title: nikon aw100
Reviews.Author: andrew
Reviews.Content: Only used the aw100 once under water and it leaked!  I made sure the seal was securely closed.  Nikon say there were grains on sand and fibres  in the seal but I checked it carefully before using it and it was clean.Had to pay them over £70 for repair .  A month later I have not had it returned-they say they are waiting for spare parts!Not happy!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix great until the waterproofing failed
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Camera last year and it worked great. I recently went snorkeling and the waterproofing failed, the camera filled up with water.The camera is now broken and all the photos on the memory card were lost. Very disappointing :O(

Reviews.Title: Nikon AW100 and GPS
Reviews.Author: Erhard
Reviews.Content: because i recommended this camera to many of my friends i feel i should also share some negatives.i was wondering why sometimes the GPS does not lock on at all and other times it locks within seconds.at least with my camera i can stand behind the following finding:GPS works great with fully charged battery but basically never locks on with only 1 battery indicator visible. I do have my own experimental evidence for that.i think the nikon engineers could have done better in 2 ways.1. have the battery indicator indicating more meaningful battery levels (guys learn from Sony, they do a much better job since more than 10 years)2. make the GPS less sensitive to the battery charging level - in fact it is ridiculous to have a problem like that onesaid all this, with the sudden battery death syndrom one needs to have a second battery ready anyway.still a nice camera with the worldwide high resolution maps - i was recently in germany and japan and it had all the streets to most useful details - ha, why not adding street names also?Erhard

Reviews.Title: 100% Happy! Love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: MCOsteve
Reviews.Content: After a couple months of research and reading reviews on amazon, I finally decided to purchase the Nikon AW100. I just returned from 10 days in Tahiti where I took over 200 underwater photos and lots of underwater video. I cannot say enough how happy I am with the results.This is my first waterproof camera so I was pretty paranoid about putting it in the ocean for several days. I never had one leak for any condensation during the trip (I always washed it in fresh water after being in salt water). It was so easy to use (I used auto for everything), even underwater it was easy to switch from photo to video with one button.The pictures and videos came out extremely well. They were bright, sharp and very colorful. For the price you just can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: This camera takes good picture for being waterproof.
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: I have been pleasantly surprised at the performance of this camera and its very durable. It works better in low light than my Olympus water proof camera.

Reviews.Title: This cam is not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Javier Quintero
Reviews.Content: I used this cam in my last vacation and great surprise, the water dangered the display and all system. clarification: im not a professional diver. This cam is a fake

Reviews.Title: AW100 failed after 15 minutes in water
Reviews.Author: Cameron Litvin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for the purpose of using it while snorkeling.  It lasted about 15 minutes in just a few feet of water (sea water).  I had purchased it at Costco without reading reviews.  It was a Nikon, I had another Nikon point and shoot, regular camera that works great.  Saw this one and thought it would be great to have a good camera for the snorkeling.  It just didn't last.I looked online after encountering this problem and found that others had the problems too, not everyone, but a many users.  I expect that means there are more cameras that fail than do not fail, so BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!!
Reviews.Author: BookLoverTracy
Reviews.Content: I was soooooo excited to take this camera with us on our trip to Belize - I was excited to document my becoming a certified scuba diver.  To bad we didn't have an underwater camera that WORKED!!!!  Used it in our cave tubing experience, camera wasn't even in 3 inches of water and DEAD! You could not turn the camera back on, the LCD screen was completely fogged up.  We could not figure out how in the world a camera that is supposed to be rated for 33 feet of water died after being in mere inches.  Have no clue what happened but needless to say my once in a lifetime experience was not captured.  Do yourselves a favor and spend a bit more money on an underwater camera and I am sure you won't be disappointed.  We really had high hopes for this one, definitely were excited to use the GPS feature, etc.  Too bad we only got to use the camera for about 15 minutes before it was of no use.  And yes, we waited for a few days to see if it would turn back on and had zero luck.

Reviews.Title: A big disappointment
Reviews.Author: shopper mom
Reviews.Content: Not sure if the camera I purchased was faulty or if it was just a bad camera. Picture quality was awful! I tried it on the manual setting then tried monkeying around with the settings and that still didn't help. Pictures were often blurry and shutter speed is slow. I have two young children that don't sit still. Even on the sports mode setting I found it difficult to get a clear picture. After several attempts at one shot I would finally manage to get a clear shot. As for the gps, I was hoping to use this for geocaching or at least for showing where I was on my vacations but instead it only shows points of interest, not coordinates. The bad thing about the poi is that it usually just shows hotels, golf courses, courses, or airports. When the gps was on at my home it said I was at an Rv park. I've never even heard of the place let alone live there. The only good thing I can say is tha  it looked cool, and had an ok battery life even with the gps on. This was my first Nikon and sadly I will never buu another after this one.

Reviews.Title: best camera of it's type
Reviews.Author: Donna Boles
Reviews.Content: i love this camera! i have used every underwater camera in this class of camera; the olympus, panasonic and canon. i use them at least 5 days a week and none last very long. this one has a new closure that feels really tight. the seal is thicker and looks like it might last.as soon as it is turned on it is ready to shoot, other cameras issue a warning about closing the battery compartment and take so long to be ready that you can miss shots.the only reason i'm giving it 4 stars is that i like to set the flash to always be on and so far have not figured out if i can do that.

Reviews.Title: Nothing but problems
Reviews.Author: Terri Laine "Terri Laine"
Reviews.Content: I have shot with a waterproof lumix for years with zero problems. Thought I would try this camera out because it got good reviews, but I have not taken a successful photo with it yet and it corrupts the memory card everytime I put one in. Unfortunately I have been very busy at work and have not had time to suss out the problem completely and now I am past my window of return for a full credit. I'm pretty upset about this camera. Even if they replace it for me I don't want it because I feel like I can't trust it. Give me a good old Canon or Panasonic anytime. The one time I try Nikon it's a disaster.

Reviews.Title: Camera for my fisherman
Reviews.Author: Happy Cook
Reviews.Content: This camera has all the features we were looking for.  Great resolution, waterproof and compact. Unforunately the destructions book is all on line.  We would rather have a "hard" copy.

Reviews.Title: Bad deal.
Reviews.Author: Sergio Mazzei
Reviews.Content: The video is ok, but the pics have not the expected quality. There are too much noise in mostly light situations. But the worst: the camera fails exactly on the main reason for its choice, the waterproof capability. Even for snorkeling (max. 1 meter), the moisture takes place on the LCD display. After now, virtually at the second utilization on water, the display stop working.I'm really disapointed, specially because I'm a Nikon fan and owner of DSLR, flashes, lenses and other products of this brand. Now I'm gonna test the Nikon warranty, hoping they recognize the poor quality of this product and don't argue misuse,  abnormal use, negligence or that kind of thing manufacturers used for blaming the customer.

Reviews.Title: Nearly does it all
Reviews.Author: L. Hahn
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures depending on your resolution setting and very respectable videos.  It seems to be easy on battery usage too.  It can be taken anywhere, except from my research it is not advisable to use it in any capacity as an underwater camera.  While it states its good down to about 30 feet, that is a static pressure rating.  In reality when holding the camera down at that depth and then moving it about with any movement will create a dynamic pressure in excess of its rating causing leakage.  In reality I would not trust it for use deeper than 5 to 10 feet and then only if I happen to fall overboard from a canoe or kayak.  I have not tested it in any extreme cold environments but I know of no reason why it would not do as well as it does or as it is supposed too.

Reviews.Title: I Always wanted one
Reviews.Author: Joseph H. Thiel, III
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting another Waterproof Camera for years. I lost the first one in heavy surf 20 years ago because...I didn't have a floating wrist leash. I do now! The features are more than I need but I get a lot of compliments about the Nikon Coolpix, especially since I chose the Orange shell.

Reviews.Title: best compact camera
Reviews.Author: jose vera
Reviews.Content: best compact camera ever, i used use my professional canon but this is the perfect second camera for me, good

Reviews.Title: Nikon camera
Reviews.Author: Caro
Reviews.Content: The camera is beautifull, light and very easy to handle, pictures are great. Everything was received in perfect condition. Thx

Reviews.Title: Excelente producto, muy bueno.
Reviews.Author: Abraham Jose Padilla VE10X1004
Reviews.Content: Este producto cumplió con las necesidades que se tenían, es de buena calidad, lo recibí en el indicado por el vendedor, recomiendo ampliamente al vendedor. Gracias por atención.

Reviews.Title: Good, not great
Reviews.Author: scott
Reviews.Content: I love the features on this camera.  It is perfect for the outdoor use that I wanted it for.  I love that I do not have to worry about it getting wet.  I love that I can take it anywhere and not worry about getting rained on or anything like that.  Only thing is that it is very inconsistent when trying to take pictures in low light.  Sometimes the flash works great and gives a good picture.  Other times (on the same setting) the flash will wash everything out in white.  Its pretty aggravating.  But I do not know of many cameras in this price range that are good with the low light pictures anyway.LOVE the video mode.  Takes great quality video and this will be a function we use the most with our growing kids.  I would recommend this camera to anyone who is always on the go in the outdoors!

Reviews.Title: Blurry indoor photos
Reviews.Author: Arthur H. Penrose
Reviews.Content: Almost all of the indoor photos were blurry, and the ones that were not were much too bright and washed out.  I am not sure if it was defective or just a much too slow lens for indoor photos.  Either way, I am returning the camera.  Fortunately, that is why I always buy from Amazon, and they are great with customer service and returns if necessary.

Reviews.Title: absolutely love this camera.
Reviews.Author: jaimepoohbr
Reviews.Content: easy to use. great color. had to get a different case to keep it in since it is thicker in width.

Reviews.Title: Not so sure....
Reviews.Author: JBAP
Reviews.Content: The first Nikon Coolpix AW100 I purchased lasted exactly one day.  I got it for my daughter because she said it was waterproof, shockproof, etc., and has a GPS.  She spent one day putting it to the test and the next day it quit working.  The led screen was completely black and I tried everything to fix it, resetting it, etc.  SO DISAPPOINTING. I sent it to Nikon and I must say they were great.  They replaced it at no charge with the same model and color.  This one is still working but I have told her DON'T GET IT WET.  It may say waterproof but I'm not so sure about that.  It does take EXCELLENT pictures, better than any camera I've ever had.  It is a little complicated, however, lots of bells and whistles that I haven't taken the time to learn yet.  So good camera I do believe, maybe my first one was a lemon.  It may be waterproof, shockproof, but it isn't 12-yr-old proof!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: CP
Reviews.Content: This camera is tough. It takes great video underwater and is durable. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Rugged, waterproof, and small
Reviews.Author: Sarah D Hill
Reviews.Content: I loaded the camera with a fully charged battery and a chip, and then threw it in a pool of 4 and 5 year olds! They had a blast taking pictures underwater. I strapped the camera around my neck and wore it on a 9 day excursion in Costa Rica of zip lining, rappelling down waterfalls, kayaking, swimming, rafting, and taking a mangrove safari where monkeys jumped on the boat with us. Then I wore it to Belize and took amazing underwater pictures while snorkeling, swimming with sharks and sting rays, SCUBA, and hookah diving. It's so light weight and small that I keep it in my purse.

Reviews.Title: Nikon AW100 waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Rodger Schultz
Reviews.Content: It was definitely time to replace my old point and shoot camera.This Nikon is everything I needed it to be.Great delivery time.

Reviews.Title: Like new... No was new
Reviews.Author: Troy Patrin
Reviews.Content: Got to my house in 2 day. No prablems at all. Just a great great to deal with! Cool! Cool.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof is good
Reviews.Author: li jie XUKKO
Reviews.Content: I am very like it. Its water proof very Good,and the photo which the camera take is very pretty. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Mel "sunchaser"
Reviews.Content: So far I have been very happy with my new Nikon COOLPIX AW100 16 MP CMOS Waterproof Digital Camera.  Going on a cruise in February and can hardly wait to do some underwater shooting!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Bill Dickey
Reviews.Content: Good sharp pictures with a very compact unit. Will withstand some banging around. Bought a float to go with it as I planned to just take hunting and fishing pictures with primarily, but now I use it for everything.

Reviews.Title: Not a good buy
Reviews.Author: DR
Reviews.Content: i bought the AW100 about six months ago as a backup for my DSLR and to use when the enviroment would possibly be harmful to my standard camera. The AW100 takes impressive pictures and I have no complaints about the picture quality. The camera spent most of the time in my camera bag or pocket and was never actually exposed to any extreme water or shock conditions. In June, the SD card retainer quit working and the card would not stay inserted in the camera and two weeks later the camera quit working completely. I sent the camera to Nikon for repair/replacement and it has been there since August 13 on part hold whatever that means. Email inquiry has been received but not answered.Bottom line is a relatively expensive, not very durable camera with poor customer service. I expected better from Nikon. I cannot recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: too foggy to use
Reviews.Author: Mr. McGee
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nikon AW100 to replace a first generation Olympus Tough series camera which had developed a leak and died after a number of years of service. I have several cameras and my use for a "rugged" camera is solely for our annual Jersey shore vacation. Before "rugged" cameras I was loosing a point & shoot yearly to a rogue wave or some other mishap on the beach.Reviews of the AW100 were generally positive and I leave aspects like picture quality and features to other reviewers. I suspect the camera may be fine or even great for many users, but it failed me badly for the particular purpose for which I had bought it - to use it in the surf at the Jersey shore. And my comments pertain to only that one aspect of the camera.The issue is condensation on the inside of both the lens and the LCD screen when the camera is in cool water. Setting the stage, the Atlantic in NJ in August varies between 60 & 72 degrees (lets say 65), and the daytime air temp typically between 80 and 90, or a bit higher, and humidity is usually in the mid to high 80's. So there is a fair degree of separation between air and water temps, as well as humidity to deal with. As soon as I'd take the camera into the surf the lens would fog up on the inside (condensation) and pictures and video appeared as if shot through the densest fog imaginable. And of course auto focusing through that foggy lens was hit or miss at best - but that's neither here nor there, because the pictures were useless anyway. Once I noticed the problem I began just wading into the surf, attempting not to submerse the "waterproof" camera. But even this failed as mere droplet splashes from the surf would fog the lens. And this happened every day of our vacation, no matter what tricks I tried - and I tried many.I detailed this to Amazon and they promptly sent a second AW100 to my home. Upon returning home I tested both the original and new AW100's. In water that is close to air temperature (like a pond or swimming pool) both cameras worked fine - no fogging. However, cooling some water in a bowl to around 65 degrees caused both cameras to fog, and the air temp was only in the low 80's that day.One very puzzling thing to me is that the AW100 manual cites the condensation issue, says it's NOT a malfunction, and tells you how to clear it. And that's true - the camera is not broken or leaking, and the lens will clear in time (5 min avg). BUT, all pictures taken while in that fogged state are totally useless; and once you return to the water you're back to fogged up again immediately. To me it IS a malfunction when a waterproof camera cannot take a picture in or around cool water. And, as mentioned before, I have had another waterproof camera (Olympus Tough 1030 SW) which did fine at the Jersey shore for a number of years. Hence I know that fogging in 65 degree water does not need to happen - my Olympus Tough never once fogged, even in very similar conditions. Was it metal body vs. plastic body? I have no idea, I just know that the Olympus never fogged and the AW100 fogged almost immediately upon contact with cool water.I have returned both the original and replacement AW100's. Fortunately I have until next summer before needing to worry about another waterproof camera. I'll see what's available then, paying particular attention to the condensation issue.I give only one star, but depending upon your needs the AW100 may warrant a higher rating. It flunks the Jersey shore test badly, but if your needs are for the backyard pool and/or the Caribbean it may perform just fine. That said, if you get one I suggest you do a water test immediatly. And make sure the water is as cool as you're likely to encounter. Don't base it upon lukewarm bathtub water or your fish tank or even the fact that it's water tight. Because it is water tight - yet it still builds up condensation on the inside of the lens when there's a fair degree of difference between air and water temps.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof - Maybe splash proof
Reviews.Author: Don_Drapper
Reviews.Content: Camera is great!  I loved the camera but it is not waterproof.  I took it to the pool and it got water inside of it although lock was set correctly.  Other tough cameras I've tested took horrible picture but not this one.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX is COOL
Reviews.Author: Keith A. Prewitt
Reviews.Content: We were surpised and pleased that we got the product much earlier than expected.  Set up was easy.  It is hard to believe that you can take pictures under water, we will try it sometime in July.  We took some really high quality pictures this weekend.  Easy to download and view.

Reviews.Title: Camera OK supplier not so much
Reviews.Author: Peter M. Abec
Reviews.Content: The main issue with the camera is somewhat minor: in the video mode, you can barely hear the audio during playback even at the loudest setting. I figured this can't be right, so I returned it for an exact exchange.  The supplier, after all the proper "lip service" sent another fairly quickly.  The second camera was obviously another return that was not even opened by the supplier.  It was packed with a lot of the packaging missing (thought all the parts were there) and the screen was very smudged so it was obviously used for a while.  It had the same issue as the first.  I called Nikon and the best they could tell me was that the audio will be strong when played on a computer or other.  I tried it and it was.  Appearently the camera itself has very poor speakers by design (perhaps a side effect of the waterproof feature). Not sure if this is the case or not, but I certainly do not want an even more used one as an exchange just to find out.

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures.  Have not tried it underwater. Video is awful.
Reviews.Author: Carlos M Abaunza
Reviews.Content: I have taken some pretty good pictures with this camera.  Operating it is very easy.  Have not tried it`s underwater capabilities.  It's video performance is pathetic, awful... it may well be that I was doing something wrong, though.All in all, nice camera.

Reviews.Title: disappointing
Reviews.Author: J. Salisbury
Reviews.Content: disappointed that a large name brand manufacturer with a good reputation sells a 'waterproof' camera that leaks.just in a rain storm the screen fogs up from the inside and the camera shuts down.  it does still work after being left in the sun, etc to dry out.nothing manual or adjustable about this camera.  all auto and no bypassesone plus is that the coating on the lens is amazingly resistant to water spots.also very poor battery life.  about one battery / 100 shots and 4 minutes of video.

Reviews.Title: Avoid unless you don't care
Reviews.Author: lambergini
Reviews.Content: Not at all what I expected. For starters the camera leaked but not as bad as some other reviews I have read. I used it extensively in the water at the pool and in the lake for almost a week and the only time I noticed water in the camera was a few drops behind the LCD screen that would show up especially after the battery would warm up from extended use like 2 minutes.  Also my other issue was with the slow shutter speed in the sports mode. Very slow and at best 2 frames per second. That catches the inital jump and the kids being under water. No ACTION.  The focus and the flash were also not very reliable.  Did Nikon even test this product out in the real world before selling it?  Shame on Nikon. It seems from all the other reviews there are no good waterproof options out there.  Thank goodness for Amazon for taking back this crap of camera and refunding my hard earned money.

Reviews.Title: Not the best camera of it's stature
Reviews.Author: AmyAmes
Reviews.Content: For the past 5 years I've owned an array of waterproof/shockproof camera. My problem used to be damage to my digital camera and now my problem is losing the undestructable camera. Anyhow, I've had my shares of these types of cameras. The Nikon COOLPIX is a fun color, easy to use and takes pretty good pictures. I've had the camera for about 2 months now and have taken it skiing, hot tubbing, through family functions with children and it's survived. The only reason why I didn't give it all 5 stars is because I had the Olympus camera and it's by far the best in class. Prior to a water tubing incident where I somehow came up out of a turned over tube in water with beer in one hand and no camera in the other, I had the Olympus for over a year. I've never had any functionality problems with it, and as far as user friendly was concerned, it was top notch. The Nikon however is stuck on a setting where the flash is only on auto or off. On auto, it doesn't always take the best pictures at night because the flash doesn't go off and there is NO WAY to make the thing go off until you take a million pictures and hopes it flashes. It's also stuck on a setting where all the pictures on the review, is on a slide show and I cannot for the life of me figure out how to get it off of the slideshow. The manual didnt help so now I'm stuck. The only thing the Nikon has the Olympus could do a better job at is clarity and auto focus. Even in the dark it has an amazing clarity to it, even though its just.. dark. I'll probably use this camera for another couple of months and hope I am able to keep it at bay but if I lose this one, I'll most likely go back to the Olympus.

Reviews.Title: Best P&S; Camera AND save $50
Reviews.Author: TucsonShopper
Reviews.Content: I had all (five) of my cameras stolen and this was my first replacement. It is the ideal Point and Shoot allowing one to bring a SMALL camera with them no matter how rough the treatment. Picture quality is stunning (the HD video is better than my lost HD camcorder), vibration reduction and auto-focus is impressive, while the GPS tracking to properly upload photos to Google Earth is fun. Professional reviews say this is best ruggedized camera and it is sure to please both novice and experienced user. I also bought a 32GB micro-SD card, an extra battery, a Sunpak polarizer filter, a Pedco Ultrapod, screen protector, and a small Neoprene case. The SD card and battery fit into a sealed enclosure to maintain water tightness (which of course also means less optical zoom as compared say to a Coolpix S9100). The camera comes with a snap-on adapter for filters. Alas, no raw mode as common to Coolpix line. It's already more than $10 less than during Black Friday week AND you can now save an additional $50 (valid January 1, 2012 through January 28, 2012 - see first comment for URL).

Reviews.Title: I haven't purchased any digital cameras until the Nikon Coolpix AW100, but i can tell you that i am completely satisfied.
Reviews.Author: Barbie
Reviews.Content: I haven't purchased any digital cameras until the NIKON Coolpix AW100, but i am completely satisfied with it. The picture quality is just about what i expected from 16 megapixles. It does not have an insanely fast shutter speed, but this is not a camera designed for fast photography. The camera was built to withstand life. Built for those seeking adventure. This camera is tough. You can feel how solid it is just holding the camera. I have no submerged the camera yet, but i'm sure there will be no issues. I look forward to the day that i have to dunk it in a creek because i just dropped it in a puddle of mud and my display has too much dried dirt on it to see what pics im taking. I used it primarily at night and caught some beautiful photos. The battery lasted well over 4 hours  3 videos and 153 photos and still has full capacity showing. I plan on taking it for another 4-5 hours tomorrow and know that i won't need to worry about it. This is an extremely reliable camera. I would recommend this camera to anyone. It is small enough to keep in a pocket. Durable enough to let hang from your neck without worry. You can use it in the rain, underwater anywhere you want to take a picture, but can't because your Digital SLR might get damaged. I would suggest this camera as a perfect backup if you are a serious photographer and need something for the sticky situations. It is very easy to use. The battery takes about 3-4 hours to charge initially. The strap is kind of a pain in the butt but, you can replace this easily. Don't be discouraged if you are like me and the pictures don't look so HQ on the display. They always look better once blown up on the computer. Don't let anyone fool you. This is a 16 MP camera and it takes great pictures. Don't compare it to a professional camera, but for the novice like me who just wants something to capture their life as they go and doesn't want to worry about tearing up some big expensive camera, but still wants to make sure they get a good deal and great pictures. This camera is definitely for you!!!!! A+

Reviews.Title: Don't do it!
Reviews.Author: J. Sullivan
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera for one year and it has already died twice. The first time was as soon as we got in the water on our trip to Barbados. Thank goodness we had a backup waterproof camera to take pictures of the sea turtles. Sent it back. Got another one and the brand new replacement made it in the pool twice before dying. Don't count on this camera ever! Also, it takes horrible photos in low light. Just a bad purchase overall and I really wanted to love it but just couldn't.

Reviews.Title: Poor Camera
Reviews.Author: ibuyer
Reviews.Content: Poor camera. Photos are often blurry, either from glare, easily-smudged lens, or temporary interior fog. The sun or lighting can't be anywhere in front of the camera, or overhead, or you will get glare streaks. Instant first shot, but slow thereafter. The sensor seems unusually noisy in other than sunlight; decreasing the resolution seems to help. The GPS uses the battery as fast as any handheld GPS: a few hours. This means your camera will be dead a few hours after a full recharge. There is no clear indication that the GPS is off, and there is no "GPS OFF" function (through a complex menu, you tell the GPS not to track, and I think then it is off. I hope.)

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Lesley J. Schmidt "Lesley"
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a trip to Hawaii, which I bought this camera for, and during my snorkeling trip the camera first got foggy and then completely died.  I have only had the camera for 2 months and used it in the pool with no issues so I assuming you can't use it in salt water (even though this allowed per the Nikon).  This product has a 1 year warranty but Nikon requires you to ship it back to them on your own dime.  Then they determine if you broke it or if it is a defect with the camera. They said this will take about a month to get my camera back (either fixed or not).  They won't send me a new camera so I am out an underwater camera for the rest of the summer.  A lot of good that does me.  Now I am finding this issue is happening to a lot of folks.  DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA because you will have the same issue as the rest of us.

Reviews.Title: disappointment
Reviews.Author: Sinclair7
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a snorkeling/diving trip to Turks and Caicos.  Daughter was going on from there to a marine biology program and we planned to leave the camera for her to use for the next month.Camera's viewfinder went black 3 days into the trip.  We hadn't done anything with the camera - in fact I'd just been taking photos around the pool area at our hotel and went back to the room and downloaded the photos - put the card back in and the viewfinder was black.  The battery was still working - recharged it to make sure it was fully charged - everything else worked.  Except the viewfinder.It took lovely photos both regular photos and underwater.  But something is wrong with the design.  On returning to the US I looked at some of the reviews and it seems I wasn't the only person who'd had this experience.
