We had used the camera underwater - but it had continued working after being used in the water and that didn't seem to be a problem.I've considered buying it as a regular camera - because it did take nice pictures - but since it failed after using it normally (not underwater), I'll try something else.  Unfortunately, we had to buy another camera for our daughter to take with her and there wasn't the selection available on the island and it was more expensive than it would have been at home.  Wish I could be writing a better review.

Reviews.Title: NOT Water Proof
Reviews.Author: BobT49
Reviews.Content: Bought this relatively expensive point and shoot camera expressly for a trip to Hawaii.  It is advertised as waterproof to 33feet.  The first time in the water it quit working after 10 minutes.  I rinsed it off in fresh water and thoroughly dried it out before opening it to check.  Sure enough it had leaked seawater into the case.  Well, no more pictures for the rest of the trip. I had followed the instructions for use in the water precisely as written in the owners manual.  It was never more than 2 feet deep and treated very gently during all use.If it had not been for the leak and failure I would have rated the camera very high.  It is very intuitive, easy to use and, for the most part, takes excellent pictures. The only fault I could find with it prior to the leak is the fact that it has no manual settings.  I could not over ride the internal focusing to obtain an infinity setting to allow a clear picture to be taken of the full moon.  Movies were easy to produce causing me to leave my video camera home.  Luckily I have a smart phone so I was able to take some pictures the rest of the trip.I will revise and perhaps upgrade this review depending on how Nikon responds to the returned camera. I just sent it back and I fully expect it to be replaced.  Since it has been exposed internally to salt water I doubt if it will reliably function for the long term even if they can dry it out and get it operating again. Again, a very disappointing experience for someone who has used Nikon products exclusively for many years.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix AW100
Reviews.Author: Zac5023
Reviews.Content: The Nikon COOLPIX AW100 has been a good camera so far.  I haven't had the chance to use it underwater so i really can't elaborate on that feature.  It is definitaly shock proof though.  Out here in Afghanistan i'm always dropping it because of all the moving around i'm doing.  So far it's holding up very well.  The picture quality and movie quality are awesome as well.  Pictures taken on the move are no problem for the AW100.  The auto focus feature does just what its suppossed to do.  I find the GPS of no use.  That is more of a personal issue though.  I found the software quit annoying so i just threw it away.  I bought this camera for the purpose of using it on my adventures.  I haven't been able to use it underwater yet so that's why i didn't give it full stars.  The price dropped dramatically since i first bought it, so i would suggest this camera to anyone

Reviews.Title: My first Nikon
Reviews.Author: Saif Rizvi
Reviews.Content: hi there, i am pleased to introduce and write about my newest camera addition, the NIKON aw100, amazingly well designed camera for the future and the outdoors..Form- excellent design, tough, rugged, looks very alluring, the color startling orange though on the downside, the buttons are terrible....terrible...but there is a learning curve for these waterproof, sealed buttons... if u can manage then the camera is for you,,like i have finally been able to do..Now i love the camera, previously i was using a canon sd 990 powershot but ergonomically it was better, but overall i am happy with this camera...Pictures-- amazing quality for the rugged class,,,the processor at 16MP is a steal and i recommend shooting at this setting for best results...though annoying setting buttons and a a real learning curve in trying to get manual with the camera/ this camera is best used on Auto settings....Though the pics arent bad...Videos----very nice colors,,,and the 240 fps is great and awesome,,,,and so is the 60fps....very nice videos is all i have to say... Nice HD camera...Strap and battery--- a little weak the battery from what i found and a terrible strap, which i replaced immediately...Waterproof---nicely done...i dropped in my fishbowl and it came out Alive! 'nuff said!overall--camera is worth the money and now you need you OUTDOOR adventure! out you GO!

Reviews.Title: thee worse camera ever!
Reviews.Author: lenny ginn
Reviews.Content: buttons don't work. Lens fog up inside. Don't bye it waste of money. Should have study more about this before i bought it!

Reviews.Title: I love my new Nikon  Coolpix Waterproof
Reviews.Author: Sandra
Reviews.Content: I love this canmera because the quality it's so good, I like the color too, and the pictures under the water are so good, and I buy it for a good price.

Reviews.Title: Not water proof and not what you'd expect from Nikon.
Reviews.Author: Mark Brophy
Reviews.Content: I got this camera couple of years ago, was fairly happy, took okay snap shots and was pretty rugged.  First year in the Caribbean it took fair picture in the water and some descent video.  Went to Aruba last week took it snorkeling and it flooded, needless to say I am very disappointed.  If you choose to buy this camera, I wouldn't recommend you put it in the water.

Reviews.Title: Poor pictures, reutrned defective first one & doesn't float
Reviews.Author: Ktsbelle
Reviews.Content: It takes OK pictures if you have perfect lighting.  We miss a lot of shots because it does not auto focus quickly.  And it takes awful evening shots..no matter what setting I have it on.Our first one we had to return because it leaked when it was used underwater..it stopped working. 2nd camera we got took decent underwater pictures..comparable to a disposable 35mm camera..however it was nice to not have to worry about wasting the film.IT DOES NOT FLOAT!!!!!!!!!!  So plan on tethering it to your wrist or purchasing an some device to keep it from sinking straight downBTW...AMAZON rocks with their return/exchange policy!!!!This is the accessory kit I purchased with the floating wrist band.. http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B007H9Y78I/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_71

Reviews.Title: No good
Reviews.Author: Brandy Buntin "Brandy Buntin"
Reviews.Content: I thought for being a Nikon it would be a great camera. But everytime I would use it under water the lens fogs up and I cant take video or pictures again until  it clears. I had a warranty and turned it in thinking the camera had a problem. Apparently its normal for the lens to fog up underwater.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Camera screen went black on about the third time in the water. I can now see why.  Leakage around the battery/digital card compartment. I was very careful with it.  Now it is just $240 worth of tin and plastic.

Reviews.Title: No Lens Cap
Reviews.Author: truth seeker
Reviews.Content: 1 STAR for 1 REASON:NO LENS CAP.I called Nikon.  No help.  Personally for a waterproof camera I would think a lens cap is standard for protection.  If your lens is scratched the entire camera is useless.Also the camera has a huge and bulky battery charger.  So much for rustic adventure.  Any camera this size that can't be charged directly is a waste of resources.

Reviews.Title: Not happy with the product
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: Nikon said it was a point and shoot,but it was a point and wait,i do lots of pictures in Alaska and i dont seem to be able to get the action shots that i would want with it,in other words animals usally do not wait around 5 to 10 seconds while the camera is trying to trake its picture9it was to dam slow)The person i bought it from was honest but Nikon miss represented it,so i returned it

Reviews.Title: LEAKS...first time in water.
Reviews.Author: Margie Jacobs
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and it takes GREAT pictures, but don't believe it is waterproof (to ANY depth).  It is out of warranty so I have no recourse but to warn others.  We went to Cancun recently and I took it into the pool and it was never more than 2 feet in depth...yet, shortly after getting out, I saw evidence of water intrusion.  The first evidence was the condensation in the lense...I tracked down some rice and put it in the rice to hopefully forestall any further damage, but after 5 days in the rice, I removed it and it won't even turn on.  So, if you expect to get great pics out of the water, it does that well, but I would never take it into the water...you will have no way of knowing if it is waterproof until it is too late.  Shame Nikon.  Last Nikon I buy.

Reviews.Title: REAAAALLLLLLYYYYYY slow focus!!!
Reviews.Author: GM
Reviews.Content: I guess the title pretty much summarizes my experience with it. I bought it so i could take photos with my family as we went outdoors without having to worry about the weather, but i never got to test the all-weather capabilities. It was really slow focussing, even in bright daylight and all i got was blurry photos of my daughter. i tried every setting and every mode on the camera and same result, so i just returned it.I thought the orange color was really cool and the overall layout of controls and buttons was good, but what's the point if it can't take the photos you want?!

Reviews.Title: Lasted 1month
Reviews.Author: Nevin Leiby
Reviews.Content: Used hiking on rugged trail for 10 days, then took to Hawaii the next month in 2/2013. Viewfinder cut out when snorkeling which was odd because the lights were still on. After multiple battery changes, I realized that it wasn't a dead battery but the viewfinder failed. It still works, but useless without the screen. Nikon nor BB would honor refund and hundreds of posts about the same topic in the forums.  Considering that I was so diligent and focused on NOT getting a leak and ensuring clean seal, it is a clear manufacturing defect that it failed. So much for warranty.Not surprising that they no longer sell it. Total P O S life despite an otherwise great camera. Awaiting 2/11/14 release of AW120 to see if it's any better. Very happy with GPS tagging and would intermittently turn on shooting picks on the trail to conserve battery.

Reviews.Title: Great pics, not waterproof, lens always exposed - dried water droplets or dirt on lens glass can mar pictures
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: Takes great pics. It is NOT waterproof. I use it for kayaking, not diving. It never gets submerged in water, but it is in a watery environment (I keep it in the chest pocket of my life jacket that I am wearing). On a particularly rough day, it did get pretty wet just in my chest pocket. That day, the inside of the battery compartment got wet; I didn't know until the next day when I was checking my gear and opened the battery compartment to find the terminal on the battery a bit corroded from the little bit of salt water in it overnite. The other problem with camera is the glass on the lens is exposed all the time - it does not get covered when the camera is turned off. It gets dirty, and also if the camera does get wet, then the water droplets dry on the glass and you can see them on your pictures. So - you have to check the glass in those conditions, and buy and carry something to clean the glass. This reduces its functionality in a watery environment bec the water environment is usu one where you are busy and can't fuss with things so much. On a dry environment, I would just check the lens in the morning and clean it if needed -so that was one more thing to check but not such a trouble. A positive-it did get dropped once -onto a carpeted surface - and it worked fine afterwards.Would I buy again - yes, but if a "waterproof" camera comes out with a covered lens then I would prefer that one.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Tessa Mozzini
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I use it going fishing and it works great in the water!!! Can't wait to use it again!!

Reviews.Title: Works ok
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: This camera does what it suppose to do. My problem with it is when I'm recording and make a sudden move/turn its doesn't record the sound. For a 16mp it doesn't take pictures so well under low light (I think thats what the mp are for right???). But im happy with it, I got this for my kayaking trip and it caught and capture memories that will last a life time.

Reviews.Title: I found it lacking for low light and lacking for panoramas
Reviews.Author: K. Haenel
Reviews.Content: I took pictures with this camera for 3 days, then returned it. I was replacing a 3-year old Canon Powershot D10 that had started malfunctioning (lens error, intermittent). The shots looked good on the camera's LCD screen, but when uploaded to the computer and viewed on a large monitor, the grain/noise in the lower light shots was noticeable and distracting. I might have been able to fix that by setting the ISO manually...didn't keep the camera long enough to try. I did notice a much more limited set of choices in the menu than on the Canon D10 - for example I could not set increase contrast/saturation like I could with the Canon's Vivid setting. The deal breaker that led me to return it, though, was the terrible quality of the panoramas. Taking them was pretty nice - just panning across the horizon with the shutter down - but looking at them on the computer - Yuck! They were full of stitching artifacts (stutters - repeated image parts and/or breaks in the image on 3 out of 5 attempts) and VERY low resolution. I returned it and bought the Canon Powershot D20 that I'm still evaluating, but am happier with so far.

Reviews.Title: A Nice Camera but...A
Reviews.Author: Douglas Thomas
Reviews.Content: This is a good pocket camera that takes good photos.No viewfinder is a minus but I knew that when I bought it (balancing waterproof, size and features available.)  Without a viewfinder, the image screen (always on) reduces battery life.  My previous camera and a Viewfinder and I certainly miss it.Screen scratches easily.  Where you find water you often find sand which is very abrasive. Considered a lens protector but don't know if they are waterproof.The screen is large and does OK in sunlight.The lens did fog up once which surprised me because I came from a low humidity environment to a lower humidity area Idaho to Arizona).  When taking a photo of a water fall (I was near the mist and in the shade), the lens fogged up.  The camera had not been opened in a high humidity environment.  There is a dry out procedure in the manual which I have done at home.  Have not been back to a similar waterfall conditions to retest.

Reviews.Title: Charger Massive /construction
Reviews.Author: chenstyl
Reviews.Content: The charger for this small camera is ridiculously large.  Very poor charger design.  Everything else is great.  My advice is buy a smaller after market charger.  I got the camera today and already order one.UPDATE:The camera takes great pictures but it is very poorly constructed.  It fell apart with no shock etc in less than 30 days.

Reviews.Title: Only English language!!!!
Reviews.Author: Enrico
Reviews.Content: The shipping time was good, but i notice that the language configuration only have English and Chinese or japanese!!!! Im realy disappointed!!!Im thinking that its not a good idea buy some ítems in Amazon providers

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Hekman
Reviews.Content: This camera works great so far, the GPS isn't as accurate in Central America as I had hoped but I bought it because of the other capabilities. The big action button on the side is easily triggered (a great hands-free function) but it also turned on in my purse by accident, wearing out the battery faster than I'd like. Thus I'd recommend a camera case for certain.There are also some special functions that were difficult to figure out at first but the manual (CD) lays out everything much better than the quick-guide. Both manuals came with.

Reviews.Title: Really blurry pictures
Reviews.Author: Alicia Binns
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and returned it the same day it was delivered. I was really excited to have a camera that was waterproof and rugged since I do a lot of outdoorsy stuff and recently purchased kayaks, and I thought this would be perfect to take with me on my next trip. However, when I went to test it out, half my pictures came out blurry and the other half were just wholly unexceptional. I guess maybe I'm just used to higher quality cameras, but I figured this one would be okay because everyone spoke so highly of it. That turned out not to be the case. I think I'm going to get a sony nex3n and a waterproof casing instead. A whole lot more money, but probably worth it in the long run.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Thea Kratochvil
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a family vacation to Jamaica. The second day we went snorkeling and my son dropped it. The tour was headed back and while he tried to retrieve it, he couldn't and didn't tell me about it until we were half way back. I chalked it up to being gone. Two days later a couple came up to me at the resort, they had been scuba diving that morning and found it. They identified us by the pictures on on the camera. It still worked after being submerged for two days and the pictures were great!  It still works fine. I am very technologically challenged and found this camera way easy to use, it took great photos and really it lasted two days underwater!  I tell everyone who is interested in a waterproof camera to look into this one. Will take when we go to Florida this summer.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: icy
Reviews.Content: Purchase this for my parents.Easy to use, nice orange color.Light and easy to carry.Can take good photos in the daylight.I didn't try the water proof function, hope it will be nice.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Rich Brunt
Reviews.Content: Depsite the camera being camaflauge it works great.  Took it on a cruise with me and took great pictures both inside and outside the water.  I think the underwater pictures look better than the underwater video but overall very satisfied with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Like
Reviews.Author: Norman Weinelt
Reviews.Content: Great camera, dont like it that I have to use 18 words to make this review, I will not be making any other reviews, dumb rule.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Jayci Ventura
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a cruise to the Bahamas and it's a great product. Pictures come out clear and the camera is waterproof. I have not had a problem with this camera. I dropped it a few times and it still works!

Reviews.Title: Not for us
Reviews.Author: Gina Sharp
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera because it was supposed to be one of the best ruggedized cameras.  I, honestly, can't say how well it takes pictures because I only took two before I knew it had to go back.  There are a few protrusions on the casing (the lens and a couple I didn't know what they were for) that make me feel like, if I dropped it, they could break really easily.  Also, there a ton of options for shooting and no touch screen.  So, you have to go through each one by pushing the buttons...kind of tedious. And the panorama feature... you have to take each picture separately, piecing them together by the shadow image of the previous pic, which is also tedious.  I immediately returned this one and bought the Sony DSC-TX20.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera and piece of mind
Reviews.Author: Tapps
Reviews.Content: I use this camera primarily to take pics of my kids. The quality is outstanding. In good light it rivals what I get with my D7000.It's not great at capturing motion but I clean up a lot in Lightroom.For low light I've found it better to turn off the auto flash and adjust in post.I spent a lot of time at water parks, this camera is a nice piece of mind.It's not perfect but if you work within the cameras limitations you can get some great shots.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy on line
Reviews.Author: NIall
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a present from my brother for Christmas. In April the screen cracked rendering it useless. It was clearly a warranty issue as it was cracked by a 18 month old toddler... either that or it is useless as a outdoor camera, I dont know which as nikon would not even look at it. I brought it with the receipt to my local nikon dealer who told me it was not bought in canada and as such the Nikon canada or US would not deal with it, I explained it was bought for me on line and showed the receipt he said there was nothing he could do for me. It is $260 to fix the screen I believe, nearly the same price as the camera.... If you buy this camera on line nikon will not help you if anything happens to it. They are VERY uncooperative and costumer service is crap.The camera was ok when I was using it, a little graney but over all ok image quality.I would not buy nikon if you have the option particularly on line.

Reviews.Title: everything that I wanted
Reviews.Author: timtoll
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take on hikes that I would not want to take my DSLR on and it was just what I wanted. light weight easy to use and take great pictures. so far I only used it in the snow and the cold.when I get a chance to use it under water I will update. but for hiking it is great

Reviews.Title: Excelente...
Reviews.Author: Juan Vera
Reviews.Content: Excelente equipo, sin duda la una de las mejores inversiones realizadas por cualquier fanatico de los video juegos.Aconsejado al 100%!...

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Sandra McGuire
Reviews.Content: Great underwater pictures.  Perfect for beach and pool.  It takes very good video even in low light situations. I bought another one for me after experiencing this one!!

Reviews.Title: Fun
Reviews.Author: chuck Henrichsen
Reviews.Content: Took it to Africa and it took great photos. I took it into Lake Malawi and the underwater pic are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Well built and good pictures
Reviews.Author: Jim T
Reviews.Content: I am surprised how durable this camera is compared to my old digital camera. It will definetly hold up better outside and out on the boat.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Product
Reviews.Author: Oscar Lara Rincon
Reviews.Content: Nice pictures, quality, imaging.Perfect to share with kids, no problem if they drop itNice for outdoor I recommended it

Reviews.Title: Has a bit of a learning curve
Reviews.Author: Karen Boylan "Silly Aunty!"
Reviews.Content: This will be my the fifth CoolPix camera I have purchased in 15 years. I have purchased them for myself, for use at my office and one for my mother.  So I needless to say I feel myself pretty knowledgeable about the CoolPix settings and navigating through its menus.  However htis camera's software is set up much differently than all the other CoolPix.It has an automatic setting - so you do not have to choose your scene and it should judge the condistions and choose the most optimal...This automatic setting works horribly. Our first use o the camera was outside on a bright sunny day. The pictures were wonderful, sharp clear and vibrant color. However anything shot indoors on auto is cloudy and grainy and out of focus. I have noticed that I can be indoors in pretty average to bright light and it will choose the night landscape setting resulting in blurred photos. Or it chooses the underwater setting that results in hazy photos. I have been trying to shoot night landscape and it has selected a different indoor setting resulting in dark photos.  for anything I take indoors I pretty much  have to use the indoor party setting and the backlight setting does not seem to work as well as the other models I have.When the camera is set to the appropriate setting they are sharp clear and good qulaity, But for a point and shoot it takes a little more effort than I would prefer and the automatic setting is useless.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: damma64
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband as a gift and he "LOVES" the camera.  It came highly recommended by a friend.  I am very pleased at how quickly I received the product just before the holidays.

Reviews.Title: easy sturdy good quality
Reviews.Author: Stefan van den Akker
Reviews.Content: - picture quality: good, bit soft around the edges though- functionality: does everything a point and shoot needs to do, plus some more cool features- sturdy? Hell yeah! dropped it in water, snow, held it in extreme cold and no problems so far.recommendation: buy at least a 32 GB card with it and a floater cord to not loose it in the water!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: April S. Brown
Reviews.Content: Getting ready to take it to the Bahamas. Love it!  Bought this one as a replacement for the orange one I had just like it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph J. Albanese
Reviews.Content: Its a great camera!  It is easy to use and takes great pictures.  I like the idea that the camera is waterproof!!

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Nurse53
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the waterproof capabilities. I have not tried that out yet. I have taken pictures with it and they have turned out great.

Reviews.Title: No Linux Software Support, terrible customer service
Reviews.Author: William T. Kranz
Reviews.Content: I was given a Nikon AW100 for Christmas, I've only taken about 6 pictures so look elsewhere for a review of the physical camera.However I am one of the minority computer owners who run Linux.  Not only does Nikon not support this Operating system, but their technical support is terrible.  I've made two help requests, and gotten replies that come no where near addressing the questions I asked about software.  I will probably not buy (nor accept gifts of) Nikon again if this is the norm.If anyone is interested there is a free sourceforge.net package, gphoto2 ver 2.5.0, that will let you transfer images from the Camera to a PC running Linux.  Seems to work, but Nikon either does not know of it, or is unwilling to mention 3rd party software.

Reviews.Title: Cool camera!!!
Reviews.Author: deanna
Reviews.Content: This was a gift to my granddaughter who loves it because all of the cool features!!!  She hopes it's indestructable!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: JENNIFER COLLINS
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use. Has good instructions that are easy to follow and Amazon's price was unbelievable!! The orange color will make it easy to spot in my bag.

Reviews.Title: Not a great camera
Reviews.Author: Keith Chicquen
Reviews.Content: Pictures were of medium quality and zoom was inadequate ...lots of blurry photos if light was low or if there was movement of subject.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Marsha Bierly
Reviews.Content: I love it.  It took it to Turkey and got a lot of beautiful shots.  My husband also bought one, a little bit different model, but he's happy with it also.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX AW100
Reviews.Author: visions
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera, the operation is very simple.Should I choose not wrong.Shortcoming is that feel too light, the price should be more favorable!

Reviews.Title: pretty sweet
Reviews.Author: yoyoma
Reviews.Content: UPDATE!!!  I USED THIS CAMERA IN WATER A COUPLE TIMES AND I GUESS I DIDN'T REALIZE THIS BEFORE BUT THE MICROPHONE IS SO MESSED UP. It really sucks. I AM PISSED OFF ABOUT IT OBVIOUSLY FROM CAPS. THERE IS THE MOST ANNOYING TICKERING AND BUZZING SOUND NON STOP THROUGHOUT RECORDING IN MY TOTALLY SILENT ROOM. I AM GOING TO REFUND IT IF POSSIBLE AND GET A GO-PRO!Could be a little better , like make an additional underwater housing that can go deeper and that's about it. its really good, such clear quality. i don't think there's anything wrong with it at all. i take it to the beach all the time, like every weekend, and it works great. I've dove down prob 20 ft with it and had no problems at all. so ya. it's a good buy!

Reviews.Title: Horrible casing
Reviews.Author: Angie333
Reviews.Content: Camera takes excellent pictures but the casing is absolutely horrible. My camera won't even work anymore because water got into the battery compartment.

Reviews.Title: Neat little toy for  300.00
Reviews.Author: Sammy K. Chin "Sammy"
Reviews.Content: Con: the screen get hot/ and battery dies faster. Don't know if there is an issue with the camera or it just the way it is.Panorama feature is neat. love it!!I don't know if I am going to use all the features of the camera.Get a float for the camera. Floatation straphttp://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003CK10DG/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i02

Reviews.Title: New Pool Game!!
Reviews.Author: Guney
Reviews.Content: Fun for pool and seaside. Very good quality videos and photos. I especially enjoyed slow motion videos, even though it comes with low resolution drawback.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: On the Road
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon P90 but wanted something smaller, and waterproof/shockproof. I looked at many, but figured out I was going to have to up my budget to get something of better quality. And AW100 won hands down. What a great camera. I like it also for the added GPS ability. I am going on an extended European trip so it will be great to have the GPS so I will remember where all the pics are taken. I also like the fact the menu is similar to my P90.Takes great pictures and the macro is good too. I haven't had it long enough to learn all the features yet. It comes with a cd for the manual. I would have liked a book too so I can take it along to look up things when I'm on the road.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: CivDiv
Reviews.Content: Great 1080p HD video. Great photography. Simple to use. Not disappointed whatsoever. I might even buy another one to have two perspectives. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: My o My!
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: Man i love this camera. It is excellent and take great pictures of anything and everything. A must have for a outdoors, hunting person. Also works good underwater. Pretty neat and a must have people!!!!

Reviews.Title: Terrible image quality.  It is waterproof and kind of easy to use.
Reviews.Author: N. Aoun "N"
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's the unit I bought, but the pictures are of terrible quality and all washed out and super bright.. I had to adjust and fix Brightness, Color saturation and hue on every single picture especially if there is a background light.  I am gonna get in touch with Nikon and see if the warranty will take care of this issue.Otherwise I tried it in the Ocean and in rivers and there were no issues, it does not leak and it's quite water proof.Finally it's easy to use but it's all pre-programmed programs and there is no way to do a manual adjustment.Overall, I think it's a poor camera and it's not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Nikon, you could do better
Reviews.Author: Pffttt
Reviews.Content: There is a bug in the firmware, you migth loose pictures if your not carefull.Problem:When, in playback mode, on a protected img. if you press the discard button, the image is deleted instantly.Workaround:Never press the discard button in playback mode.To Nikon:Recomended solution:When Delete Protected Img;"Delete"etc."Current PROTECTED image"etc.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Noah
Reviews.Content: I normaly use a DSLR that cost well over $1000.00 so when we decided to go on vactaion where we would be boating and swimming I did not want to risk my "good" camera.  I purchased the Nikon AW100 since it is water proof and thought even if it got ruined it was better then loosing the DLSR.  I was very supprised at how nice the photos came out and the Nikon AW100 did hold true to its claim at being water proof.  I had no leaks and had it under water for several hours a day all week.  The panorama feature is very nice and easy to use as well, it realy helped capture details that could be missed with another camera.  It also does an awsome job with the HD video, all our clips play in true high def on our TV.  Battery life was not as good as my DSLR but was very respectable considering other point and shoots I have used.

Reviews.Title: FROM 3 TO 4 STAR - AWESOME LITTLE CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Wind Sock @ RedTop Landing "MadScientist"
Reviews.Content: 3 STAR INITIAL REVIEW: I bought this to take on a cross country trip that ended at Yosemite.  At 16 mega pixel setting, it will go through a battery after ~100 pictures.  Never could get panorama to work - even with the 32 GB disc.  I bought 3 back-up batteries & they weren't easy to find at that in Flagstaff & Sante Fe.  Pictures are not awesome by any means, but I am just an amateur & did not want to take the Cannon Rebel Ti1 this time around as we did a lot of hiking & that camera is just too bulky. Seller of generic battery said it was no different than Nikon, but OH yes they are!  I will be purchasing true Nikon battery for the camera as generic can ruin a camera.  Note the gold plate on back of Nikon battery is missing on generic & I believe this has something to do with camera reading battery life, etc.  The other battery can be read by camera, but I suspect only lab testing could determine difference between the two.4 STAR 3/2014 UPDATE:  We took this camera and a Go Pro to Hawaii this year.  And to my utmost surprise, this camera almost out performed the GoPro in underwater shots of fish, etc. while snorkeling.  Had no "leakage" problems, though we were only in 10-12 feet of water most of the time.  The GoPro simply offered more options, like reviewing video on iphone and wide angle views, plus different ways of attachment (head & wrist attachment options that can be purchased separately).  I didn't purchase any "safety float" attachment for Coolpix as it hung comfortably from my neck while snorkeling.  Wish I had used it more for travels around the island vs iphone - no comparison of these two when taking photos - iphone just doesn't get there for me.  So my initial 3 Star has been updated to 4 Star.  It would probably merit a 5 Star if I would take more time to learn how to use if more effectively.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Kerns "James"
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera.  I'll be honest, I didn't test the weatherproof attributes, I just didn't have the opportunity on my cruise.  This camera takes fantastic pictures.  At night it even took pictures without the flash and they turned out fantastic.  I had a large DSLR and just wanted something smaller to use.  This camera will not disappoint.  I highly recommend this camera.  I wish I could put a couple of the pictures in my review to show you.  I'll try and put some in the general product area of the night time, no flash pictures.

Reviews.Title: Decent but...
Reviews.Author: Futile
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use as a GoPro esque style camera. I figured the addition of Optical Stabilization would help out a bit.I ended up sending this back. The video modes were quirky. Filming 60 fps was limited to 720p which is fair enough, but it would only do 60fps for short burst during the filming, meaning that you'd get mixed FPS videos, and during that portion have no sound. Perhaps I was messing up somewhere, but I found video at least pretty limiting for my needs.I've no doubt the camera is pretty decent for those of you that want a small, rugged, Point and Shoot with some video ability. For me it didn't make the cut.Back to my GoPro and ContourHD.

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpis
Reviews.Author: firemnmike
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and essentially threw it in my pocket a day before heading to Canada for a ski trip.  No time to parctice or take some test picuters.  It was easy to use and worked great.  I would recommend this camera to any one that needs a tough design that is also waterproof.

Reviews.Title: this camera is terrible
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: this camera is terrible.  menu is difficult to navigate.  auto feature leaves pictures dark.  flash rarely works.  this was a lot to pay for a camera that is sobad.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof,  but American Express to the Rescue!!!
Reviews.Author: Lake Bob
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Coolpix AW100 in June 2012.  I used it for snorkeling in January 2013 in Cancun with no problems. I used it again in January 2014 for snorkeling and the camera died.  When I returned to my hotel room, I opened it up and found water droplets inside.  I have been a Nikon camera person for many years but I would never ever get another one of their "waterproof" cameras based on my experience and the experience of many others who have written similar reviews.  Snorkeling was on the surface of the water and yes, I checked the seal to be sure it was clean before I left the hotel room.  As this was salt water, I am assuming my camera can not be repaired and will consider it a loss.  Prior to the death of my camera, I was pleased with its performance.But wait - I purchased the camera with my American Express Card. American Express extends the warranty on most products by one year. I contacted American Express and they credited my AMEX account for the cost of the purchase. Yes - the annual fee on the card may be expensive but for times like this, it is worth it! Thank you American Express.

Reviews.Title: well... it might have been nice... if it ever worked...
Reviews.Author: ella
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a trip to belize with my boyfriend and his family. Took it out one time, and it then stopped working. The screen turned black, and there was water inside. I've heard that panosonic has a terrible return policy or warranty thing.... LUCKILY we bought this camera from COSTCO and they gave us a full refund with no questions asked. If your going to buy this camera at least buy it from there so you can get your money back if it breaks!!

Reviews.Title: returned first, tried to return second - can't focus well
Reviews.Author: Joe Photo
Reviews.Content: I'm a photo enthusiast. (yearbook,shot weddings, nature etc. Also I'm a real estate agent so I've taken many thousands of photos over the years.)  I've owned several digital compacts over the years. I bought this Nikon Cool Pix aw100 after much research - wanted waterproof feature.  I brought the camera home and noticed every other shot was blurry. I bought it local to support the local camera store.  I brought it back and he gave me a new camera. Could I have gotten a second piece of junk? What are the odds. The camera just doesn't want to focus. If I'm lucky 3 out of 5 shots are in focus. Of the three the lighting/contrast is horrible. It got to the point where I don't even reach for the camera it's basically a paper weight. I did bring it back to the store but the owner insisted nothing was wrong with it.  I'm going to buy something different and give this paper weight to one of my kids. (actually bought a $79 digital for my daughter that takes better pictures! Granted it's not waterproof.) Very disappointed in Nikon...

Reviews.Title: best pocketable camera
Reviews.Author: jason Moyer
Reviews.Content: got this for my honey moon in hawaii dove with it surfed with it hiked with it. now i carry it every where. takes great photos.

Reviews.Title: Not new as sold
Reviews.Author: TRFerris
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera as a Christmas gift for my son. The camera was billed as new by Amazon. It is definitely not new. There are scratches on the screen and pictures of strangers taken by another owner were left on it! I am considering returning this as I am embarrassed and angry at Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Love my new camera
Reviews.Author: I. Ozmon
Reviews.Content: I'll let you know in a few years if it's any good.  That's the true test of tech stuff these days :P

Reviews.Title: Excelente Cámara
Reviews.Author: Anuar Farid Castillo Alvarez
Reviews.Content: Excelente Cámara. Este artículo es muy bueno, yo quedé muy satisfecho con ésta compra, creo que la relación costo-beneficio es excelente, por lo tanto recomiendo este producto.

Reviews.Title: Good Hardware, Terrible Software, Dissapointing indoor shooting
Reviews.Author: Baseball FanKC
Reviews.Content: I've had the Nikon Coolpix AW100 for about a year and now and I can say that this is most definitely a flawed camera.  I think that when you purchase an all-weather camera you come into it knowing that there are going to be some trade offs but I expected a little more from Nikon.  This is my first Nikon camera and I have to say I was very disappointed.  Two of the features espoused by Nikon are its smart software scene modes and its low light capability.First, the scene modes. There are a bunch of them and basically none of them are useful.  Your best bet is to put it in to auto mode and try and adjust the settings there which are very limited to say the least.  Plus, there is a very annoying quirk to the settings where some features are only available when you are in a certain scene mode and with around 30 scene modes that can be pretty frustrating.Second, the low light shooting. I have experience with DSLRs and this camera comes nowhere close in low light.  Even in a well lit room indoors the pictures are either over-exposed due to the flash going off or they come out blurry without the flash.  The sad thing is while it can't compete with a DSLR which isn't surprising it also can't compete with my iPhone.  In the same indoor lighting situations I had to fight to get a decent photo from the Nikon while my iPhone had no problem at all. In my opinion a huge failure on Nikon's part bordering on false advertising.Finally, I think it bears noting that when I first bought this camera one of the panels came loose on the bottom and I had to send it to Nikon to be replaced by a new one.  While the replacement came quickly and easily without issue the fact that I needed a replacement after one week is also a bad sign.Positives.  A couple positives are the GPS works pretty well and its a very attractive looking camera.  Plus if you take pictures in decent light then you can get some excellent looking photos.I have to imagine that there are better cameras out there that are as tough as this one and so I would advise anyone looking for a tough camera look at Olympus, Panasonic, or Samsung before this camera its just not worth buying.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof use review
Reviews.Author: Drylbits
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera 3 months ago and I was very happy with the photos. I'm easily satisfied so although it becomes blurry when zooming on in an object being video recorded, I did not complain... Good underwater photos and videos too... However, recently when I used it underwater, the screen went black. Sea water got inside after 3 months and screwed it up. The screen was black and it started working after a week only despite cleaning and drying it up. Initially after it started working, the screen would turn black after every shot so I have to turn it off and on again so I can take photos. It did that for a few days, then resumed working but looking at the USB part inside, it's started to corrode. Now I have to have it replaced before it's warranty runs out. Another problem is when using it under water, the lens would get foggy at times which is annoying and you would have to wait till it clears up again. I had cheap underwater cameras before that never had problems with water seeping to the inside but this one disappointed me in that aspect...unfortunately, that's the biggest aspect for me as Im always in the water.

Reviews.Title: Good, Not Great
Reviews.Author: David Stewart
Reviews.Content: Good camera. No doubt about it. It's relatively easy to use and takes decent photos for the type of camera it is. My complaints are mostly minor (some may even be user error). They are (in no particular order):1. Small buttons, difficult to use/find under water.2. Bright whites seem to saturate easily.3. Occasionally it doesn't power up when pressing the button. Press again and it works.4. With a known good memory card I sometimes get an error on the screen that says it can't read the card. Kind of a pain when shooting under water.5. GPS function sometimes really eats up the battery.I've gotten some good pics with it, and would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Lens error....
Reviews.Author: GLEN E FRAM
Reviews.Content: Seven months of light, dry land use and got the dreaded "lens error" out of nowhere just like I've gotten on my Cannon elf's,sent it in to be repaired we'll see how that goes......

Reviews.Title: Good waterproof camera with limitations
Reviews.Author: Wayne Moore
Reviews.Content: My wife purchased the Nikon AW100 from Amazon as a gift to me before a recent trip.There is a lot to like about the camera.  It takes very nice photos and videos.  The size is small so carrying it is easy and convenient.  Image stabilization is excellent.  It works well and takes good photos and videos under a few feet of water.  You can take excellent photos during rain.There are also some limitations with this and many other waterproof cameras. The controls have little travel, are too numerous, and are too close together.  The zoom control is inconvenient.The menus of the Nikon AW 100 are hopelessly misleading, complex and slow to respond.Battery life is poor with 200 shots max.  Buy extra batteries!Finally, do not buy aftermarket batteries for this camera because they will likely not operate the flash unit.  The Nikon battery is expensive, but it does work.I'm giving the camera a three star rating despite its issues and limitations due to the excellent photos and videos as well as because some of the limitations are intrinsic to current generation waterproof cameras.

Reviews.Title: LCD Cracked, Not Covered Under Warranty
Reviews.Author: klsum13
Reviews.Content: After a month of use, the LCD screen cracked, making it completely unusable.  I had used it both in and out of the water and under normal strain.  I sent it back in for repair and have been arguing with Nikon for a month now about the $100 fee for fixing it because the repair is not covered under warranty.  Apparently, Nikon does not cover shock damage for the camera it advertises as shockproof.  During the time it has been in for service, I borrowed a friend's camera - the exact same Coolpix - and it leaked into the battery compartment when I used it underwater.  After having been an Olympus and Canon customer for years, I was excited to try my first Nikon.  However, I have been nothing but disappointed in both the camera and the company.  Save yourself the hassle go with something else.

Reviews.Title: POOR picture quality
Reviews.Author: Tech-Guru
Reviews.Content: I REALLY wanted this camera to work out. It had all the nifty features that, as an outdoorsman, I wanted in a camera (waterproof, shockproof, dustproof, GPS tagging, HD video, long battery life, etc.). The camera's features are mostly intuitive.There are three major issues as to why I didn't like...the first one is a deal-breaker, the second two were relatively minor annoyances:1- PICTURE QUALITY- VERY poor...grainy, blurry with even the smallest motion indoors, blurry photos outdoors, washed-out colors.2- Charger- The battery charger comes with a ridiculously large charging unit and external power cord which takes up a lot of space (as opposed to (eg) a Canon camera where the charger has the wall-plug built into it.3- GPS- It took a while to lock onto the GPS satellites and it was impossible to get a GPS fix unless you had a completely unobstructed view of the sky.I think you can get better clarity with your photographs by purchasing a cheaper camera from a competitor.

Reviews.Title: What good is an awesome camera that can't take a good image?
Reviews.Author: J. Smith
Reviews.Content: I am no camera newb.  I've owned Minolta, Canon, and Nikon DSLRs (a D5100 right now) and Fuji and Sony digital point and shoots.  I don't like backpacking with my DSLR and after losing two Sonys to water damage during our outdoor activities, I extensively researched waterproof, shockproof, and dustproof point-and-shoots until I settled on the Nikon COOLPIX AW100 16 MP CMOS Waterproof Digital Camera with GPS and Full HD 1080p Video (Orange).  My wife and I are avid hikers and backpackers, so something that could put up with abuse was a must.  Additionally, we loved the orange color because it was easy to find in a pack full of a weekend worth of essentials.  But alas, after two weekends in the wilderness, we found that this camera just doesn't fit the bill.  My biggest complaint is noise.  At any ISO over 200, there is so much noise in the images that they are unusable.  And as anyone who's spent any amount of time in the woods can attest, there's not a lot of available light, so unless we wanted to keep the camera in manual mode and use a tripod or shoot with the flash all the time, there was no way around this problem.  Maybe if you plan to spend a lot of time at the beach this would be your camera, but for anything requiring low light performance, I suggest you look elsewhere.  I've returned mine to Amazon and will be receiving the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-TX20 16.2 MP Exmor R CMOS Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom and 3.0-inch LCD (Orange) (2012 Model) in a few days.  Hopefully I'll have better results.Pros:-Rugged.  Though I didn't drop it or get it wet, I know build quality when I see it and this thing is built to last.  I have no doubt that it would have lasted a long time.-Buttons are a pro to me.  The biggest worry I have about other models is how well a touch screen will work when wet or with gloved hands.  Having buttons was nice.-Start-up time.  It's amazing, push the power button and almost as fast as you can move your finger to the shutter button you can take a picture.-Case color.  Never came even close to misplacing it!Cons:-Low light noise.  This is the deal breaker.  What good is a camera if the sensor isn't sensitive enough to get a good picture in anything but the brightest light?-Sharpness.  Again, this is no good.  Many pictures looked way too soft.-Focusing intelligence.  This is a personal issue probably, but we love taking pictures of our dog when we're outdoors.  Dog faces aren't people faces and in Auto mode, this camera really struggled with this, which was kind of funny.  Either the tip of his nose was focused and his eyes were blurred, or his eyes were focused and his nose was blurry.Neutral/Musings:-The GPS seems like a gimmick to me.  Serious backpackers will have a dedicated GPS, so it's not difficult to cross reference photo time with track points.  Anyone relying on a camera to be their GPS and photography gear is asking for trouble as the battery life isn't sufficient to do both well.-The charger is a corded model.  I don't understand this; my Nikon D5100 has a wall charger and every Sony point-and-shoot that I've owned uses a wall charger.Ultimately, a camera needs to take good pictures and in my experience this one didn't.

Reviews.Title: Water leakage after using only a few times!
Reviews.Author: Justin Mytwocents
Reviews.Content: Update after 6 months.......sending the camera back because of water leakage. Only used it 4 times in a pool, and only at the surface (it didn't go deeper than 12 inches)  and was never dropped or knocked. We never opened the access door when it was wet!The Coolpix AW100 takes average quality photos.

Reviews.Title: It leaked.
Reviews.Author: bino
Reviews.Content: During it's first trip, the seals on this camera failed when used in the ocean.  It was during its initial charge so I know it's not an issue of failing to clean the seals or anything like that.  The camera siezed and stopped functioning with signs of condensation in the lens assembly and LCD screen.  Thank God for Amazon.com's great return policy!  I'll think twice when buying an underwater camera from Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Es excelente cumple todo lo que indica
Reviews.Author: Ricky Top
Reviews.Content: La recomiendo totalmente, cumple con todo, tiene los lugares en el GPS, una calidad excelente de imagen y muchos modos, además de ser a prueba de lluvia, y golpes ( se me callo y no le paso nada)

Reviews.Title: Purchased twice and not good after several weeks of use.
Reviews.Author: bherrero
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this camera, I own a Nikon SLR (D3000) and I thought I couldn't go wrong with Nikon as they are great cameras...up until I purchased this one. Nikon is not good in the point-and-shoot category.I purchased this camera on amazon and after 15 shots (really 15) screen went black and never came back on...I have read that this has happened to some others...after returning it to amazon, I decided to purchase it again from best buy (a bit better pricing and they gave me a carrying case for free).I used the camera and took several pictures for a couple of weeks in all types of scenarios, scene modes and played with menu options. I have a baby and ALL pictures come out blurry, even using the HDR feature, went to a party and all of them off focus, blurry, went to outdoors and if sun was a bit on the side, picture would look burned; I had a Sony Cybershot for may years and not a single picture came as these ever. Also when shooting at dusk in low light or at interiors, even using the feature for interior or low light, all pictures came out moved, not focused or the camera focuses something else.Never used it for underwater so I cannot tell if this works good or not, I wanted to save this for later, but after seeing that very few pictures came out OK, just decided to return it and went for a Lumix which is great and all pictures come out in excellent quality.Nikon dissapointed in the point-and-shoot area and even the best buy geek told me so when I returned it; they may be the best for slr's but not in this area.

Reviews.Title: Defective camera and terrible interface
Reviews.Author: Carolinboston
Reviews.Content: To make this short and sweet:1)The camera was defective upon first use...the camera would let you believe it was taking pictures, yet if you pressed the Play button to go look at them, sometimes they were not there!!  The photos were never taken!  I noticed this problem occurring and when it happens, the screen flickers a lot.  Suffice to say, the camera was essentially DOA.2)ALL indoor pictures are very very very orange-looking.  I've tried the camera in 6 different indoor settings...homes, hotels, libraries, etc.3)The camera has too many "auto" modes.  Just have 1!!!!!!4)The camera seems to save pictures in multiple folders.  So every 200 pix you take, a new folder is created and the next batch starts in there.  This is THE MOST RIDICULOUS procedure I have ever seen!  And we have owned about 5 digital cameras and 3 smartphones since 2002.5)The 16MP pictures are surprisingly small JPG files...3.5MB per file.  Our 12MP DSLR camera stores them at 5-7MB JPGs so why is a higher rez camera storing them at such low file sizes?!  I don't know but I don't trust it.6)The video recording is a bummer on 3 fronts:  a)it only allows you to record 29mins at a time.  Wanna record that 45 minute birthday party?  You have to split it up into 2 clips.  b)the video playback seems jerky...it kind of makes you motion sick when you watch it...not to with our iPhones and other video recorders  c)the video is recorded as the dreaded Apple Quicktime MOV file format!!!! ARRRRRRGGGGHHH!!!!Sadly, the Nikon brand either has a 1-time lemon or this model just plain stinks.  You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof? NO it is not!
Reviews.Author: AS
Reviews.Content: Right from the very first day the lense fogged up underwater. Gradually the problem got worse: the lense, then the screen, then also in town! Not much I can do, far abroad, no international warranty. After 3 months, about the 15th time that I used the camera under water, it finally shut down completely at the sight of a jelly fish. I took it to a Nikon shop, they sent it to the service center in the Philippines. Strange: the battery is ok and its compartment is completely clean, but the adjacent USB connexion is corroded. This cannot happen if I failed to close the door properly. But no warranty, repair costs 375USD. As for the specs of this camera: its only justification for the price would be under water use. for "dry" pictures, you can buy better at half price with more zoom. So don't touch it

Reviews.Title: Fogging Plagues Camera
Reviews.Author: Adam Mills
Reviews.Content: The Nikon site states that fogging is not a defect, and you should avoid rapid changes in temperature.When you want to take it into the water that's a little hard to avoid. So you regularly have to wait up to 30 mins to use the camera!The pictures are only ok, but all-in-all very disappointed we switched away from the Olympus line.

Reviews.Title: So Far So good
Reviews.Author: Grandios
Reviews.Content: Nice Camera good picture quality Nice Video, Cons its too big and i still haven't Figured out how to use the GPS if it is even a GPS or just a Gaget to pinpoint your location on the photo's

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: Oregon April "April"
Reviews.Content: This camera didn't live up to my expectations.  Maybe it's because I'm a camera dummy (though that's why I bought the point-and-shoot camera), but the camera was disappointing to me.  The auto function didn't do a very good job at picking the right setting, so lots of indoor pics turned out too yellow or dark.  Also, many shots were blurry - even though we weren't really moving much.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: tyler bundy
Reviews.Content: I ordered what was supposed to be a new Nikon coolpix aw100. One of my Soldiers here in Afghanistan has one and its an awesome camera. The one that I received has a scratch on the case, a scratch where the camera lens is and corrosion where you plug in the AV cable. Im not sure if the scratch affects the picture or not because the camera comes on but the screen never turns on and I cant take a pic.

Reviews.Title: still exploring
Reviews.Author: cirllee
Reviews.Content: haven't really had the chance to take photos with this camera, i think it is wonderfully built but i bought for someone else and took a few photos to see if i like it. kinda hard to adjust to sand flying in airl.

Reviews.Title: Be Prepared to buy everything Separate
Reviews.Author: Anthony Trombetta "ONLINE BUYER"
Reviews.Content: The camera is kool. BUT it doesn't come with any type of SD card or any case. I think for the price paid something should have been included

Reviews.Title: NIKON COOLPIX AW100
Reviews.Author: Ferra Lin
Reviews.Content: I had a Nikon Coolpix AW 100 but it was stolen. The camera worked well. I never had a chance to test the waterproof function but overall the quality of the pictures was good. After much research, I decided to purchase the same camera again. I got it with Prime membership and received the camera in 2 days. I charged the battery as soon as I received it and the next day I tried to turn on the camera. The camera turned on, and it showed the battery, zoom, etc icons on the camera but there was no image. I took the battery out and placed it back in but same thing. I looked up on the Amazon refund/replacement page and because it was not sold by Amazon, it could only be refunded, not replaced. Furthermore, after I filled out all the information on the refund page, it seemed like I had to pay for the shipping fee. I stopped at that point because I wasn't willing to pay the shipping fee for something that never worked. I then contacted Nikon customer service which was not very helpful. He asked me to ship the camera back to their service center, with shipping fee paid by me, and it'd take up to 10 days for them to receive it and have the technician look over it. He also requested UPS with insurance. I wasn't going to pay the shipping fee, so I called the Amazon customer service. The Amazon customer service was SUPER helpful. He immediately emailed me a return label and processed a full refund within 5 minutes. I think I'll buy this camera again from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Com 1 mês de uso o painel LCD começou a embaçar na praia
Reviews.Author: carlosmp
Reviews.Content: Comprei esta máquina para minhas filhas usarem na praia. no início foi perfeita. Com menos de 1 mês de uso desligou na praia, simplesmente não ligava de novo. Após um tempo na sombra voltou a ligar, mas ao entrar no mar, o painel de LCD embaçou e não era possível mais ver as imagens ou fotografar. Para uma câmera que se propões ser aquática e de múltiplo uso, foi uma decepção. Após um tempo na sombra volta a funcionar. O tempo entre uma foto e outro deixa a desejar. Para piorar o carregador parou de funcionar de forma inexplicada, com 90 dias da compra, me obrigando a comprar outro carregador, uma vez que já estava no Brasil. As fotos aquáticas são de boa qualidade, quando a máquina funciona. Na praia e em outros ambientes de baixa luminosidade deixa a desejar na qualidade das fotos. O GPS consomea bateria muito rápido quando está ligado......Tem muito a melhorar.........................

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Regisgirl
Reviews.Content: poor pictures.........might be good in the water but for regular shots I am very disappointed.slow and poor quality.............phone pictures are far superior

Reviews.Title: I ordered this as a cheap (?) point and shoot camera for snorkeling that had some capability to use for SCUBA.
Reviews.Author: Deborah Schneider "whatusea"
Reviews.Content: I have owned Nikon cameras before. I used to dive with the original Nikonis which were great manual cameras. The controls on this are impossible to memorize. It is not user friendly - nor does it seem consistent. I had a terrible time focusing under water as there didn't seem to be any place to look and get a clear view of what you want shoot. The flash seemed to have a mind of it's own.At best I may try to get rid of this on ebay or donate it to Salvation Army. I don't want to ruin another vacation fighting with a camera that should be "point and shoot" but requires a real  PHD to us it. I like my kind of PHD - my phd stands for "Push Here Dummy".  That's the kind of PHD camera I like!!!I'd advise spend a little more and get something better. Or do more research than I did. I read reviews and it seemed to get good reviews. Maybe it is user error.

Reviews.Title: as expected
Reviews.Author: PeteM
Reviews.Content: arrived on time for the event. 14 more words a a a a a a a a a a a

Reviews.Title: Best rugged camera on the market
Reviews.Author: Douglas Higgins "D Higgins"
Reviews.Content: We've had so many underwater cameras over the years - we love to take photos from hiking to way under the sea..

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: BH
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera. It's water proof. It takes great pictures. I have been well pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: skibiker
Reviews.Author: redberryphoto
Reviews.Content: Being a serious photographer specializing in sport, nature and underwater (scuba diving) photography. I was looking for a tough compact camera just for snapshots while snorkeling, windsurfing and photography in heavy surf. Nothing serious, just the camera that I do not have to worry about.After 2 months it goes back. It develops condensation inside lens and LCD display every time it is taken from one temperature environment to another (beach to water, AC room to outside), making it basically unusable. Maybe mine was a lemon, but I am not exchanging it for another.Another serious issue is location of the lens. The camera is a bit bulky for one hand operation.  So every time you use the other hand, fingers show up in the pictures.Other than that, I liked well marked control buttons.You can take good snapshots with this camera, if you ever figure out totally ridiculous operating system, way too complicated for a photographer. But I managed to get around Nikon's idiosyncrasy.  Some day Nikon will hire photographers to design their compacts, just like they do with SLRs.

Reviews.Title: A few flaws
Reviews.Author: Rocket man 360
Reviews.Content: A few drops of water leak into the battery spot. And when I play back videos the speaker is so quiet you can hardly hear it.

Reviews.Title: Camera designed for underwater
Reviews.Author: Diver
Reviews.Content: The camera is larger and heavier than a typical digital camera with the same or better picture taking capabilities. It survived rain and saltwater diving as advertized. What I was not prepared for was the decrease in sharpness in picture quality. The lens does not telescope away from the body of the camera and aparently that is needed to get as clear a picture as most of us have come to expect from today's point and shoot digital cameras. So bottom line is its highest and best use is taking pictures underwater.

Reviews.Title: Good but not quite great
Reviews.Author: gearhead
Reviews.Content: Boot up times are fast, some the pre-programmed setting are nice but the interface isn't 100% intuitive some allow flash, some don't, the gps is confusing and the camera is a bit big and heavy.  That being said it's been durable so far and stayed dry.  For the money it's good but could be better.  If you aren't using it regularly in the water I would get something half the size and weight, for the water it's been good, we take it surfing and kite boarding.  For biking it's a bit big to carry on a 6 hours ride and doesn't fit well in a pocket.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Much Peferct
Reviews.Author: DeployedMilitaryMember
Reviews.Content: Im not going to get into everything the camera does and or can do, because i think you need to do your own research just like i did. But, I will tell you some things that i did not know even after doing research (obviously the negative). I had this camera for about 6 months and ended up loosing it on a vacation. I loved the camera so much that i came right back on here and ordered another. That being said.....the GPS on the camera is for when you are viewing your pictures so you can see where in the world that were taken.....not to help you find a lost camera haha. The camera's record time even with a 32G memory card is only 20 min. No, there is no way to change it either....even if the memory card is blank and has TONS of room.....you still can only record for 20 min. So, if you think the GPS will help you not lose your camera or your want to make some kinda movie/record for more than 20 min.....you might want to continue your research or dont get your hopes up if your expecting different. Besides that, the camera and the research i did is 100% true and im def a happy buyer.

Reviews.Title: Close but not perfect
Reviews.Author: CAE-MI "CAE-MI"
Reviews.Content: Great phone in many ways but picture quality is less than impressive. My three year old $300 Sony SLR takes better photos. Really, it is a disappointment to me. I figured a few more years of tech improvements would make the little point and shoot the equal of the Sony. It isn't...but otherwise, it's a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Missing Features
Reviews.Author: unsatisfied  and injured "exposingthetruth"
Reviews.Content: The aw100 is missing features found on much less expensive cameras:There's no Time Display when you turn on the camera. You have to go into setup to view what time it is.After you take a picture, it's only displayed for 3 seconds. Many cameras let you adjust a much longerdisplay time.It's easy for your left hand fingers to get in the way of the lens.The camera has a slippery feel when holding it.I guess that's why they had to pay ashton kutcher so much money to advertise it.

Reviews.Title: Worked for one trip, now won't wake up.
Reviews.Author: Gerg
Reviews.Content: My wife bought this camera for me as a birthday present. We used it on a trip to Nashville. I was very pleased with the quality of photographs both underwater and just general shots. However after returning home, we only receive a "Lens error" message at startup and cannot navigate anything on the system itself. Luckily I can remove the card and recover the photographs, but now have a $299 camera which is useless. Needless to say it will be getting returned tomorrow. I hope a replacement works, but unfortunately, it will not be here in time for a cousin's wedding this weekend. Very disappointed with the Nikon durability. When I get a new SLR, it will have to be another Canon.

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality, far down from Nikon standard
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I owned and own many Nikon cameras. From an old  Coolpix P4, a D200, now a D300S,  I just purchased this new AW 100 camera without reading any reviews thinking that this camera would be up to par to any Nikon point and shoot camera. WRONG, the image quality of this camera is very poor. I am at the point of calling Nikon service center to find out if they would exchange it for another model. Otherwise it is going to stay at the bottom of my drawer. It is sadly a 300$ in the garbage.Beside this real weak point, the balance of the functions work well.

Reviews.Title: cool pix underwater camera froze in 2 days
Reviews.Author: md
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera brand new in box right before leaving for vacation. We also bought an extra battery just for back up. This camera is supposed to be waterproof to 30 something feet. On the 2nd day of vacation it completely froze. We opened it and removed battery to let air out. We tried new battery- nothing. It was totally useless and never saw below a foot and a half underwater nor was it ever laid in sand. It basically ruined our vacation as we could not film or take pictures of anything we did. We were in the Bahamas and the cost of a new camera was about double the U.S price. I will never buy this product again. I will be returning it for my money back but that does not replace the fact that I could not record our memories. They will never see another cent from me on any product they carry.

Reviews.Title: brain-dead flash, and no lens protection
Reviews.Author: SkipperSean
Reviews.Content: The flash in this camera seems to fire at full power every time, leading to terribly overexposed subjects.  When I first saw this, I thought "hm, must have missed a setting somewhere", so I dug through all the menus but to no avail.  Next, I searched Nikon's web site for updated firmware to fix this egregious problem, but no updates were available.  Thus the camera is useless for most indoor shots.  On the plus side, outdoor shots are beautiful when there's plenty of sunlightAnother problem with this camera is the absence of any protection for the lens.  The lens is somewhat recessed from the protective frame around it, but there is nothing to cover it.  I lent the camera to my 10-year-old to use for a day and it came back with a scratch that could not be fixed.The positives (GPS, quick focus, good 1080P video, water and dust proof) are outweighed by the negatives, and I can't recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Meh.
Reviews.Author: Lawrence
Reviews.Content: It's slow, very slow. The GPS takes forever to load up unless you leave it on all the time. It's not good for night shots. Good audio recording though, unfortunately it doesn't have an mic port though.

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix AW100 camera
Reviews.Author: sally shinn
Reviews.Content: Camera is unusable. Screen goes black. Very frustrated that it appears that someone has passed off damaged merchandise. I bought it as a gift for my daughter and she has just returned from a trip.  We are hoping there is still time to return it for a refund

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in waterproofing and the battery charger
Reviews.Author: JimBob
Reviews.Content: This is just a heads up... everyone has different purchasing criteria, but for me the AW100 is not going to make the grade ... two things:1) The only negative thing I have read about the AW100 that caught my attention was that a number of reviewers have had trouble with water intrusion. I received my AW100 today, and upon examining the sealing mechanism for the battery/memory card access hatch, I can see why ... it is a single-edge/lip compression seal that could be easily compromised by an overlooked piece of grit or strand of hair. For comparison, if you take a look at how the Olympus TG-820 door is sealed I assure you ... it will instill considerably more confidence.2) My other disappointment ... and I will admit I overlooked this attribute until I received my AW100. The battery (apparently) can not be charged in the camera. You must remove the battery and charge it in the (provided) charger. The charger is not very compact, and ships with a separate power cord (not one of the built-in/flip-out plugs). I need to travel light, and for me not being able to recharge the camera from a mini or micro USB charger (which I will already be carrying with me for my cell phone and other items) is a hassle and also adds weight and bulk.

Reviews.Title: I returned it
Reviews.Author: J Charles
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera a thorough test on my trip to South America this year, and was so disappointed that I returned it to the big-box store I bought it from. The photo quality was terrible! I'm an avid photographer, but not dependent on having a fancy camera. My last point-and-shoot more than lived up to my expectations, letting me take snapshots, close-ups of flowers, and landscape photos. But I REALLY wanted a waterproof camera so I tried this one.The photos were washed out and often out of focus. Even when mostly in focus, the focus was often soft around the edges. The color quality was lousy - both washed out and too dark in the same image. Close-ups were a nightmare - I had to delete almost all of the pictures I took of tropical flowers because they were SO out of focus -  and landscapes were better but still solidly in the mediocre range. And the user interface (button placement etc) was clunky too.I was less dissatisfied with the underwater shots... but then, my expectations were lower. I expected a memento from the trip, not an image I could hang on a wall, and that's what I got. Overall I've never had so much trouble with a camera!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Abe
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera "Used- Like New" for $40 less than retail. No complaints there. It was like new and it worked great right out of the box. The reason I bought this camera was because of the 1080p video in stereo, 16mp, the non-exposed lens, and all of the durability features. I was anxious to get it because I had a 4 state trip to go on and I wanted to make a photo journal of the trip. I should have brought the charger. The battery in this thing is weak. It is a 3.7volt, 1050mAh rechargeable battery that wouldn't make it past 150 shots in the daytime with no flash. The camera takes great photos and good videos, but it almost seems to me like its affiliated with Apple because it records video in .MOV format and nothing else. It almost makes me think that Nikon is Apple's un-official line of digital cameras. I am absolutely, 100% against the Apple regime, so this is a problem for me. I had to buy a video editing program that accepts .MOV format files. The program is slow on most computers, even on my higher-end desktop. Another problem I've had with 2 of my computers is getting the computer to recognize the camera. Connection via USB is time consuming and slow. And something about the way that this Nikon formats memory cards prevents me from viewing photos and videos straight from the card. It would be nice to have some alternate firmware that would allow this to be more of a Windows camera. File formats and connections aside, the video quality is up to par. The waterproofing is a pretty neat from what I've tested so far. I pressed record and dropped it into my friends fish tank and it made for an entertaining video. I've read other reviews since then, and I think I'll reserve that feature for when I might really need it.  Many of the 1 and 2 star reviews said that the camera leaked upon firs submersion. Scary thought. Other than the battery life, connection issues, and the .MOV format, it is a great camera, but these three things really limit what I can do with it. I sell used equipment so it is absolutely necessary that I have a durable camera, which this is. It is great for taking photos in the rain, and the fact that there is no exposed telescoping lens helps to prevent things from breaking when it gets bumped on steel and such.1-30-13 - UpdateThis camera has grown on me. I've used it underwater, in snow, dropped it, and it's still working great to this day. I've been able to work around it's formatting faults once I began experimenting with other video editors, and the SD card issue was resolved by using a better card reader. The battery life isn't as bad as I first though, but I recommend spending an extra $20 on a cheap set of 2 extra batteries and an additional charger.I've upped the rating to 4 stars, but I'd almost consider giving it 4 and a half. ★★★★ ½

Reviews.Title: a review of amazon
Reviews.Author: jj
Reviews.Content: yes i love this camera. i was pretty sure i would, due to to extensive research. mainly, i would like to thank amazon for treating me so well in the purchasing of this product. the first one i received was clearly used. naturally, i was unhappy. but amazon came through!!! with an extremely fast turn around. i received my new one in 3 1/2 days. the return process was easy and fast. i will certainly continue to do business with amazon. 5 stars for amazon

Reviews.Title: not good so far
Reviews.Author: Teri Watson "i am Amazon"
Reviews.Content: Man! this is my 3rd Nikon Cool pix that sucks!so ok, i have a Nikon D90-dslr.so i know what is clear image..i even call my D90 "bad-photographer proofed"just bc in cheat mode = Auto, pictures are very crisp and clear.i had been browsing for some tough snap and shoot.read some reviews..the reviews were good/bad.but what caught me was the cmos sensor [i thought in a snap and shoot cam??"]there's something about the cloudy, blur element to itit's like even the monitor shows that blur-y capturing..anyways, i will try on day time if this holds up.also, i am not so sure how the battery compartment will remain tightif underwater..more later then..

Reviews.Title: Not so Cool
Reviews.Author: Bob in the Valley "Bob in the Valley"
Reviews.Content: First you have to understand I am a D90 Nikon owner.  I love that camera.  It is fast and flexible.  My first choice.By the end of a vacation touring day it gets heavy.  It is also not waterproof.  So I carry the Coolpix at night.Obviously no view finder.  Slow to use.  Results are very questionable.I would not buy again.In addition, while smaller than my D90, it is still significantly larger and heavier than my prior Canon 450 shirt pocket size camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent! Its the best!
Reviews.Author: ALEXANDRE CORTINES GUIMARAES
Reviews.Content: Excellent!Its the best camera ever!I really want to take pictures in the water, and if this camera I can do it!

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Auteur
Reviews.Content: It's solid construction is perfect for outdoor.  This camera goes were I'd never take my DSLR.  Prefect to toss into a pack and capture the beauty of the day.

Reviews.Title: Does the job.
Reviews.Author: customer123
