Reviews.Content: This camera is very durable and does the job as far as point and shoot pictures of friends at parties, etc. The editing software sucks and there's no room for creativity or art.

Reviews.Title: Are you kidding me
Reviews.Author: Mef
Reviews.Content: Ordered this on a Saturday, was on my doorstep that Tuesday, I was expecting a lot more time due to the holiday schedule, but you guys knocked it out of the park.

Reviews.Title: Won't know until we take it underwater...
Reviews.Author: conlanja
Reviews.Content: This camera has worked WONDERFULLY thus far.  It exceeded expectations on general picture quality and ease of use, but the real test will be when we take it snorkeling over the holidays.  I will update after it has been exposed to salt water - hopefully it holds up.  I will go to 5 stars if it truly is waterproof over a couple of weeks.

Reviews.Title: more durable than other point and shoots
Reviews.Author: Sam Mercer "Sam"
Reviews.Content: I've generally been a big fan of canon point and shoot cameras, but those cameras are typically only good for 3 or so drops, so after going through a few of those, I opted to look for a more durable option.  The Fuji waterproof/shockproof camera was useless, so I decided to try this one.  What can I say other than its pretty good.  Reasonably durable, and takes pretty good pictures.  It is slow, and doesn't really have as many options and modes as other cameras, or maybe they are there but the menus are too hard to navigate.  In general, I'd say if you want something more durable than average, this may fill the gap for you.

Reviews.Title: Too fragile and the back screen is covered with Acrylic instead Policarbonate
Reviews.Author: Sandry Seibert
Reviews.Content: This should be my 3rd waterproof camera, so why should? Because I'm returning it due a lot of minor issues and bad material quality.I had a Lumix TS-2 and another Lumix TS-3, now I tried this Nikon AW-100 thinking about have a CMOS camera instead a CCD camera but I could not believe that this camera are so sensitive. In just one week in my pocket chared with my hotel card the LCD cover was totally damaged by the plastic card. Also the camera isn't more sensitive than the CCD as they promise here is a difference but you can't feel it.The image quality is good, but the configuration menu is quite hard to understand.I'm going to buy another Lumix.

Reviews.Title: Faulty camera, TWICE!
Reviews.Author: Toni Pope
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera back in June.  When I got it the first time I took it out of the package and discoverd it instantly did not work.  I sent it back, assuming there was a problem caused in shipping.  I got a new one, used it a few times and the same problem has occured again.  It will not record pictures.  It flashes, shows the picture in the digital view window but will not save the picture to the camera or an SD card. This camera is junk - DO NOT BUY IT.

Reviews.Title: cool concept, lousy video.
Reviews.Author: K. moon "economic stimulator"
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on a cycling tour and came home to an hour of some of the worst video I have ever seen! Jumbly and noisy and totally unwatchable. This seems to be a common problem with this camera. It may be wonderful for videos of the kids at a picnic or school play, but it is no susbstitute for the Go-Pro video system. The GPS is cool, but in the end, I want a hadnlebar mounted video system and this isnt it.

Reviews.Title: This one is going back
Reviews.Author: M. Lynn Horned "cmhorned"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because my son is going to study in Costa Rica and needed a waterproof camera to take to the beach and the rain forest.  I read a lot of good reviews and purchased this for him.  We took a weekend trip to Omaha to try it out.  After taking 156 pictures at the zoo, the reviews were not good.  I have owned 5 different digital cameras and each of my sons has one, so we are not beginning users.  The pictures that we took were just not sharp enough.  I expected some low quality shots indoors, but expected outdoor shots to be sharp and clear, and they just were not.  Most pictures looked like they were taken through a slight haze.  Of the 156 pictures, there were about 3 that were of good quality.  The performance of the camera was inconsistant. We returned it and are going with the Olympus TG 1.

Reviews.Title: Not So Great
Reviews.Author: M. Yo
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for a week. I returned it for two reasons:Switching to Video mode takes too much timeColors were not so true. Especially red is a bit on the orange side.Enough said.

Reviews.Title: Not Worthy of the Nikon Name
Reviews.Author: James R. Spitznas
Reviews.Content: I am a professional photographer (GoldFeatherPhoto [dot] com) and am a huge devotee of the Nikon DSLRs and lenses -- the quality simply can't be beat.  So when I wanted a pocket camera that I could easily stick in the pocket of my ski jacket or in the bike bag while out cycling, I went to Nikon first and thought this camera would be perfect -- small, waterproof, shock-resistant and 16 MP.  After the cameras first use, however, I packed it up and returned it without a second thought.  Here is what I found "wrong" with the camera:1) After walking around downtown Washington, DC snapping images in and around the monuments for 90 minutes the battery was depleted.2) The menus were difficult to navigate and there were too many settings that I had no control over.3) The camera repeatedly had problems focusing in situations in which it should not have (e.g., Washington monument against vivid blue sky).4) The quality of the images was very disappointing.  Even at the lowest ISO settings, there was a lot of visible sensor noise, and all of the images were a bit soft and edges were not sharp.  Some of this may be due to the fact that the camera only supports JPEG image files but even if that is the case Nikon should have offered a numerically lossless compression option.5) Rather than using a standard micro-USB cable, Nikon opted to have a non-standard USB connector for the camera.  Given all the other cables that I have to carry around while traveling this is a nuisance.  Why couldn't they have used the standard micro-USB that many peripheral devices use, including the Nikon DSLRs?FYI, I replaced the Nikon AW-100 with a Canon S100, and I am quite impressed thus far.  The camera allows either JPEG or RAW images to be captured, the menus are easy to navigate and the battery life is much longer.  And while the S100 only has a 12 MP sensor, the image quality and detail is vastly superior to the AW-100's 16 MP sensor.  As an added bonus, the S100 is even slightly smaller than the AW-100.

Reviews.Title: I had to return it
Reviews.Author: Sherpa Jimmy
Reviews.Content: I had to return it because the camera was no good at all sorry, please read others review too so if you like it you can buy it. could be mine one was defective too.Amazone refunded my money next day thanks for them.

Reviews.Title: Nikon AW100
Reviews.Author: randee
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera and it will be for sale on Ebay within the week.  It is beyond awful.  How Nikon can soil their name by offering such an awful product is beyond me.  I have a Nikon D90 so assumed that this would be a good compact...WRONG.  Pictures are blurry unless you are photographing a statue!  The camera is slow as well.  I used it at one party, took 20 photos, 15 were blurry....selling the camera.  YUK!  Buy a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Poor Manual
Reviews.Author: Leoanrd Mayer
Reviews.Content: Nikon COOLPIX AW100 16 MP CMOS Waterproof Digital Camera with GPS and Full HD 1080p Video (Orange) Most disappointing is the manual.  For details about the memory card it refers you to page 21, but there is no page 21!

Reviews.Title: waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: raneepsachos
Reviews.Content: Coolpix cameras are fragile and quickly malfunction. I know from having Owned two. It's  really too bad because they have good features. Other Nikon cameras can be very nice like the digital SLRs but they are also fragile. A much better underwater point and shoot is the Olympus stylus 1050 sw. This little camera has no problems with leaking or condensation even in very warm water.  It's too bad about this coolpix because the color  is cool!

Reviews.Title: Poor customer relations
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: Great camera, but..........who can travel around the country side with a computor to view the CDrom viewer manual? And NIKON claims they are being ECO friendly by not wasting paper(THEIR PAPER AND THEIR MONEY!!!!! but its OK for me to use my ink,paper and money to print out the manual). Typical large business mentality. Returned the camera for another brand with a hard copy user manual.Nikon COOLPIX AW100 16 MP CMOS Waterproof Digital Camera with GPS and Full HD 1080p Video (Orange)

Reviews.Title: No Camera
Reviews.Author: Debrealtor
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera before my Friend and he has received it two days agomy has not even been shipped yet. My question is how do you determine who gets theirs first??

Reviews.Title: reclamo por envio
Reviews.Author: merys
Reviews.Content: Buenas noches realice una compra el día 08 de octubre y aun no han realizado el envió,necesito información al respecto.

Reviews.Title: Isn't GE sell same camera for $5???
Reviews.Author: K. Yi
Reviews.Content: Looks just same as my $5 GE camera, same spec.Are both camera made in same Chinese sweat shop, and badged differently at the end of assembly line, probably designed by uneducated Chinese minimum wager earners, who probably doesn't understand the meaning of "Water Proof."Who else but Nikon, sell hundred fold more than same camera sold in Wal-Mart for $5.

Reviews.Title: Thoughtless accessory
Reviews.Author: Georgia Athenian "ozzieaccie"
Reviews.Content: I unpacked our new CoolPix AW100 last night. With a GPS system, this is clearly a camera for the traveller. I was amazed that Nikon supplied a 2 meter cord for plugging into the battery charger. In contrast, the adaptor for my Lumix camera has the power plug built into the battery charger. How thoughtless!

Reviews.Title: SDXC compatibility is poor
Reviews.Author: Fred Boojum
Reviews.Content: This camera does not work with Lexar 128GB SDXC (class 10) cards. I tried several. This was a no-go for me as I wanted to use this on a long trip. It's really annoying because the specs say that it supports SDXC but apparently not very well.FYI, the Panasonic Lumix TS3 supports those 128GB cards perfectly.

Reviews.Title: I'm bringing this baby to my Asia Tour this month!
Reviews.Author: STRALLENT COM "STRALLENT"
Reviews.Content: I just bought the Nikon Coolpix AW100 with a 3 days shipping.After reading the reviews, I am convinced that this is the Camera that I should bring with me in my 1 month Vacation in a few Countries in Asia.I'll try to shoot as much Pictures and HD Videos as I can underwater, landscape, nights, cloudy, etc, etc. and use the GPS. But, one I thing I will guarantee you that I wont do, is to test it's 5 ft. Drop Shock-Proof feature...lol...As much as I love the word Shock-Proof (SHOCKPROOF(tm) my Company Name) I will avoid testing that feature(-;I will update my Review on this Camera when I come back next month from my vacation and post some Pictures & Videos here on Amazon and on my YouTube Channel: /SHOCKPROOFXSee you later for now...I'M ON VACATION. BABY!--STRALLENT (Sunday: 10-02-2011)

Reviews.Title: Lost Camera
Reviews.Author: Zimos
Reviews.Content: It's a nice camera, but I set it down somewhere and I can't seem to find it again. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Robby Gee "Rob"
Reviews.Content: Bought it in Aug 2011 as a dustproof camera, but when I actually used it snorkeling last week , it started acting up 15 minutes into the water....now the LCD screen has spots in it...I am going to return it to PANASONIC CANADA and see what they say....the BETTER repair it under warranty or I'll NEVER buy a PANASONIC product again....

ProductInfo.Features:
Water-proof, Shock-proof, Freeze-proof: ruggedly built for reliable and comfortable outdoor operation. Water-proof to a depth of 33 feet;3 inch LCD display
16 effective megapixel CMOS sensor ideal for low light shooting and fast operation,Zoom: Optical: 5x, Digital: 4x
Full HD (1080p) movie with stereo sound and movie-record button that enables one-touch recording (HDMI mini connector equipped)
Aperture: f/3.9 to f/4.8,Lens Focal Length : 5.0-25.0mm (angle of view equivalent to that of 28-140mm lens in 35mm (135) format)
Points of Interest (locations, landmarks, etc.) and location information (latitude and longitude) can be added to your photos
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon COOLPIX AW100 16 MP CMOS Waterproof Digital Camera with GPS and Full HD 1080p Video (Orange)
